title = Savage Messiah 
overview = The film fictionalizes the real relationship between French sculptor Henri Gaudier and Polish writer Sophie Brzeska, twenty years his senior, who came to Paris, she says, for its “creative atmosphere.” 
tagline = Every man has a dream that must be realised... a love that must come true... a life that must not stop. 
production compagnie = Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 44.7 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Every man has a dream that must be realised... a love that must come true... a life that must not stop. 

In the captivating film "Savage Messiah," based on true events, viewers are immersed in the fictionalized relationship between French sculptor Henri Gaudier and Polish writer Sophie Brzeska. Set against the backdrop of Paris, where Sophie seeks its creative atmosphere, the movie delves into their unconventional love story. As they navigate their bond with a significant age gap, every man's dream, love, and life aspirations are put to the test. Produced by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) and presented in English, "Savage Messiah" grossed an impressive $44.7 million, captivating audiences with its poignant tale of love and art. The tagline of the film is "Every man has a dream that must be realised... a love that must come true... a life that must not stop."

overview = Teacher and novelist François Bégaudeau plays a version of himself as he negotiates a year with his racially mixed students from a tough Parisian neighborhood. 
date of release = the 24 of September 2008 
average note = 6.9 
original language of the movie = French

production countrie = France 
Producer = Carole Scotta 
Director = Laurent Cantet 
revenue = 28.8 millions of dollars 
budget = 31.9 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 24 of September 2008 

In "The Class," a compelling drama directed by Laurent Cantet, teacher and novelist François Bégaudeau takes on the role of a teacher navigating a challenging year with his racially diverse students in a tough Parisian neighborhood. Released on September 24, 2008, the film is presented in its original language, French, and features a talented cast including François Bégaudeau, Franck Keïta, Esmeralda Ouertani, and Rachel Regulier. Produced in France by Carole Scotta, the movie garnered an average rating of 6.9. Despite its critical success, the film faced financial challenges, with a budget of 31.9 million dollars and a revenue of 28.8 million dollars.

title = I Love You Again 
overview = Boring businessman Larry Wilson recovers from amnesia and discovers he's really a con man...and loves his soon-to-be-ex wife. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : budget = 200.3 millions of dollars 

In the heartwarming comedy "I Love You Again," we follow the journey of Larry Wilson, a seemingly dull businessman who undergoes a life-altering experience. After recovering from amnesia, Larry is shocked to realize that he is not who he thought he was - in fact, he's a skilled con man! As he grapples with this newfound identity, Larry also comes to a surprising revelation - he is deeply in love with his soon-to-be-ex wife. With a mix of humor and heartfelt moments, this film explores the complexities of love, identity, and second chances.

Facts included in the description:
1. Larry Wilson is a boring businessman who recovers from amnesia.
2. Larry discovers he is actually a con man.
3. Larry loves his soon-to-be-ex wife.

title = Conan the Barbarian 
overview = A quest that begins as a personal vendetta for the fierce Cimmerian warrior soon turns into an epic battle against hulking rivals, horrific monsters, and impossible odds, as Conan (Jason Momoa) realizes he is the only hope of saving the great nations of Hyboria from an encroaching reign of supernatural evil. 

FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Enter an age undreamed of 

In the action-packed film "Conan the Barbarian," we follow the journey of the fierce Cimmerian warrior, Conan, portrayed by Jason Momoa. What starts as a personal vendetta quickly escalates into an epic battle against formidable foes, terrifying monsters, and insurmountable challenges. As Conan navigates through this treacherous world, he comes to a profound realization - he is the sole beacon of hope for the great nations of Hyboria, threatened by the looming presence of supernatural malevolence. Will Conan rise to the occasion and save Hyboria from this encroaching reign of evil, or will he succumb to the overwhelming odds stacked against him? Join Conan on his thrilling quest where bravery, strength, and determination are put to the ultimate test.

Facts included in the description:
- Title: Conan the Barbarian
- Main character: Conan, portrayed by Jason Momoa
- Plot: A personal vendetta turning into an epic battle to save the nations of Hyboria from supernatural evil

title = Indestructible Man 
overview = Scientific experiments accidentally revive an executed criminal and make him impervious to harm, allowing him to seek revenge on his former partners, and deal similarly with anyone else who gets in his way. 
cast = Lon Chaney Jr., Max Showalter, Marian Carr, Ross Elliott 
average note = 4.9 
production compagnie = C.G.K. Productions 
tagline = The Screen's 300,000 Volt SHOCKER! 
duration of the movie = 1h12 
budget = 272.1 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 194.8 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 24 of March 1956 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the fact mentioned is indeed the cast: lon chaney jr., max showalter, marian carr, and ross elliott, which matches the description provided.']
fact : cast = Lon Chaney Jr., Max Showalter, Marian Carr, Ross Elliott 

In a shocking turn of events, "Indestructible Man" tells the tale of a scientific experiment gone awry, bringing back to life an executed criminal who becomes impervious to harm. With a thirst for revenge on his former partners, played by Lon Chaney Jr., Max Showalter, and Marian Carr, this electrifying thriller takes viewers on a wild ride. As the Indestructible Man, portrayed by Lon Chaney Jr., seeks vengeance, no one is safe from his wrath, as Ross Elliott's character soon discovers. With a tagline that promises a 300,000 Volt SHOCKER, this C.G.K. Productions film keeps audiences on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 12-minute runtime. Set in the United States of America and originally released on March 24, 1956, this English-language production captivates viewers with its intense action and suspense. Despite its impressive $272.1 million budget, the film raked in $194.8 million in revenue, proving to be a formidable force in the world of cinema. 

The movie has an average note of 4.9.

title = Dream House 
overview = Publisher, Will Atenton quits a lucrative job in New York to relocate his wife, Libby and their daughters to a quaint town in New England. However, as they settle into their home the Atentons discover that a woman and her children were murdered there, and the surviving husband is the town's prime suspect. With help from a neighbor who was close to the murdered family, Will pieces together a horrifying chain of events. 
Director = Jim Sheridan 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Jim Sheridan 

In the chilling thriller "Dream House," directed by Jim Sheridan, Will Atenton makes a life-changing decision to leave his successful job in New York and move his family to a peaceful town in New England. However, their idyllic new home holds a dark secret - a previous family was brutally murdered there, and the husband is suspected of the crime. With the help of a neighbor connected to the tragedy, Will unravels a terrifying mystery that threatens his own family's safety. As the past haunts the present, Will must confront the sinister truth lurking within the walls of his dream house. Will Atenton is portrayed by a well-known actor.

In the chilling thriller "Dream House," directed by Jim Sheridan, Will Atenton makes a life-changing decision to leave his successful job in New York and move his family to a peaceful town in New England. However, their idyllic new home holds a dark secret - a previous family was brutally murdered there, and the husband is suspected of the crime. With the help of a neighbor connected to the tragedy, Will unravels a terrifying mystery that threatens his own family's safety. As the past haunts the present, Will must confront the sinister truth lurking within the walls of his dream house. Will Atenton is portrayed by a well-known actor.

title = Hell to Eternity 
overview = Based on the story about Guy Gabaldon, a Los Angeles Hispanic boy raised in the 1930s by a Japanese-American foster family. After Pearl Harbor, his foster family is interned at the Manzanar camp for Japanese Americans, while he enlists in the Marines, where his ability to speak Japanese becomes a vital asset. During the Battle of Saipan, he convinces 800 Japanese to surrender after their general commits suicide. 
Director = Phil Karlson 
date of release = the 1 of August 1960 
average note = 10.0 
cast = Jeffrey Hunter, David Janssen, Sessue Hayakawa, Vic Damone 
duration of the movie = 2h11 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : Director = Phil Karlson 

In "Hell to Eternity," directed by Phil Karlson and released on the 1st of August 1960, viewers are taken on a gripping journey following the remarkable true story of Guy Gabaldon. Raised by a Japanese-American foster family in 1930s Los Angeles, Gabaldon's unique background becomes a crucial asset when he enlists in the Marines after the attack on Pearl Harbor. Portrayed by Jeffrey Hunter, Gabaldon's ability to speak Japanese proves invaluable during the Battle of Saipan, where he successfully convinces 800 Japanese soldiers to surrender. Alongside a talented cast including David Janssen, Sessue Hayakawa, and Vic Damone, this 2-hour and 11-minute film showcases courage, loyalty, and the power of communication in the midst of war. With an exceptional average rating of 10.0, "Hell to Eternity" is a must-watch for those who appreciate historical dramas with a touch of heroism.

With an exceptional average rating of 10.0, "Hell to Eternity" is a must-watch for those who appreciate historical dramas with a touch of heroism.

title = Natural Born Killers 
overview = Two victims of traumatized childhoods become lovers and psychopathic serial murderers irresponsibly glorified by the mass media. 
tagline = The Media Made Them Superstars. 
Producer = Jane Hamsher 
date of release = the 25 of August 1994 
budget = 34.0 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.9 
Director = Oliver Stone 
duration of the movie = 1h59 
cast = Woody Harrelson, Juliette Lewis, Robert Downey Jr., Tommy Lee Jones 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 50.3 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Regency Enterprises 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = The Media Made Them Superstars. 

In the intense and provocative film "Natural Born Killers," directed by Oliver Stone and produced by Jane Hamsher, we are plunged into the twisted love story of two individuals who, scarred by their traumatic pasts, evolve into a pair of psychopathic serial killers. Portrayed by the stellar cast including Woody Harrelson, Juliette Lewis, Robert Downey Jr., and Tommy Lee Jones, their heinous acts are irresponsibly glorified by the mass media, leading to their unsettling rise to stardom. As the tagline suggests, "The Media Made Them Superstars," showcasing the dark side of fame and sensationalism. Released on the 25th of August 1994 in the United States of America, the film garnered an average rating of 6.9 and grossed $50.3 million in revenue against a budget of $34.0 million. With a runtime of 1 hour and 59 minutes, "Natural Born Killers" delves deep into the disturbing consequences of media obsession and societal fascination with violence. The original language of the movie is English, and the production company behind it is Regency Enterprises.

['correct']

title = Anjaana Anjaani 
overview = Akash (Ranbir Kapoor) and Kiara (Priyanka Chopra) are trying to find luck in their life after several failed attempts to be successful in their careers and in love. Fed up, they both decide to commit suicide by jumping off a bridge. However, both land up on the same bridge at the same time. 
cast = Priyanka Chopra, Ranbir Kapoor, Vishal Malhotra, Pooja Kumar 
duration of the movie = 2h31 
budget = 6.4 millions of dollars 
Director = Siddharth Anand 
tagline = All the greatest love stories...are between strangers 
average note = 6.1 
production countrie = India 
Producer = Sajid Nadiadwala 
date of release = the 24 of September 2010 
revenue = 5.9 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Eros Entertainment 
original language of the movie = Hindi 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Priyanka Chopra, Ranbir Kapoor, Vishal Malhotra, Pooja Kumar 

In the romantic drama "Anjaana Anjaani," Akash (Ranbir Kapoor) and Kiara (Priyanka Chopra) are two individuals who, after facing numerous setbacks in their careers and love lives, decide to end it all by jumping off a bridge. However, fate has other plans as they both end up on the same bridge at the same time. Directed by Siddharth Anand and produced by Sajid Nadiadwala, this Indian film explores the unexpected connection that forms between two strangers contemplating the same drastic decision. With a budget of 6.4 million dollars, the movie was released on September 24, 2010, and despite generating a revenue of 5.9 million dollars, it received an average rating of 6.1. Join Akash and Kiara on their journey to find luck and love in this poignant tale where strangers' paths intertwine in the most unexpected way.

The cast includes Priyanka Chopra, Ranbir Kapoor, Vishal Malhotra, and Pooja Kumar. The tagline of the movie is "All the greatest love stories...are between strangers." The production company behind the film is Eros Entertainment, and it was primarily filmed in India. The original language of the movie is Hindi, and it has a duration of 2 hours and 31 minutes. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : duration of the movie = 2h31 

In the romantic drama "Anjaana Anjaani," Akash (Ranbir Kapoor) and Kiara (Priyanka Chopra) are two individuals who, after facing numerous setbacks in their careers and love lives, decide to end it all by jumping off a bridge. However, fate has other plans as they both end up on the same bridge at the same time. Directed by Siddharth Anand and produced by Sajid Nadiadwala, this Indian film explores the unexpected connection that forms between two strangers contemplating the same drastic decision. With a budget of 6.4 million dollars, the movie was released on September 24, 2010, and despite generating a revenue of 5.9 million dollars, it received an average rating of 6.1. Join Akash and Kiara on their journey to find luck and love in this poignant tale where strangers' paths intertwine in the most unexpected way.

The cast includes Priyanka Chopra, Ranbir Kapoor, Vishal Malhotra, and Pooja Kumar. The tagline of the movie is "All the greatest love stories...are between strangers." The production company behind the film is Eros Entertainment, and it was primarily filmed in India. The original language of the movie is Hindi, and it has a duration of 2 hours and 31 minutes.

title = Micmacs 
overview = A man and his friends come up with an intricate and original plan to destroy two big weapons manufacturers.  Avid movie-watcher and video store clerk Bazil has had his life all but ruined by weapons of war. His father was killed by a landmine in Morocco and one fateful night a stray bullet from a nearby shootout embeds itself in his skull, leaving him on the verge of instantaneous death. Losing his job and his home, Bazil wanders the streets until he meets Slammer, a pardoned convict who introduces him to a band of eccentric junkyard dealers including Calculator, a math expert and statistician, Buster, a record-holder in human cannonball feats, Tiny Pete, an artistic craftsman of automatons, and Elastic Girl, a sassy contortionist. When chance reveals to Bazil the two weapons manufacturers responsible for building the instruments of his destruction, he constructs a complex scheme for revenge that his newfound family is all too happy to help set in motion. 

FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = French 

In the movie "Micmacs," Bazil, a movie enthusiast and former video store clerk, finds his life turned upside down by the devastating impact of weapons of war. After a series of tragic events, Bazil teams up with a group of quirky junkyard dealers, each with their own unique skills and talents. When Bazil uncovers the identities of the two weapons manufacturers responsible for his misfortunes, he hatches an elaborate plan for revenge with the help of his newfound eccentric family. As they set their intricate scheme in motion, filled with humor and heart, Bazil and his team embark on a mission to take down the big arms dealers and seek justice for the harm they have caused. The group includes Slammer, a pardoned convict, Calculator, a math expert and statistician, Buster, a record-holder in human cannonball feats, Tiny Pete, an artistic craftsman of automatons, and Elastic Girl, a sassy contortionist. 
 
 
FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct']

title = Pin 
overview = A doctor has a lifelike, anatomically-correct medical dummy, with muscles and organs visible through its clear skin, named Pin (after Pinocchio). Via ventriloquism, Pin explains bodily functions in a way kids can relate to. When the over-strict doctor and his wife are killed in a car crash, his son (Leon) transfers his alter-ego into Pin, whom he always believed was alive. He starts using Pin as an excuse to over-protect his sister (Ursula) from admirers and deflect unwanted intrusions, even to the extent of committing murder. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : Producer = Rene Malo 

title = Pin 
overview = In the chilling movie "Pin," a doctor's son, Leon, forms a deep connection with a lifelike medical dummy named Pin, who he believes is alive. After a tragic accident claims the lives of his parents, Leon transfers his alter-ego into Pin, using ventriloquism to communicate through him. As Leon becomes increasingly obsessed with Pin, he uses him as a tool to over-protect his sister Ursula and commit heinous acts to keep her safe. Through Pin, Leon delves into the dark depths of his psyche, blurring the lines between reality and fantasy in a twisted tale of love and manipulation.

Facts:
1. A doctor has a lifelike, anatomically-correct medical dummy named Pin, with muscles and organs visible through its clear skin.
2. Pin explains bodily functions in a way kids can relate to via ventriloquism.
3. Pin is named after Pinocchio.
4. The doctor and his wife are killed in a car crash.
5. Leon uses Pin as an excuse to over-protect his sister Ursula from admirers and deflect unwanted intrusions.
6. Leon transfers his alter-ego into Pin after his parents' death.
7. Leon always believed Pin was alive.
8. Leon commits murder using Pin as a tool. 
 
 
FP  -  FalsePositive
['correctthe average note mentioned in the fact matches with 6.6, which is also stated in the description.']
fact : average note = 6.6

overview = In the chilling movie "Pin," a doctor's son, Leon, forms a deep connection with a lifelike medical dummy named Pin, who he believes is alive. After a tragic accident claims the lives of his parents, Leon transfers his alter-ego into Pin, using ventriloquism to communicate through him. As Leon becomes increasingly obsessed with Pin, he uses him as a tool to over-protect his sister Ursula and commit heinous acts to keep her safe. Through Pin, Leon delves into the dark depths of his psyche, blurring the lines between reality and fantasy in a twisted tale of love and manipulation.

Facts:
1. A doctor has a lifelike, anatomically-correct medical dummy named Pin, with muscles and organs visible through its clear skin.
2. Pin explains bodily functions in a way kids can relate to via ventriloquism.
3. Pin is named after Pinocchio.
4. The doctor and his wife are killed in a car crash.
5. Leon uses Pin as an excuse to over-protect his sister Ursula from admirers and deflect unwanted intrusions.
6. Leon transfers his alter-ego into Pin after his parents' death.
7. Leon always believed Pin was alive.
8. Leon commits murder using Pin as a tool.

title = Dirty Grandpa 
overview = Jason Kelly is one week away from marrying his boss's uber-controlling daughter, putting him on the fast track for a partnership at the law firm. However, when the straight-laced Jason is tricked into driving his foul-mouthed grandfather, Dick, to Daytona for spring break, his pending nuptials are suddenly in jeopardy. Between riotous frat parties, bar fights, and an epic night of karaoke, Dick is on a quest to live his life to the fullest and bring Jason along for the ride. 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 21 of January 2016 
average note = 5.7 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 11.5 millions of dollars 
Director = Dan Mazer 
tagline = This is Jason. He's a little worried about his grandpa. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the uproarious comedy "Dirty Grandpa," Jason Kelly finds himself in a hilarious predicament just a week before his high-stakes wedding to his boss's daughter. When he unwittingly becomes the chauffeur for his crude and outspoken grandfather, Dick, on a wild trip to Daytona for spring break, Jason's carefully planned future is thrown into chaos. Amidst wild frat parties, rowdy bar brawls, and a memorable night of karaoke, Dick is determined to seize the day and show Jason how to truly live life to the fullest. Directed by Dan Mazer, this English-language film was released on January 21, 2016, in the United States of America. With a budget of 11.5 million dollars and an average rating of 5.7, "Dirty Grandpa" promises a raucous and unforgettable journey filled with laughter and unexpected life lessons. And remember, as the tagline suggests, "This is Jason. He's a little worried about his grandpa."

title = One from the Heart 
overview = Hank and Frannie don't seem to be able to live together anymore. After a five-year relationship, lustful and dreamy Fanny leaves down-to-earth Hank on the anniversary of their relationship. Each one of them meets their dream mate, but as bright as they may seem, they are but a stage of lights and colours. Will true love prevail over a seemingly glamorous passion? Welcome to Coppola's Broadway-like romantic musical. 
Director = Francis Ford Coppola 
production compagnie = Zoetrope Studios 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 181.2 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h47 
Producer = Gray Frederickson 
cast = Teri Garr, Frederic Forrest, Raúl Juliá, Lainie Kazan 
date of release = the 12 of February 1982 
tagline = The Francis Coppola classic that audiences never had the chance to see [re-release] 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 5.6 
budget = 115.8 millions of dollars 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : Director = Francis Ford Coppola 

In "One from the Heart," directed by Francis Ford Coppola and produced by Zoetrope Studios, viewers are taken on a journey through the tumultuous relationship of Hank and Frannie. After five years together, Fanny leaves Hank on their anniversary, leading them both to encounter their dream partners. However, amidst the bright lights and colors of their new relationships, the question remains: will true love conquer all? Set in a Broadway-like romantic musical atmosphere, the film features a stellar cast including Teri Garr, Frederic Forrest, Raúl Juliá, and Lainie Kazan. Released on February 12, 1982, with a tagline teasing its re-release, this English-language movie runs for 1 hour and 47 minutes. Despite its budget of $115.8 million, "One from the Heart" managed to gross $181.2 million at the box office, earning an average rating of 5.6. The movie was produced in the United States of America and the producer was Gray Frederickson.

In "One from the Heart," directed by Francis Ford Coppola and produced by Zoetrope Studios, viewers are taken on a journey through the tumultuous relationship of Hank and Frannie. After five years together, Fanny leaves Hank on their anniversary, leading them both to encounter their dream partners. However, amidst the bright lights and colors of their new relationships, the question remains: will true love conquer all? Set in a Broadway-like romantic musical atmosphere, the film features a stellar cast including Teri Garr, Frederic Forrest, Raúl Juliá, and Lainie Kazan. Released on February 12, 1982, with a tagline teasing its re-release, this English-language movie runs for 1 hour and 47 minutes. Despite its budget of $115.8 million, "One from the Heart" managed to gross $181.2 million at the box office, earning an average rating of 5.6. The movie was produced in the United States of America and the producer was Gray Frederickson.

title = Baby Mama 
overview = A successful, single businesswoman who dreams of having a baby discovers she is infertile and hires a working class woman to be her unlikely surrogate. 
tagline = Would you put your eggs...in this basket? 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Would you put your eggs...in this basket? 

In "Baby Mama," a successful single businesswoman faces a heartbreaking realization when she discovers she is infertile. Determined to fulfill her dream of motherhood, she decides to take a unique approach by hiring a working-class woman to be her surrogate. As the two women from different worlds navigate the complexities of pregnancy and motherhood, they form an unlikely bond that challenges their preconceived notions about family and friendship. With the tagline "Would you put your eggs...in this basket?" this comedy explores the unconventional journey of two women brought together by the miracle of life.

title = The Tuxedo 
overview = Cabbie-turned-chauffeur Jimmy Tong learns there is really only one rule when you work for playboy millionaire Clark Devlin : Never touch Devlin's prized tuxedo. But when Devlin is temporarily put out of commission in an explosive accident, Jimmy puts on the tux and soon discovers that this extraordinary suit may be more black belt than black tie. Paired with a partner as inexperienced as he is, Jimmy becomes an unwitting secret agent. 
cast = Jackie Chan, Jennifer Love Hewitt, Jason Isaacs, Debi Mazar 
date of release = the 27 of September 2002 
revenue = 245.7 millions of dollars 
Director = Kevin Donovan 
production compagnie = DreamWorks SKG 
Producer = Adam Schroeder 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Jackie Chan, Jennifer Love Hewitt, Jason Isaacs, Debi Mazar 

In "The Tuxedo," cabbie-turned-chauffeur Jimmy Tong finds himself in a high-stakes situation when he puts on his playboy millionaire employer Clark Devlin's prized tuxedo after Devlin is incapacitated. What Jimmy soon realizes is that this seemingly ordinary tuxedo is anything but - it grants him extraordinary abilities that turn him into an accidental secret agent. Teamed up with an equally inexperienced partner, Jimmy navigates a world of espionage and danger. Starring Jackie Chan, Jennifer Love Hewitt, Jason Isaacs, and Debi Mazar, this action-packed comedy, directed by Kevin Donovan and produced by Adam Schroeder, was released on September 27, 2002, under the production company DreamWorks SKG. With a whopping revenue of 245.7 million dollars, "The Tuxedo" is a thrilling blend of humor, martial arts, and espionage. And remember, in this movie, the tuxedo itself is the real star of the show.

['correct']
fact : date of release = the 27 of September 2002

title = Gold 
overview = Kenny Wells, a modern-day prospector, hustler, and dreamer, is desperate for a lucky break. Left with few options, Wells teams up with an equally luckless geologist to execute a grandiose, last-ditch effort: to find gold deep in the uncharted jungle of Indonesia. 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Living Films 
tagline = Prove 'em all wrong 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 6.6 
cast = Matthew McConaughey, Bryce Dallas Howard, Edgar Ramírez, Timothy Simons 
Producer = Michael Nozik 
Director = Stephen Gaghan 
budget = 20.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct. the fact mentioned is the production country being the united states of america, which matches the description provided.']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the thrilling movie "Gold," directed by Stephen Gaghan and produced by Michael Nozik, viewers are taken on a wild ride with Kenny Wells, a determined modern-day prospector portrayed by Matthew McConaughey. Desperate for a lucky break, Wells teams up with a geologist to embark on a grandiose mission to find gold in the uncharted jungles of Indonesia. As they face numerous challenges and obstacles, including doubters and skeptics, the tagline "Prove 'em all wrong" resonates throughout their journey. With a stellar cast including Bryce Dallas Howard, Edgar Ramírez, and Timothy Simons, this American production by Living Films is a testament to the relentless pursuit of dreams against all odds. Despite its $20.0 million budget, the film has garnered an average rating of 6.6, showcasing the highs and lows of the quest for fortune and glory.

The movie "Gold" was filmed in the United States of America and is originally in English. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Living Films 

In the thrilling movie "Gold," directed by Stephen Gaghan and produced by Michael Nozik, viewers are taken on a wild ride with Kenny Wells, a determined modern-day prospector portrayed by Matthew McConaughey. Desperate for a lucky break, Wells teams up with a geologist to embark on a grandiose mission to find gold in the uncharted jungles of Indonesia. As they face numerous challenges and obstacles, including doubters and skeptics, the tagline "Prove 'em all wrong" resonates throughout their journey. With a stellar cast including Bryce Dallas Howard, Edgar Ramírez, and Timothy Simons, this American production by Living Films is a testament to the relentless pursuit of dreams against all odds. Despite its $20.0 million budget, the film has garnered an average rating of 6.6, showcasing the highs and lows of the quest for fortune and glory.

The movie "Gold" was filmed in the United States of America and is originally in English.

title = Ultramarines: A Warhammer 40,000 Movie 
overview = A squad of Ultramarines answer a distress call from an Imperial Shrine World. A full Company of Imperial Fists was stationed there, but there is no answer from them. The squad investigates to find out what has happened there. 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = In the grim darkness of the far future there is only war 
cast = Terence Stamp, John Hurt, Sean Pertwee, Steven Waddington 
budget = 5.3 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United Kingdom 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the English-language film "Ultramarines: A Warhammer 40,000 Movie," a squad of Ultramarines, including notable actors Terence Stamp, John Hurt, Sean Pertwee, and Steven Waddington, respond to a distress call from an Imperial Shrine World. The planet was previously occupied by a Company of Imperial Fists, but all communication has ceased. As the squad delves into the mystery, they uncover the grim reality of a universe consumed by eternal warfare. With a budget of 5.3 million dollars, this production from the United Kingdom immerses viewers in the relentless battles and dark atmosphere of the Warhammer 40,000 universe. The tagline "In the grim darkness of the far future there is only war" sets the tone for the intense journey that awaits both the characters and the audience.

title = Save the Date 
overview = After breaking up with her boyfriend, a bookstore manager resists a seemingly perfect guy's attempts to woo her. 
duration of the movie = 1h38 
budget = 258.4 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.1 
Director = Michael Mohan 
Producer = Jordan Horowitz 
production compagnie = Instinctive Film 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h38 

In "Save the Date," directed by Michael Mohan and produced by Jordan Horowitz, we follow the story of a bookstore manager who, after a breakup, finds herself fending off the advances of a seemingly perfect suitor. As she navigates the complexities of romance, viewers are taken on a 1 hour and 38-minute journey filled with twists and turns. With a budget of a whopping 258.4 million dollars, this film delivers a visually stunning experience that keeps audiences engaged throughout. The movie, produced by Instinctive Film, has received an average rating of 6.1, making it a must-watch for fans of romantic dramas.

title = Dead End 
overview = Christmas Eve. On his way to his in-laws with his family, Frank Harrington decides to try a shortcut, for the first time in 20 years. It turns out to be the biggest mistake of his life. 
production countrie = France 
tagline = Read the signs. 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : production countrie = France 

In the French-produced thriller "Dead End," Frank Harrington embarks on a fateful Christmas Eve journey with his family to visit his in-laws in France. Against his better judgment, Frank decides to take a shortcut for the first time in two decades, a decision that proves to be disastrous. As the night unfolds, the family finds themselves trapped in a series of eerie and unsettling events along a desolate road. With the ominous tagline "Read the signs," "Dead End" delivers a suspenseful and chilling tale of a shortcut gone horribly wrong. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Read the signs.

Against his better judgment, Frank decides to take a shortcut for the first time in two decades, a decision that proves to be disastrous. As the night unfolds, the family finds themselves trapped in a series of eerie and unsettling events along a desolate road. With the ominous tagline "Read the signs," "Dead End" delivers a suspenseful and chilling tale of a shortcut gone horribly wrong.

title = The Crazies 
overview = Citizens of a small town are infected by a biological weapon that causes its victims to become violently insane. As uninfected citizens struggle to survive, the military readies its own response. 
Director = George A. Romero 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = George A. Romero 

In "The Crazies," directed by the legendary George A. Romero, a small town is thrown into chaos when its citizens are infected by a deadly biological weapon that drives them to madness. As the infected become violently insane, the uninfected residents must fight for their survival against their own neighbors. Meanwhile, the military, led by Sheriff David Dutton, played by Timothy Olyphant, prepares to intervene, escalating the tension and danger to new heights. Will anyone make it out of this nightmarish situation alive?

duration of the movie = 2h15

revenue = 59.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Emperor Motion Pictures 
average note = 7.5 
original language of the movie = Chinese 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : date of release = the 22 of July 2010 

In 2010, "Aftershock" was released, a gripping film directed by Feng Xiaogang and produced by Chen Kuo-Fu. The movie, with a runtime of 2 hours and 15 minutes, is based on the tragic Tangshan Earthquake of 1976, which claimed the lives of 240,000 people. Starring Xu Fan, Zhang Jingchu, Chen Dao-Ming, and Li Chen, the film tells a powerful story in its original Chinese language. With a tagline that reads "23 seconds, 32 years," "Aftershock" managed to earn an impressive $59.0 million in revenue and received an average rating of 7.5. Produced by Emperor Motion Pictures, this movie is a poignant reminder of the devastating impact of natural disasters.

The movie, with a runtime of 2 hours and 15 minutes, is based on the tragic Tangshan Earthquake of 1976, which claimed the lives of 240,000 people. Starring Xu Fan, Zhang Jingchu, Chen Dao-Ming, and Li Chen, the film tells a powerful story in its original Chinese language. With a tagline that reads "23 seconds, 32 years," "Aftershock" managed to earn an impressive $59.0 million in revenue and received an average rating of 7.5. Produced by Emperor Motion Pictures, this movie is a poignant reminder of the devastating impact of natural disasters.

title = Hiroshima Mon Amour 
overview = A French actress filming an anti-war film in Hiroshima has an affair with a married Japanese architect as they share their differing perspectives on war. 
tagline = From the measureless depths of a woman's emotions... 
budget = 237.3 millions of dollars 
revenue = 116.8 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = French 
Director = Alain Resnais 
average note = 8.0 
Producer = Anatole Dauman 
production compagnie = Pathé Entertainment 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : tagline = From the measureless depths of a woman's emotions... 

In the mesmerizing film "Hiroshima Mon Amour," directed by Alain Resnais, a French actress finds herself entangled in a passionate affair with a married Japanese architect while filming an anti-war movie in Hiroshima. Against the backdrop of the devastating effects of war, they share their contrasting perspectives on the subject, delving into the measureless depths of a woman's emotions. Produced by Anatole Dauman under the banner of Pathé Entertainment, this French-language masterpiece captivates audiences with its poignant exploration of love and conflict. With an average rating of 8.0, the film showcases the complexities of human relationships amidst the haunting shadows of history. The movie had a budget of 237.3 million dollars and generated a revenue of 116.8 million dollars. The original language of the movie is French. The tagline of the film is "From the measureless depths of a woman's emotions."

title = Grosse Pointe Blank 
overview = Martin Blank is a freelance hitman who starts to develop a conscience, which causes him to muff a couple of routine assignments. On the advice of his secretary and his psychiatrist, he attends his 10th year High School reunion in Grosse Pointe, Michigan. 
duration of the movie = 1h47 
cast = John Cusack, Minnie Driver, Dan Aykroyd, Joan Cusack 
production compagnie = Caravan Pictures 
budget = 84.9 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
Producer = Susan Arnold 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 28.1 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.9 
Director = George Armitage 
tagline = Even a hit man deserves a second shot. 
date of release = the 11 of April 1997 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h47 

In the action-comedy film "Grosse Pointe Blank," we follow the story of Martin Blank, a skilled hitman portrayed by John Cusack, who begins to question his profession and botches a few of his usual assignments. Encouraged by his secretary and psychiatrist, he decides to attend his 10th-year high school reunion in Grosse Pointe, Michigan. Directed by George Armitage and produced by Caravan Pictures, this movie has a runtime of 1 hour and 47 minutes. The star-studded cast includes Minnie Driver, Dan Aykroyd, and Joan Cusack. With a budget of 84.9 million dollars, the film managed to gross 28.1 million dollars at the box office. Released on April 11, 1997, in the United States, "Grosse Pointe Blank" delivers a blend of action, humor, and introspection, earning an average rating of 6.9. The tagline "Even a hitman deserves a second shot" encapsulates the essence of this unique and entertaining film. The production company behind the movie is Caravan Pictures, and the producer is Susan Arnold. The original language of the movie is English.

title = FairyTale: A True Story 
overview = Two children in 1917 take a photograph, believed by some to be the first scientific evidence of the existence of fairies. Based on a true story 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
Director = Charles Sturridge 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "FairyTale: A True Story," directed by Charles Sturridge, two children in 1917 capture a photograph that some believe to be the first scientific evidence of fairies' existence. Set in the United Kingdom and based on a true story, this English-language film explores the magical and mysterious world of fairies through the eyes of these young photographers. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : production countrie = United Kingdom 

In "FairyTale: A True Story," directed by Charles Sturridge, two children in 1917 capture a photograph that some believe to be the first scientific evidence of fairies' existence. Set in the United Kingdom and based on a true story, this English-language film explores the magical and mysterious world of fairies through the eyes of these young photographers.

title = Sabotage 
overview = In "Sabotage", Arnold Schwarzenegger leads an elite DEA task force that takes on the world's deadliest drug cartels. When the team successfully executes a high-stakes raid on a cartel safe house, they think their work is done - until, one-by-one, the team members mysteriously start to be eliminated. As the body count rises, everyone is a suspect. 
date of release = the 28 of March 2014 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 17.5 millions of dollars 
Director = David Ayer 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 28 of March 2014 

In the action-packed thriller "Sabotage", released on the 28th of March 2014, Arnold Schwarzenegger leads an elite DEA task force in a high-stakes battle against the world's deadliest drug cartels. Directed by David Ayer, the movie unfolds as the team successfully raids a cartel safe house, only to be faced with a series of mysterious and deadly eliminations among its members. With a revenue of 17.5 million dollars, this English-language film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats as the body count rises and suspicion falls on everyone.

title = Showtime 
overview = A spoof of buddy cop movies where two very different cops are forced to team up on a new reality based T.V. cop show. 
production compagnie = Village Roadshow Pictures 
tagline = Lights. Camera. Aggravation. 
cast = Robert De Niro, Rachael Harris, Eddie Murphy, Zaid Farid 
date of release = the 14 of March 2002 
budget = 85.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Tom Dey 
revenue = 77.7 millions of dollars 
Producer = Jane Rosenthal 
duration of the movie = 1h35 
average note = 5.3 
production countrie = Australia 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Village Roadshow Pictures 

In "Showtime," directed by Tom Dey and produced by Jane Rosenthal under Village Roadshow Pictures, audiences are taken on a hilarious ride through the world of buddy cop movies. Starring Robert De Niro, Rachael Harris, Eddie Murphy, and Zaid Farid, this film follows two vastly different cops who are reluctantly paired up to star in a new reality-based TV cop show. With a budget of 85.0 million dollars, the movie was released on the 14th of March 2002 and filmed in Australia. The tagline "Lights. Camera. Aggravation." perfectly captures the chaos that ensues as the mismatched duo navigates their way through the show. Despite its star-studded cast and high production value, "Showtime" garnered mixed reviews with an average rating of 5.3. The movie grossed 77.7 million dollars at the box office, proving that sometimes, even the best-laid plans can go awry when the cameras start rolling.

title = Maid to Order 
overview = Spoiled Jessie Montgomery, whose wild behavior and spending excesses cause her well-meaning but exasperated millionaire father Charles to wish he never had her, is visited by fairy godmother Stella. In an effort to save Jessie, Stella casts a spell which causes Charles to no longer have a daughter. Jessie, now penniless and without a friend, must take a maid's job to earn a living, and hopefully to learn her lesson. 
production compagnie = Vista Organization 
date of release = the 10 of July 1987 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct.']
fact : production compagnie = Vista Organization 

In the whimsical comedy "Maid to Order," we meet the spoiled Jessie Montgomery, whose lavish lifestyle pushes her father, millionaire Charles, to his breaking point. Enter fairy godmother Stella, who intervenes by casting a spell that erases Jessie from Charles' life. Now, stripped of her wealth and connections, Jessie must navigate life as a maid to make ends meet and discover the true value of hard work. Released on July 10, 1987, by Vista Organization, this film is a delightful tale of redemption and self-discovery. 

Facts included in the final description:
- Spoiled Jessie Montgomery
- Jessie's wild behavior and spending excesses
- Jessie's father is a millionaire named Charles
- Fairy godmother Stella casts a spell to erase Jessie from Charles' life
- Jessie becomes penniless and friendless
- Jessie takes a maid's job to earn a living
- The film is a whimsical comedy
- Released on July 10, 1987
- Produced by Vista Organization

- Released on July 10, 1987
- Produced by Vista Organization

fact : duration of the movie = 1h33 

In the whimsical comedy "Maid to Order," we meet the spoiled Jessie Montgomery, whose lavish lifestyle pushes her father, millionaire Charles, to his breaking point. Enter fairy godmother Stella, who intervenes by casting a spell that erases Jessie from Charles' life. Now, stripped of her wealth and connections, Jessie must navigate life as a maid to make ends meet and discover the true value of hard work. Released on July 10, 1987, by Vista Organization, this film is a delightful tale of redemption and self-discovery.

title = Close Range 
overview = A rogue soldier turned outlaw is thrust into a relentless fight with a corrupt sheriff, his obedient deputies, and a dangerous drug cartel in order to protect his sister and her young daughter. 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Ehud Bleiberg 
cast = Scott Adkins, Nick Chinlund, Caitlin Keats, Jake La Botz 
budget = 27.7 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h20 
date of release = the 11 of December 2015 
revenue = 96.3 millions of dollars 
average note = 5.1 
production compagnie = Bleiberg Entertainment 
Director = Isaac Florentine 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "Close Range," a former soldier turned outlaw finds himself in a dangerous battle against a corrupt sheriff, his loyal deputies, and a ruthless drug cartel to safeguard his sister and her young daughter. Directed by Isaac Florentine and produced by Ehud Bleiberg under Bleiberg Entertainment, the film features a stellar cast including Scott Adkins, Nick Chinlund, Caitlin Keats, and Jake La Botz. With a budget of 27.7 million dollars, the English-language movie was released on December 11, 2015, in the United States of America. Despite receiving an average rating of 5.1, "Close Range" managed to generate a revenue of 96.3 million dollars in just 1 hour and 20 minutes of intense action and suspense.

title = All I Desire 
overview = In 1910, a wayward mother re-visits the family she deserted. 
average note = 7.7 
cast = Barbara Stanwyck, Richard Carlson, Lyle Bettger, Marcia Henderson 
budget = 52.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Universal International Pictures (UI) 
duration of the movie = 1h19 
revenue = 286.3 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 7.7 

In "All I Desire," set in 1910, a mother who had once abandoned her family unexpectedly returns home, stirring up old emotions and secrets. Starring Barbara Stanwyck, Richard Carlson, Lyle Bettger, and Marcia Henderson, this poignant drama delves into the complexities of family dynamics and the consequences of past decisions. Produced by Universal International Pictures (UI), the film runs for 1 hour and 19 minutes, captivating audiences with its emotional depth and compelling performances. With an average rating of 7.7, "All I Desire" not only resonates with viewers but also proves to be a commercial success, grossing an impressive $286.3 million against its $52.0 million budget.

title = Brain of Blood 
overview = Amir, the benevolent ruler of Kalid, is dying, but there is hope. Freshly deceased, he is flown to the United States where Dr. Trenton transplants his brain into the body of a simpleton in a classic "assistant got the wrong kind of body" plot line. Dr. Trenton has a few nefarious plot twists of his own in mind, and then there's the thing with the dwarf and the women chained in the basement. It's up to Amir's friend Bob and wife Tracey to try and salvage this tale. 
tagline = A Blood-dripping Brain Transplant turns a Maniac into a Monster... 
revenue = 242.2 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 1 of August 1971 
budget = 290.2 millions of dollars 
Director = Al Adamson 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Grant Williams, Kent Taylor, Regina Carrol, Vicki Volante 
Producer = Al Adamson 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = A Blood-dripping Brain Transplant turns a Maniac into a Monster... 

In the chilling horror film "Brain of Blood," ruler Amir of Kalid faces imminent death until a risky brain transplant is performed by Dr. Trenton in the United States. However, things take a sinister turn as the brain is placed into the body of a simpleton, setting off a chain of malevolent events orchestrated by Dr. Trenton. Amidst a twisted plot involving a dwarf and captive women, Amir's friend Bob and wife Tracey must navigate a web of deceit to save the day. With a tagline promising a blood-dripping brain transplant that transforms a maniac into a monster, this film delves into the dark realms of science gone awry. Directed by Al Adamson and featuring a stellar cast including Grant Williams, Kent Taylor, Regina Carrol, and Vicki Volante, "Brain of Blood" was released on August 1, 1971, in the United States, grossing a staggering $242.2 million at the box office despite its $290.2 million budget. The production country of the movie is the United States of America, and the original language of the movie is English. The producer of the film is Al Adamson.

['wrong']

Directed by Al Adamson and featuring a stellar cast including Grant Williams, Kent Taylor, Regina Carrol, and Vicki Volante, "Brain of Blood" was released on August 1, 1971, in the United States, grossing a staggering $242.2 million at the box office despite its $290.2 million budget. The production country of the movie is the United States of America, and the original language of the movie is English. The producer of the film is Al Adamson.

In "Wake Up, Ron Burgundy: The Lost Movie," released on the 28th of December 2004 in the United States of America, director Adam McKay brings back the beloved characters from the Anchorman series. As Ron Burgundy's feud with Veronica Corningstone reaches new heights, a bumbling group of thieves known as 'The Alarm Clock' stumble into the spotlight, determined to uncover the truth, whatever that may entail. Produced by Judd Apatow and with a budget of 52.0 million dollars, this English-language film promises to continue the adventure with its star-studded cast including Will Ferrell, Christina Applegate, Paul Rudd, and Steve Carell. With an average rating of 5.5, get ready for more laughs, more chaos, and more Burgundy in this DreamWorks SKG production. Remember, the adventure continues...

title = The Damned 
overview = After suffering the recent loss of his wife, David Reynolds decides to take his family on a cathartic trip to her home village in Columbia. While en route, they get into a car accident and seek refuge in a secluded inn. While there they find a mysterious young girl, Ana Maria, locked up with cryptic symbols painted on the walls of her cell. Shocked by the treatment of her caretaker, the family sets Ana free only to realize that she is possessed by an evil spirit from centuries past. What’s worse, the spirit can jump from person to person, creating a deadly dynamic amongst the once loving family. Now, David must figure out a way to lock the spirit up for good before it destroys him and his family. 
production compagnie = Launchpad Productions 
average note = 5.0 
duration of the movie = 1h27 
date of release = the 17 of October 2013 
cast = Peter Facinelli, Sophia Myles, Nathalia Ramos, Carolina Guerra 
Producer = Peter Block 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 202.6 millions of dollars 
Director = Víctor García 
revenue = 266.6 millions of dollars 
tagline = Heaven help us 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Launchpad Productions 

In "The Damned," directed by Víctor García and produced by Launchpad Productions, a grieving David Reynolds takes his family to his late wife's village in Colombia for closure. However, their journey takes a sinister turn when they seek refuge in a secluded inn after a car accident. Inside, they discover a young girl named Ana Maria, locked up and possessed by an ancient evil spirit that can possess others. Shocked by the treatment of her caretaker, the family sets Ana free only to realize that she is possessed by an evil spirit from centuries past. As the spirit wreaks havoc on the family, David must find a way to banish it before it destroys them all. Starring Peter Facinelli, Sophia Myles, Nathalia Ramos, and Carolina Guerra, this supernatural thriller with a tagline "Heaven help us" was released on October 17, 2013. With a budget of 202.6 million dollars, the film grossed 266.6 million dollars at the box office, receiving an average rating of 5.0. The original language of the movie is English, and it was produced in the United States of America.

However, their journey takes a sinister turn when they seek refuge in a secluded inn after a car accident. Inside, they discover a young girl named Ana Maria, locked up and possessed by an ancient evil spirit that can possess others. Shocked by the treatment of her caretaker, the family sets Ana free only to realize that she is possessed by an evil spirit from centuries past. As the spirit wreaks havoc on the family, David must find a way to banish it before it destroys them all. Starring Peter Facinelli, Sophia Myles, Nathalia Ramos, and Carolina Guerra, this supernatural thriller with a tagline "Heaven help us" was released on October 17, 2013. With a budget of 202.6 million dollars, the film grossed 266.6 million dollars at the box office, receiving an average rating of 5.0. The original language of the movie is English, and it was produced in the United States of America.

title = Tamara Drewe 
overview = A young newspaper writer returns to her hometown in the English countryside, where her childhood home is being prepped for sale. 
production countrie = United Kingdom 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United Kingdom 

In the charming British film "Tamara Drewe," a young newspaper writer embarks on a journey back to her quaint hometown in the English countryside. As she navigates through familiar streets and memories, she discovers that her childhood home is in the process of being prepared for sale. Set against the backdrop of the picturesque United Kingdom, this heartwarming tale explores themes of nostalgia, change, and the bittersweet feeling of returning to one's roots. The production country for the film is the United Kingdom.

title = In the House 
overview = A sixteen-year-old boy insinuates himself into the house of a fellow student from his literature class and writes about it in essays for his French teacher. Faced with this gifted and unusual pupil, the teacher rediscovers his enthusiasm for his work, but the boy’s intrusion will unleash a series of uncontrollable events. 
budget = 32.0 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h45 
original language of the movie = French 
production compagnie = France 2 Cinéma 
Director = François Ozon 
Producer = Claudie Ossard 
revenue = 11.9 millions of dollars 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : budget = 32.0 millions of dollars 

"In the House" is a captivating French film directed by François Ozon. The story follows a sixteen-year-old boy who cleverly integrates himself into the home of a classmate from his literature class, using his experiences as material for essays he writes for his French teacher. As the teacher becomes increasingly intrigued by the boy's talent and uniqueness, he rediscovers his passion for teaching. However, the boy's presence sets off a chain of unpredictable events that spiral out of control. With a budget of 32.0 million dollars, a runtime of 1 hour and 45 minutes, and produced by France 2 Cinéma, this film explores the boundaries between reality and fiction, leaving viewers on the edge of their seats. Despite its critical acclaim, "In the House" grossed 11.9 million dollars at the box office, showcasing the complex and thought-provoking nature of this cinematic masterpiece. The original language of the movie is French, and the producer of the film is Claudie Ossard.

title = Stuck 
overview = A young woman commits a hit-and-run, then finds her fate tied to her victim. 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = Canada 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the English-language film "Stuck," a young woman's life takes a dark turn after she commits a hit-and-run accident. As she grapples with the consequences of her actions, she discovers that her fate is inexplicably intertwined with that of her victim. Set against the backdrop of Canada, this gripping thriller explores the complexities of guilt, redemption, and the unpredictable nature of destiny. The movie was produced in Canada.

title = The Land That Time Forgot 
overview = During World War I, a German U-boat sinks a British ship and takes the survivors on board. After it takes a wrong turn, the submarine takes them to the unknown land of Caprona, where they find dinosaurs and neanderthals. 
budget = 1.5 millions of dollars 
tagline = THE ADVENTURE YOU WILL NEVER FORGET! 
production compagnie = British Lion Film Corporation 
average note = 5.7 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 1.5 millions of dollars 

In "The Land That Time Forgot," a group of survivors from a British ship, taken aboard a German U-boat during World War I, find themselves on a thrilling and unexpected journey to the mysterious land of Caprona. As they navigate through this uncharted territory, they encounter not only dinosaurs but also neanderthals, leading to a series of dangerous and exciting adventures. Produced by British Lion Film Corporation with a budget of 1.5 million dollars, this film promises an unforgettable adventure that will keep you on the edge of your seat. With an average rating of 5.7, get ready to embark on a journey like no other in "The Land That Time Forgot." And remember, this is THE ADVENTURE YOU WILL NEVER FORGET!

title = The Martian 
overview = During a manned mission to Mars, Astronaut Mark Watney is presumed dead after a fierce storm and left behind by his crew. But Watney has survived and finds himself stranded and alone on the hostile planet. With only meager supplies, he must draw upon his ingenuity, wit and spirit to subsist and find a way to signal to Earth that he is alive. 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 30 of September 2015 
average note = 7.6 
Producer = Ridley Scott 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In "The Martian," directed by Ridley Scott and released on September 30, 2015, we are taken on a thrilling journey to Mars where Astronaut Mark Watney is left stranded after being presumed dead by his crew. With only limited supplies, Watney must rely on his resourcefulness and determination to survive on the harsh planet and devise a plan to communicate with Earth. This American production showcases Watney's resilience and wit as he battles the elements in a fight for survival. With an average rating of 7.6, this gripping tale of human ingenuity and spirit is sure to captivate audiences. The film was produced in the United States of America.

title = Lara Croft: Tomb Raider 
overview = English aristocrat Lara Croft is skilled in hand-to-hand combat and in the middle of a battle with a secret society. The shapely archaeologist moonlights as a tomb raider to recover lost antiquities and meets her match in the evil Powell, who's in search of a powerful relic. 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 

In the action-packed adventure film "Lara Croft: Tomb Raider," English aristocrat Lara Croft showcases her expertise in hand-to-hand combat while facing off against a mysterious secret society. When not engaging in epic battles, the shapely archaeologist embarks on thrilling expeditions as a tomb raider, seeking out lost antiquities. However, her skills are put to the ultimate test when she crosses paths with the villainous Powell, who is on a quest to obtain a powerful relic. Produced by Paramount Pictures, this movie unfolds in its original English language, delivering a riveting tale of danger, intrigue, and ancient mysteries. The movie is titled "Lara Croft: Tomb Raider" and the original language of the movie is English. The production company behind the film is Paramount Pictures.

title = The Throwaways 
overview = Notorious hacker Drew Reynolds is captured by the CIA and given a proposition - work for them or spend the rest of his life in prison. Agreeing on the condition that he can form his own team, he puts together a group of "throwaways" - the people deemed expendable and seemingly the worst in the organization. 
cast = Peter Brooke, James Caan, Noel Clarke, Kevin Dillon 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Peter Brooke, James Caan, Noel Clarke, Kevin Dillon 

In "The Throwaways," notorious hacker Drew Reynolds finds himself at a crossroads when the CIA captures him and presents a life-altering proposition: either work for them or face a lifetime behind bars. Reluctantly agreeing to cooperate, Drew seizes the opportunity to assemble his own team, comprised of individuals labeled as "throwaways" - those considered expendable and the least valuable within the organization. As tensions rise and loyalties are tested, Drew and his unconventional team, portrayed by talented actors Peter Brooke, James Caan, Noel Clarke, and Kevin Dillon, must navigate a treacherous world where trust is a luxury they can't afford to lose. 
 
 
FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct!']
fact : date of release = the 30 of January 2015

As tensions rise and loyalties are tested, Drew and his unconventional team, portrayed by talented actors Peter Brooke, James Caan, Noel Clarke, and Kevin Dillon, must navigate a treacherous world where trust is a luxury they can't afford to lose.

In "The Throwaways," notorious hacker Drew Reynolds finds himself at a crossroads when the CIA captures him and presents a life-altering proposition: either work for them or face a lifetime behind bars. Reluctantly agreeing to cooperate, Drew seizes the opportunity to assemble his own team, comprised of individuals labeled as "throwaways" - those considered expendable and the least valuable within the organization. As tensions rise and loyalties are tested, Drew and his unconventional team, portrayed by talented actors Peter Brooke, James Caan, Noel Clarke, and Kevin Dillon, must navigate a treacherous world where trust is a luxury they can't afford to lose.

['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h30 

In "The Throwaways," notorious hacker Drew Reynolds finds himself at a crossroads when the CIA captures him and presents a life-altering proposition: either work for them or face a lifetime behind bars. Reluctantly agreeing to cooperate, Drew seizes the opportunity to assemble his own team, comprised of individuals labeled as "throwaways" - those considered expendable and the least valuable within the organization. As tensions rise and loyalties are tested, Drew and his unconventional team, portrayed by talented actors Peter Brooke, James Caan, Noel Clarke, and Kevin Dillon, must navigate a treacherous world where trust is a luxury they can't afford to lose. 
 
 

 
title = Shutter 
overview = A newly married couple discovers disturbing, ghostly images in photographs they develop after a tragic accident. Fearing the manifestations may be connected, they investigate and learn that some mysteries are better left unsolved. 
cast = Joshua Jackson, Rachael Taylor, Megumi Okina, David Denman 
production compagnie = Regency Enterprises 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 108.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 21 of March 2008

['correct! the fact mentioned is indeed the cast: joshua jackson, rachael taylor, megumi okina, and david denman, which matches the description provided.']
fact : cast = Joshua Jackson, Rachael Taylor, Megumi Okina, David Denman 

In the chilling horror film "Shutter," directed by Masayuki Ochiai and produced by Takashige Ichise, a newly married couple, played by Joshua Jackson and Rachael Taylor, experiences a series of unsettling events after a tragic accident. As they develop photographs revealing ghostly images, they embark on a terrifying investigation to uncover the connection between these manifestations. Set in the United States of America and released on the 21st of March 2008, this Regency Enterprises production with a budget of 108.0 million dollars delves into the idea that some mysteries are best left unsolved. With a tagline that reads "The most terrifying images are the ones that are real," the movie runs for 1 hour and 25 minutes and features a cast including Megumi Okina and David Denman. Despite receiving an average rating of 5.3, "Shutter" promises to deliver spine-chilling thrills and a haunting tale that will leave viewers on the edge of their seats.

title = Freerunner 
overview = With a ticking bomb locked to his neck, a young freerunner races against the clock and all types of baddies to get from one end of the city to the other to save himself and his girlfriend. 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = Run For Your Life 
cast = Sean Faris, Danny Dyer, Tamer Hassan, Amanda Fuller 
production compagnie = Vitamin A Films 
date of release = the 14 of September 2011 

In the heart-pounding action thriller "Freerunner," we follow a daring young freerunner who finds himself in a race against time. With a deadly bomb strapped to his neck, he must navigate through the city, facing various adversaries, in a desperate attempt to save both himself and his girlfriend. Starring Sean Faris, Danny Dyer, Tamer Hassan, and Amanda Fuller, this adrenaline-fueled film, released on September 14, 2011, will have you on the edge of your seat from start to finish. Remember to heed the tagline: Run For Your Life.

overview = On September 15, 1963, a bomb destroyed a black church in Birmingham, Alabama, killing four young girls who were there for Sunday school. It was a crime that shocked the nation--and a defining moment in the history of the civil-rights movement. Spike Lee re-examines the full story of the bombing, including a revealing interview with former Alabama Governor George Wallace.

production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 95.7 millions of dollars 

title = Nazi Agent 
overview = The story of identicial twin brothers -- one loyal to Nazi Germany and the other a loyal American who get involved with Nazi agents. 
revenue = 95.7 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 

In "Nazi Agent," viewers are taken on a gripping journey following identical twin brothers who find themselves on opposite sides of a dangerous conflict. One brother remains loyal to Nazi Germany, while the other stands firm in his allegiance to America. As they navigate the treacherous waters of espionage and deceit, they become entangled with Nazi agents, leading to a series of high-stakes encounters that will test their loyalties to the core. Set against the backdrop of World War II, this thrilling tale unfolds in the United States of America, where the brothers' fates hang in the balance. With a staggering revenue of 95.7 million dollars, "Nazi Agent" is a riveting cinematic experience that delves into the complexities of war, loyalty, and the bonds that tie us together.

title = Tales from Earthsea 
overview = Something bizarre has come over the land. The kingdom is deteriorating. People are beginning to act strange... What's even more strange is that people are beginning to see dragons, which shouldn't enter the world of humans. Due to all these bizarre events, Ged, a wandering wizard, is investigating the cause. During his journey, he meets Prince Arren, a young distraught teenage boy. While Arren may look like a shy young teen, he has a severe dark side, which grants him strength, hatred, ruthlessness and has no mercy, especially when it comes to protecting Teru. For the witch Kumo this is a perfect opportunity. She can use the boy's "fears" against the very one who would help him, Ged. 
cast = Junichi Okada, Aoi Teshima, Bunta Sugawara, Yūko Tanaka 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Junichi Okada, Aoi Teshima, Bunta Sugawara, Yūko Tanaka 

In the mystical world of "Tales from Earthsea," a kingdom is in turmoil as strange occurrences plague the land. Wizards, dragons, and dark forces intertwine as Ged, a wandering wizard, embarks on a journey to uncover the source of the chaos. Along the way, he crosses paths with Prince Arren, a troubled young boy with a hidden dark side that threatens to consume him. As Ged and Arren navigate through a world filled with danger and deceit, they must confront their inner demons and face off against the cunning witch Kumo, who seeks to exploit Arren's fears for her own sinister purposes. With a talented cast including Junichi Okada, Aoi Teshima, Bunta Sugawara, and Yūko Tanaka, "Tales from Earthsea" is a captivating tale of magic, redemption, and the battle between light and darkness.

title = Hope Springs 
overview = After thirty years of marriage, a middle-aged couple attends an intense, week-long counseling session to work on their relationship. 
average note = 5.8 
Producer = Todd Black 
cast = Meryl Streep, Steve Carell, Tommy Lee Jones, Jean Smart 
budget = 30.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = David Frankel 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.8 

In "Hope Springs," directed by David Frankel and produced by Todd Black, a middle-aged couple portrayed by Meryl Streep and Tommy Lee Jones embark on a transformative journey. After thirty years of marriage, they decide to attend an intense week-long counseling session led by a therapist played by Steve Carell. As they navigate the challenges and revelations that arise during the sessions, their relationship is put to the test. With a stellar supporting cast including Jean Smart, this emotional and insightful film delves into the complexities of love, communication, and the enduring power of hope. Set in the United States of America and spoken in English, "Hope Springs" is a poignant exploration of the highs and lows of long-term relationships. And with a budget of 30 million dollars, this movie delivers a compelling and authentic portrayal of the struggles and triumphs of marriage. The average note for the movie is 5.8. The production country is the United States of America. The original language of the movie is English. The cast includes Meryl Streep, Steve Carell, Tommy Lee Jones, and Jean Smart. The producer of the movie is Todd Black.

['correct']

The producer of the movie is Todd Black.

In "Hope Springs," directed by David Frankel and produced by Todd Black, a middle-aged couple portrayed by Meryl Streep and Tommy Lee Jones embark on a transformative journey. After thirty years of marriage, they decide to attend an intense week-long counseling session led by a therapist played by Steve Carell. As they navigate the challenges and revelations that arise during the sessions, their relationship is put to the test. In "Bandslam," directed by Todd Graff, a high school social outcast and a popular girl find a common ground through their mutual passion for music. Starring Vanessa Hudgens, Aly Michalka, Gaelan Connell, and Lisa Kudrow, this heartwarming tale showcases the power of music to bridge social divides. Set in the United States of America, the film was released on the 6th of August 2009, with a budget of 20.0 million dollars. Despite its touching story, the movie received an average rating of 5.4. title = Bunraku 
overview = In a world with no guns, a mysterious drifter, a bartender and a young samurai plot revenge against a ruthless leader and his army of thugs, headed by nine diverse and deadly assassins. 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Josh Hartnett, Demi Moore, Woody Harrelson, Ron Perlman 
Producer = Nava Levin 
production compagnie = Ram Bergman Productions 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 5.9 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In a world where guns are nonexistent, "Bunraku" follows a mysterious drifter, a bartender, and a young samurai as they devise a plan for revenge against a brutal leader and his gang of thugs. This action-packed film features a diverse and deadly group of nine assassins, all under the command of the ruthless leader. Starring Josh Hartnett, Demi Moore, Woody Harrelson, and Ron Perlman, this English-language movie is a thrilling tale of vengeance. Produced by Nava Levin and brought to life by Ram Bergman Productions in the United States of America, "Bunraku" has an average rating of 5.9.

title = Critical Condition 
overview = Eddie is a con artist. But this time he's framed and comes before a judge. By claiming insanity, he hopes to get off the hook. He manages end up in a hospital for a mental examination. That night, a storm breaks out over New York, and the electricity to the hospital is broken. In the ensuing chaos that follows, Eddie is taken for a doctor. Suddenly he is in charge of a whole hospital! 
Producer = Ted Field 
production countrie = United States of America 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 
tagline = Guess who's playing doctor? 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the fact mentioned is indeed "producer = ted field" and it matches the description provided.']
fact : Producer = Ted Field 

In the American comedy film "Critical Condition," produced by Ted Field and released by Paramount Pictures, Eddie, a con artist, finds himself in a tricky situation after being framed and brought before a judge. Desperate to avoid punishment, he decides to feign insanity in hopes of getting off the hook. However, his plan takes an unexpected turn when he is mistakenly taken for a doctor during a chaotic night at a hospital in New York, caused by a storm that knocks out the electricity. As Eddie suddenly finds himself in charge of the entire hospital, he must navigate the hilarious challenges that come with his newfound responsibility. With the tagline "Guess who's playing doctor?" this English-language film is a wild ride filled with comedy and unexpected twists. 

Producer: Ted Field
Production country: United States of America
Original language of the movie: English
Production company: Paramount Pictures 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America

['correct']
fact : tagline = Guess who's playing doctor? 

In the American comedy film "Critical Condition," produced by Ted Field and released by Paramount Pictures, Eddie, a con artist, finds himself in a tricky situation after being framed and brought before a judge. Desperate to avoid punishment, he decides to feign insanity in hopes of getting off the hook. However, his plan takes an unexpected turn when he is mistakenly taken for a doctor during a chaotic night at a hospital in New York, caused by a storm that knocks out the electricity. As Eddie suddenly finds himself in charge of the entire hospital, he must navigate the hilarious challenges that come with his newfound responsibility. With the tagline "Guess who's playing doctor?" this English-language film is a wild ride filled with comedy and unexpected twists.

Original language of the movie: English
Production company: Paramount Pictures

title = The Hot Chick 
overview = Not only is Jessica Spencer (Rachel McAdams) the most popular girl in school -- she is also the meanest. But things change for the attractive teen when a freak accident involving a cursed pair of earrings and a chance encounter at a gas station causes her to switch bodies with Clive (Rob Schneider), a sleazy crook. Jessica, in the form of the repulsive Clive, struggles to adjust to this radical alteration and sets out to get her own body back before the upcoming prom. 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 35.1 millions of dollars 
tagline = The hottest chick in town just switched bodies with the luckiest loser in the world. 
production compagnie = Happy Madison Productions 
date of release = the 13 of December 2002 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In "The Hot Chick," the high school hierarchy is turned upside down when Jessica Spencer, the popular yet mean girl, finds herself in a bizarre predicament after swapping bodies with a sleazy crook named Clive. As Jessica navigates life in Clive's unappealing form, she must race against time to reclaim her own body before the upcoming prom. With a tagline that promises a hilarious twist on the classic body-swap trope, this United States of America production from Happy Madison Productions grossed an impressive $35.1 million at the box office. Released on the 13th of December 2002, get ready for a comedy that proves that appearances can be deceiving and that true beauty comes from within. The hottest chick in town just switched bodies with the luckiest loser in the world.
