title = Mars Attacks! 
overview = 'We come in peace' is not what those green men from Mars mean when they invade our planet, armed with irresistible weapons and a cruel sense of humor.  This star studded cast must play victim to the alien’s fun and games in this comedy homage to science fiction films of the '50s and '60s. 
budget = 70.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 12 of December 1996 
tagline = Nice planet. We'll take it! 
revenue = 101.4 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.1 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 70.0 millions of dollars 

In the comedic sci-fi film "Mars Attacks!", a group of green men from Mars invade Earth with a cruel sense of humor and advanced weapons, declaring "Nice planet. We'll take it!" Released on December 12, 1996, this star-studded movie pays homage to classic science fiction films of the '50s and '60s. With a budget of $70 million, the film grossed $101.4 million at the box office. Despite the chaos caused by the alien invasion, the average note for the movie stands at 6.1.

title = Kind Hearts and Coronets 
overview = Louis Mazzini's mother belongs to the aristocratic family D'Ascoyne, but she ran away with an opera singer. Therefore, she and Louis were rejected by the D'Ascoynes. Once adult, Louis decides to avenges his mother and him, by becoming the next Duke of the family. Murdering every potential successor is clearly the safest way to achieve his goal. 
average note = 7.6 
budget = 196.3 millions of dollars 
revenue = 158.9 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Ealing Studios 
Director = Robert Hamer 
Producer = Michael Balcon 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United Kingdom 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : average note = 7.6 

In "Kind Hearts and Coronets," directed by Robert Hamer and produced by Michael Balcon, we are taken on a thrilling journey with Louis Mazzini. Born into a family shunned by the aristocratic D'Ascoynes, Louis sets out on a mission to avenge his mother's rejection by the family. His elaborate plan? To become the next Duke by eliminating each potential successor in a series of calculated murders. As the tension rises, Louis navigates the intricate web of aristocratic society with cunning precision. Set against the backdrop of the United Kingdom, this English-language film from Ealing Studios delves into themes of revenge, ambition, and the lengths one will go to for power. With an average rating of 7.6, this gripping tale captivates audiences with its dark humor and intricate plot twists. The film had a budget of 196.3 million dollars and grossed 158.9 million dollars in revenue.

In "Kind Hearts and Coronets," directed by Robert Hamer and produced by Michael Balcon, we are taken on a thrilling journey with Louis Mazzini. Born into a family shunned by the aristocratic D'Ascoynes, Louis sets out on a mission to avenge his mother's rejection by the family. His elaborate plan? To become the next Duke by eliminating each potential successor in a series of calculated murders. As the tension rises, Louis navigates the intricate web of aristocratic society with cunning precision. Set against the backdrop of the United Kingdom, this English-language film from Ealing Studios delves into themes of revenge, ambition, and the lengths one will go to for power. With an average rating of 7.6, this gripping tale captivates audiences with its dark humor and intricate plot twists. The film had a budget of 196.3 million dollars and grossed 158.9 million dollars in revenue.

title = Class Action 
overview = Liberal activist lawyer Jedediah alienated daughter Maggie years ago when she discovered his many affairs. Now a conservative corporate lawyer, Maggie agrees to go up against her father in court. To gain promotion, she must defend an auto manufacturer against charges that their explosion-prone station wagons are unsafe. As her mother begs for peace, Maggie takes on her dad in a trial that turns increasingly personal and nasty. 
cast = Gene Hackman, Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio, Colin Friels, Laurence Fishburne 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Gene Hackman, Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio, Colin Friels, Laurence Fishburne 

In the riveting legal drama "Class Action," we follow the complex relationship between liberal activist lawyer Jedediah and his estranged daughter Maggie, now a conservative corporate lawyer. When Maggie is tasked with defending an auto manufacturer in a high-stakes case involving dangerous station wagons, she finds herself facing off against her own father in court. As the trial unfolds, personal and professional conflicts intertwine, leading to a showdown that tests their beliefs and values. Starring Gene Hackman, Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio, Colin Friels, and Laurence Fishburne, "Class Action" delivers a gripping narrative filled with emotional depth and intense courtroom drama. The story delves into how Jedediah's many affairs alienated Maggie years ago, leading to their estrangement. Additionally, Maggie's mother pleads for peace as the trial between father and daughter becomes increasingly personal and contentious.

overview = When 13 year old Maria Merryweather's father dies, leaving her orphaned and homeless, she is forced to leave her luxurious London life to go and live with Sir Benjamin, an eccentric uncle she didn't know she had, at the mysterious Moonacre Manor. 
duration of the movie = 1h43 
production compagnie = South Pacific Pictures 
average note = 6.2 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h43 

In "The Secret of Moonacre," we follow the journey of 13-year-old Maria Merryweather, who finds herself orphaned and homeless after her father's passing. Forced to leave behind her luxurious life in London, Maria is taken in by her eccentric uncle, Sir Benjamin, and brought to the enigmatic Moonacre Manor. As she navigates this new and mysterious world, Maria unravels family secrets and discovers the true magic of Moonacre. Produced by South Pacific Pictures, this enchanting tale unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 43 minutes, captivating audiences with an average rating of 6.2.

In the chilling horror film "Cannibal Girls," directed by Ivan Reitman, a young couple's night takes a terrifying turn when they decide to stay at a haunted restaurant. Little do they know, the establishment is inhabited by three deceased women with an insatiable appetite for human flesh. Released on April 1, 1973, the movie, produced by Scary Pictures Productions and filmed in Canada, features a stellar cast including Eugene Levy, Andrea Martin, Ronald Ulrich, and Randall Carpenter. Despite its budget of 210.9 million dollars, "Cannibal Girls" managed to gross an impressive 158.9 million dollars at the box office. With a runtime of 1 hour and 24 minutes, this spine-tingling tale unfolds in English, captivating audiences with an average rating of 3.8.

In the chilling horror film "Cannibal Girls," directed by Ivan Reitman, a young couple's night takes a terrifying turn when they decide to stay at a haunted restaurant. Little do they know, the establishment is inhabited by three deceased women with an insatiable appetite for human flesh. Released on April 1, 1973, the movie, produced by Scary Pictures Productions and filmed in Canada, features a stellar cast including Eugene Levy, Andrea Martin, Ronald Ulrich, and Randall Carpenter. Despite its budget of 210.9 million dollars, "Cannibal Girls" managed to gross an impressive 158.9 million dollars at the box office. With a runtime of 1 hour and 24 minutes, this spine-tingling tale unfolds in English, captivating audiences with an average rating of 3.8.

fact : duration of the movie = 1h39 

In the romantic comedy "Speechless," Michael Keaton and Geena Davis play speechwriters for rival political campaigns, bringing wit and humor to the world of politics. Directed by Ron Underwood and produced by Renny Harlin, the film was released on December 16, 1994, in the United States by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM). The star-studded cast includes Christopher Reeve and Bonnie Bedelia. With a runtime of 1 hour and 39 minutes, the movie is in English and received an average rating of 5.5. Despite its success at the box office, grossing $59.2 million, "Speechless" remains a delightful choice for political junkies and fans of romantic comedies alike.

title = Infernal Affairs II 
overview = In this prequel to Mou gaan dou (2002), Chan Wing Yan has just become an undercover cop in the triads while Lau Kin Ming joins the police force. Both the triads and the police find an enemy in a rival crime boss. 
production compagnie = Media Asia Films 
original language of the movie = Chinese 
date of release = the 1 of October 2003 
average note = 7.2 
budget = 300.0 millions of dollars 
revenue = 230.8 millions of dollars 
Director = Andrew Lau 
cast = Anthony Wong, Eric Tsang, Carina Lau, Francis Ng 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Media Asia Films 

In "Infernal Affairs II," a gripping prequel to the acclaimed "Mou gaan dou," viewers are taken back to witness the early days of Chan Wing Yan's journey as an undercover cop within the treacherous triads, while Lau Kin Ming embarks on his own path within the police force. As both sides navigate the dangerous underworld, they must unite against a common foe - a formidable rival crime boss. Directed by Andrew Lau and featuring a stellar cast including Anthony Wong, Eric Tsang, Carina Lau, and Francis Ng, this intense thriller unfolds in its original Chinese language, courtesy of production company Media Asia Films. Despite a hefty budget of 300 million dollars, the film managed to earn 230.8 million dollars at the box office upon its release on the 1st of October 2003, garnering an average rating of 7.2.

title = The Spiderwick Chronicles 
overview = Upon moving into the run-down Spiderwick Estate with their mother, twin brothers Jared and Simon Grace, along with their sister Mallory, find themselves pulled into an alternate world full of faeries and other creatures. 
cast = Freddie Highmore, Mary-Louise Parker, Nick Nolte, Sarah Bolger 
average note = 6.3 
revenue = 162.8 millions of dollars 
budget = 90.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h35 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 
tagline = Their World Is Closer Than You Think. 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Mark Waters 
Producer = Larry J. Franco 
date of release = the 14 of February 2008 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Freddie Highmore, Mary-Louise Parker, Nick Nolte, Sarah Bolger 

In the enchanting movie "The Spiderwick Chronicles," directed by Mark Waters and produced by Larry J. Franco, viewers are taken on a thrilling journey with the Grace siblings. Upon moving into the mysterious Spiderwick Estate, twins Jared and Simon, along with their sister Mallory, discover a hidden world teeming with faeries and other mystical creatures. As they navigate this alternate reality, they must unravel secrets and face challenges beyond their wildest imagination. Starring Freddie Highmore, Mary-Louise Parker, Nick Nolte, and Sarah Bolger, this captivating tale unfolds in the United States of America, where Paramount Pictures brought it to life. With an average rating of 6.3, the film grossed a staggering $162.8 million, surpassing its $90 million budget. The 1 hour and 35-minute adventure, released on February 14, 2008, in English, carries the tagline "Their World Is Closer Than You Think," inviting audiences to explore the extraordinary alongside the courageous Grace siblings.

In the enchanting movie "The Spiderwick Chronicles," directed by Mark Waters and produced by Larry J. Franco, viewers are taken on a thrilling journey with the Grace siblings. Upon moving into the mysterious Spiderwick Estate, twins Jared and Simon, along with their sister Mallory, discover a hidden world teeming with faeries and other mystical creatures. As they navigate this alternate reality, they must unravel secrets and face challenges beyond their wildest imagination. Starring Freddie Highmore, Mary-Louise Parker, Nick Nolte, and Sarah Bolger, this captivating tale unfolds in the United States of America, where Paramount Pictures brought it to life. With an average rating of 6.3, the film grossed a staggering $162.8 million, surpassing its $90 million budget. The 1 hour and 35-minute adventure, released on February 14, 2008, in English, carries the tagline "Their World Is Closer Than You Think," inviting audiences to explore the extraordinary alongside the courageous Grace siblings.

title = 16 Wishes 
overview = The story about Abby Jensen, a girl who's been eager to reach her 16th birthday and has kept a secret wish list since she was a little girl. When the Big Day actually arrives, utter disaster strikes, leaving Abby to think her birthday is ruined. But when a mysterious box of magical birthday candles arrives to turn things around, Abby's 16 Wishes start to come true. Her day gets better and better...until she makes one wish that threatens to change everything.

fact : cast = Debby Ryan, Jean-Luc Bilodeau, Keenan Tracey, Anna Mae Routledge 

In the heartwarming Disney Channel movie "16 Wishes," Abby Jensen, portrayed by Debby Ryan, is counting down the days until her 16th birthday, holding onto a secret wish list she's cherished since childhood. When her highly anticipated birthday takes a turn for the worse, Abby receives a mysterious box of enchanted birthday candles that begin granting her wishes one by one. As her day transforms into a series of magical moments, Abby's excitement grows, until she makes a wish that could alter everything. Directed by Peter DeLuise and produced by Ron French, this English-language film, released on June 25, 2010, features a talented cast including Jean-Luc Bilodeau, Keenan Tracey, and Anna Mae Routledge. With an average rating of 5.5, "16 Wishes" takes viewers on a whimsical journey filled with surprises and the power of believing in the extraordinary.

The production company behind "16 Wishes" is Disney Channel, and the movie was produced in the United States of America.

In the captivating film "Irreconcilable Differences," released on the 28th of September 1984 in the United States of America, viewers are taken on a journey through time as a precocious little girl takes a bold step to sue her selfish, career-driven parents for emancipation. The stellar cast including Ryan O'Neal, Shelley Long, Drew Barrymore, and Sam Wanamaker brings this emotional tale to life. With a budget of 51.0 million dollars, this movie delves into the complexities of family dynamics and the unexpected twists that can arise when a child decides to take a stand against their own parents.

title = Rammbock: Berlin Undead 
overview = When lovelorn Michael arrives in Berlin to return a set of keys to his ex-girlfriend, Gabi, as an excuse to see her again, he finds her apartment empty save for a couple of plumbers making repairs to the central heating. Just as Michael learns from the plumber’s apprentice, Harper, that Gabi has popped out for a while but will return soon, the apprentice is attacked by his boss who has unexpectedly and inexplicably transformed into a raging madman. Together, Michael and Harper manage to bundle the crazed plumber out of the apartment and barricade themselves safely inside. Within minutes, they find themselves trapped in apartment block under siege from a horde of similarly insane people, apparently hungry for human flesh. 
duration of the movie = 1h03 
production compagnie = ZDF "Das Kleine Fernsehspiel" 
original language of the movie = German 
average note = 6.3 
cast = Michael Fuith, Theo Trebs, Anka Graczyk, Emily Cox 
revenue = 120.1 millions of dollars 
Producer = Sigrid Hoerner 
production countrie = Germany 
Director = Marvin Kren 
budget = 290.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h03 

In the heart-pounding thriller "Rammbock: Berlin Undead," lovelorn Michael makes a spontaneous trip to Berlin to return keys to his ex-girlfriend, Gabi. Upon arriving at her apartment, he is met with an eerie emptiness, except for a pair of plumbers working on repairs. When one of the plumbers suddenly transforms into a crazed madman, Michael teams up with the plumber's apprentice, Harper, to defend themselves. As they barricade themselves inside, they soon realize they are not alone - the apartment block is surrounded by a horde of flesh-hungry individuals. Directed by Marvin Kren and produced by Sigrid Hoerner, this German-language film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 3 minutes runtime. Starring Michael Fuith, Theo Trebs, Anka Graczyk, and Emily Cox, "Rammbock: Berlin Undead" received an average rating of 6.3. With a staggering revenue of 120.1 million dollars against a budget of 290.0 million dollars, this intense zombie apocalypse movie showcases the struggle for survival in the midst of chaos. The production company behind the film is ZDF "Das Kleine Fernsehspiel," and it was produced in Germany.

['correct!']

Upon arriving at her apartment, he is met with an eerie emptiness, except for a pair of plumbers working on repairs. When one of the plumbers suddenly transforms into a crazed madman, Michael teams up with the plumber's apprentice, Harper, to defend themselves. As they barricade themselves inside, they soon realize they are not alone - the apartment block is surrounded by a horde of flesh-hungry individuals. Directed by Marvin Kren and produced by Sigrid Hoerner, this German-language film keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 3 minutes runtime. Starring Michael Fuith, Theo Trebs, Anka Graczyk, and Emily Cox, "Rammbock: Berlin Undead" received an average rating of 6.3. With a staggering revenue of 120.1 million dollars against a budget of 290.0 million dollars, this intense zombie apocalypse movie showcases the struggle for survival in the midst of chaos. The production company behind the film is ZDF "Das Kleine Fernsehspiel," and it was produced in Germany.

['correct']
fact : Producer = Sigrid Hoerner

title = How Green Was My Valley 
overview = At the turn of the century in a Welsh mining village, the Morgans (he stern, she gentle) raise coal-mining sons and hope their youngest will find a better life. Lots of atmosphere, very sentimental view of pre-union miners' lives. The film is based on the 1939 Richard Llewellyn novel of the same name. 
tagline = Millions Have Read This Great Novel... Millions more will see an even greater picture! 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the fact is indeed the tagline "millions have read this great novel... millions more will see an even greater picture!" and it matches with the description provided.']
fact : tagline = Millions Have Read This Great Novel... Millions more will see an even greater picture! 

title = How Green Was My Valley 
overview = In the heart of a Welsh mining village at the turn of the century, the Morgan family navigates the harsh realities of coal-mining life. As they raise their sons in the midst of labor disputes and hardships, they cling to hope for a brighter future, especially for their youngest. "How Green Was My Valley" captures the essence of a bygone era with a sentimental lens, offering a poignant portrayal of pre-union miners' lives. Based on the beloved 1939 novel by Richard Llewellyn, this cinematic adaptation immerses viewers in a world where resilience and familial bonds are tested against the backdrop of industrial turmoil. With a tagline that promises an unforgettable cinematic experience, this film invites audiences to witness a timeless tale of struggle, love, and the pursuit of a better tomorrow. 
tagline = Millions Have Read This Great Novel... Millions more will see an even greater picture!

title = Dawn of the Dead 
overview = A group of surviving people take refuge in a shopping center after the world has been over taken over by aggressive, flesh-eating zombies. A remake of the 1978 zombie film of the same name. 
duration of the movie = 1h41 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = New Amsterdam Entertainment 
tagline = When the undead rise, civilization will fall. 
revenue = 102.4 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 28.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 19 of March 2004 
average note = 6.8 
Director = Zack Snyder 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h41 

In "Dawn of the Dead," directed by Zack Snyder, a group of survivors seeks refuge in a shopping center amidst a world overrun by aggressive, flesh-eating zombies. This English-language remake of the 1978 zombie film of the same name unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 41 minutes. As the undead rise, civilization crumbles, echoing the tagline "When the undead rise, civilization will fall." Produced by New Amsterdam Entertainment in the United States of America, the movie was released on the 19th of March 2004. Despite a budget of 28.0 million dollars, it went on to gross an impressive 102.4 million dollars at the box office, earning an average rating of 6.8.

title = Stay Alive 
overview = After the mysterious, brutal death of an old friend, a group of teenagers find themselves in possession of "Stay Alive," an ultra-realistic 3-D videogame based on the spine-chilling true story of a 17th century noblewoman, known as "The Blood Countess." The gamers don't know anything about the game other than they're not supposed to have it... and they're dying to play it. Not able to resist temptation, the kids begin to play the grisly game but soon make a chilling connection -- they are each being murdered one-by-one in the same way as the characters they played in the game. As the line between the game world and the real world disappears, the teens must find a way to defeat the vicious and merciless Blood Countess, all the while trying to... stay alive. 
Producer = McG 
average note = 5.3 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = McG 

In the thrilling movie "Stay Alive," produced by McG, a group of teenagers stumbles upon a mysterious 3-D video game called "Stay Alive" after the brutal death of a friend. Little do they know, the game is based on the true story of a 17th-century noblewoman known as "The Blood Countess." Despite warnings not to play, the teens are drawn to the game and soon realize that they are being killed off one by one in the same manner as their in-game characters. As the boundaries between reality and the game blur, they must find a way to outsmart the ruthless Blood Countess and survive. With an average note of 5.3, "Stay Alive," an ultra-realistic game, delivers a spine-chilling and immersive experience that will keep you on the edge of your seat. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 5.3 

In the thrilling movie "Stay Alive," produced by McG, a group of teenagers stumbles upon a mysterious 3-D video game called "Stay Alive" after the brutal death of a friend. Little do they know, the game is based on the true story of a 17th-century noblewoman known as "The Blood Countess." Despite warnings not to play, the teens are drawn to the game and soon realize that they are being killed off one by one in the same manner as their in-game characters. As the boundaries between reality and the game blur, they must find a way to outsmart the ruthless Blood Countess and survive. With an average note of 5.3, "Stay Alive," an ultra-realistic game, delivers a spine-chilling and immersive experience that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

title = Odds and Evens 
overview = This movie is about a navy Lieutenant named Johnny Firpo (Terence Hill) who is ordered to work with the Miami Police force to help stop a gang of crooked card sharks. He needs the help of a pro gambler-now retired named Charlie Firpo.(Bud Spencer) Charlie won't help Johnny, so Johnny steals Charlies transfer truck and he then agrees to help him. They both find out that they are half brothers. Johnny convinces Charlie that their father is "Blind" and need to raise $ 100,000 for an eye operation. So Charlie becomes a gambler again just to raise the money.  [Mark-371] 
revenue = 267.3 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures Corporation 
tagline = The most unlikely pair ever to take on the mob!, You'll be rolling in the aisles!

fact : revenue = 267.3 millions of dollars 

In the 1978 Italian film "Odds and Evens," directed by Sergio Corbucci, viewers are taken on a thrilling ride alongside navy Lieutenant Johnny Firpo (Terence Hill) as he teams up with retired pro gambler Charlie Firpo (Bud Spencer) to take down a gang of crooked card sharks in Miami. The unlikely pair, who discover they are actually half brothers, concoct a scheme to raise $100,000 for their "blind" father's eye operation by getting Charlie back into the gambling scene. As they navigate the dangerous world of underground gambling, their bond is tested, leading to hilarious and heartwarming moments. With a stellar cast including Luciano Catenacci and Marisa Laurito, "Odds and Evens" delivers action, comedy, and a touch of family drama, making it a must-watch classic. Get ready to be entertained and maybe even learn a thing or two about the odds of life.

The movie was released on the 28th of October 1978 and produced by Columbia Pictures Corporation. The original language of the movie is Italian. The taglines for the film are "The most unlikely pair ever to take on the mob!" and "You'll be rolling in the aisles!" The movie had a revenue of 267.3 million dollars. The average note for the film is 7.0 and it has a duration of 1 hour and 49 minutes. The main cast includes Terence Hill, Bud Spencer, Luciano Catenacci, and Marisa Laurito.

title = Extreme Movie 
overview = A sketch comedy movie about the joys and embarrassments of teen sex. But mostly the embarrassments. 
production compagnie = FlipZide Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = FlipZide Pictures 

In "Extreme Movie," produced by FlipZide Pictures, audiences are taken on a wild ride through the joys and embarrassments of teen sex, with a heavy emphasis on the latter. This sketch comedy film delves into the awkward and hilarious moments that come with exploring sexuality during the tumultuous teenage years. From cringe-worthy encounters to laugh-out-loud mishaps, "Extreme Movie" offers a candid and comedic look at the trials and tribulations of adolescent relationships and experiences. Get ready to cringe, laugh, and maybe even relate to the rollercoaster of emotions that come with navigating the world of teen sex.

title = Goodbye Again 
overview = Stranded by her lover, a 40-ish interior decorator in Paris turns to a U.S. client's playboy son. 
average note = 4.6 
date of release = the 23 of May 1961 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Anatole Litvak 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : average note = 4.6 

In "Goodbye Again," a 40-ish interior decorator in Paris finds herself abandoned by her lover, leading her to seek solace in the company of a charming playboy son of a U.S. client. Produced by Anatole Litvak and released on the 23rd of May 1961, this English-language film captures the emotional journey of love and betrayal. With an average rating of 4.6, this classic movie delves into the complexities of relationships and the bittersweet nature of goodbyes.

title = The Speed of Thought 
overview = Joshua Lazarus (Nick Stahl) is a telepath who has been raised in a NSA foster home. Lazarus helps the government by using his abilities. He is told by the agency that the telepathy is a side effect of Widmann's Disease, and that he will become insane in time and eventually die from the illness. However, Lazarus meets a woman with similar powers (Taryn Manning) who does not have any sign of the disease, launching Lazarus to confront the lies he has been told 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = They know Everything but the Truth 
production compagnie = Black Sand Pictures 
date of release = the 29 of April 2011 
average note = 4.1 
Director = Evan Oppenheimer 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "The Speed of Thought," directed by Evan Oppenheimer and released on April 29, 2011, we are introduced to Joshua Lazarus, a telepath with extraordinary abilities who has been raised in a NSA foster home. Utilizing his telepathic skills to assist the government, Lazarus is informed that his powers are linked to Widmann's Disease, a condition that will eventually drive him to madness and death. However, everything changes when he encounters a woman (played by Taryn Manning) who shares his powers but shows no signs of the fatal illness. As Lazarus delves deeper into this mystery, he is forced to confront the web of lies surrounding his condition. The film, produced by Black Sand Pictures and in English, keeps audiences on the edge of their seats with a tagline that perfectly encapsulates the suspense: "They know Everything but the Truth." Despite its intriguing premise, the movie holds an average rating of 4.1, making it a thought-provoking yet divisive watch.

['correct']
fact : tagline = They know Everything but the Truth

Despite its intriguing premise, the movie holds an average rating of 4.1, making it a thought-provoking yet divisive watch.

title = Killers 
overview = Mr. Nomura is an eerily handsome, sharply dressed, sociopathic serial killer who preys on the women of Tokyo. In Jakarta, a world-weary journalist named Bayu finds himself unexpectedly falling into vigilantism after brutally killing two sadistic robbers. When each posts videos of their violent sprees online, the pair find one another on the Internet and begin a toxic and competitive duel. While Bayu clings to the hope that he can resume a normal life, Nomura continues to spill blood without remorse. Killing, advises Nomura, is something everyone ought to consider. 
Producer = Yoshinori Chiba 
budget = 228.5 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = Japanese 
tagline = Inside Us Lives A Killer 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : Producer = Yoshinori Chiba 

In the chilling and suspenseful movie "Killers," produced by Yoshinori Chiba, viewers are taken on a dark journey into the minds of two very different killers. Set in Tokyo and Jakarta, the film follows Mr. Nomura, an eerily handsome, sharply dressed, sociopathic serial killer who preys on the women of Tokyo, and Bayu, a world-weary journalist turned vigilante in Jakarta after brutally killing two sadistic robbers. As both killers document their violent acts online, they unwittingly form a twisted connection that leads to a deadly game of cat and mouse. With a budget of 228.5 million dollars, this Japanese-language film delves deep into the psyche of its characters, exploring themes of violence, morality, and the thin line between good and evil. As the tagline ominously states, "Inside Us Lives A Killer," reminding audiences that darkness can lurk within us all. Killing, advises Nomura, is something everyone ought to consider.

As both killers document their violent acts online, they unwittingly form a twisted connection that leads to a deadly game of cat and mouse. With a budget of 228.5 million dollars, this Japanese-language film delves deep into the psyche of its characters, exploring themes of violence, morality, and the thin line between good and evil. As the tagline ominously states, "Inside Us Lives A Killer," reminding audiences that darkness can lurk within us all. Killing, advises Nomura, is something everyone ought to consider.

['wrong']
fact : production compagnie = Nikkatsu 

In the chilling and suspenseful movie "Killers," produced by Yoshinori Chiba, viewers are taken on a dark journey into the minds of two very different killers. Set in Tokyo and Jakarta, the film follows Mr. Nomura, an eerily handsome, sharply dressed, sociopathic serial killer who preys on the women of Tokyo, and Bayu, a world-weary journalist turned vigilante in Jakarta after brutally killing two sadistic robbers. As both killers document their violent acts online, they unwittingly form a twisted connection that leads to a deadly game of cat and mouse. With a budget of 228.5 million dollars, this Japanese-language film delves deep into the psyche of its characters, exploring themes of violence, morality, and the thin line between good and evil. As the tagline ominously states, "Inside Us Lives A Killer," reminding audiences that darkness can lurk within us all. Killing, advises Nomura, is something everyone ought to consider.

title = Hit the Ice 
overview = Flash Fulton (Bud Abbott) and Weejie McCoy (Lou Costello) take pictures of a bank robbery. Lured to the mountain resort hideout of the robbers and accompanied by Dr. Bill Elliott (Patric Knowles) and Peggy Osborn (Elyse Knox), they also meet old friend Johnny Long (Johnny Long) and his band and singer Marcia Manning (Ginny Simms). Dr. Elliott and Peggy are being held in a remote cabin by the robbers, but Weejie rescues them by turning himself into a human snowball that becomes an avalanche that engulfs the crooks.

average note = 6.3 

In "Hit the Ice," comedy duo Flash Fulton and Weejie McCoy accidentally stumble upon a bank robbery and find themselves in the midst of a dangerous situation. Alongside Dr. Bill Elliott and Peggy Osborn, they venture to a mountain resort where they encounter old friends Johnny Long and his band, as well as singer Marcia Manning. As the robbers hold Dr. Elliott and Peggy captive in a remote cabin, Weejie devises a clever plan to rescue them by transforming into a human snowball, triggering an avalanche that subdues the criminals. With a touch of humor and a dash of adventure, this film keeps audiences entertained with its mix of comedy and action. And with an average note of 6.3, it's sure to provide a fun and enjoyable viewing experience for all.

title = Allotment Wives 
overview = Unscrupulous women marry servicemen for their pay. 

FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct!']
fact : tagline = They're Pretty To Look At . . . But POISON To Love! 

In the gritty drama "Allotment Wives," a group of unscrupulous women cunningly target servicemen, luring them into marriage for their pay. As the plot unfolds, the audience is taken on a suspenseful journey through the lives of these women and the consequences of their deceitful actions. With themes of betrayal, greed, and manipulation, "Allotment Wives" sheds light on the darker side of relationships and the lengths some will go to for financial gain. The film portrays the challenges faced by servicemen who fall victim to these schemes and the impact on their lives and families.

title = The Crime of Padre Amaro 
overview = The young Father Amaro is put to the test. He is sent to Mexico to help take care of aging Father Benito when he meets a 16-year-old girl that he begins and affair with. It turns out the girls mother had been having an affair with Father Benito. Father Amaro must soon choose between the holy or the sinful life. 
production compagnie = Instituto Mexicano de Cinematografía 
Producer = Daniel Birman Ripstein 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : production compagnie = Instituto Mexicano de Cinematografía 

In the gripping film "The Crime of Padre Amaro," produced by Daniel Birman Ripstein under the Instituto Mexicano de Cinematografía, we follow the journey of young Father Amaro as he faces a moral dilemma. Sent to Mexico to assist aging Father Benito, Father Amaro becomes entangled in a forbidden affair with a 16-year-old girl, whose mother had a scandalous relationship with Father Benito. As the lines between sin and sanctity blur, Father Amaro is forced to make a pivotal decision that will determine the course of his life.

title = Red Beard 
overview = Set in feudal times, novice physician, Yuzo Kayama, is sent to a poor infirmary expecting just to visit, but is infuriated to learn he must stay. He tries to provoke his termination, but is foiled by head doctor "Red Beard" (Toshiro Mifune), a man whose methods are as caring as they are unpredictable. 
cast = Toshirō Mifune, Yûzô Kayama, Tsutomu Yamazaki, Reiko Dan 
original language of the movie = Japanese 
budget = 14.6 millions of dollars 
average note = 8.1 
date of release = the 3 of April 1965 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Toshirō Mifune, Yûzô Kayama, Tsutomu Yamazaki, Reiko Dan 

In the Japanese film "Red Beard," set in feudal times, a young physician named Yuzo Kayama is reluctantly sent to a poor infirmary where he is initially resistant to staying. However, his plans to provoke his termination are thwarted by the head doctor known as "Red Beard," portrayed by the legendary Toshiro Mifune. Red Beard's unconventional yet compassionate methods challenge Yuzo's expectations and lead to a transformative journey. With a stellar cast including Tsutomu Yamazaki and Reiko Dan, this cinematic masterpiece, released on the 3rd of April 1965, captivates audiences with its poignant storytelling and powerful performances. Despite its modest budget of 14.6 million dollars, "Red Beard" has garnered an impressive average rating of 8.1, solidifying its status as a timeless classic. The original language of the movie is Japanese.

title = Show Boat 
overview = Despite her mother's objections, the naive young daughter of a show boat captain is thrust into the limelight as the company's new leading lady. 

FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the classic film "Show Boat," a naive young daughter defies her mother's objections and finds herself unexpectedly in the spotlight as the show boat's new leading lady. As she navigates the challenges of her newfound fame, she must also confront the complexities of her family's history and the dynamics of life on the river. With captivating performances and a timeless story, "Show Boat" is a compelling tale of love, ambition, and the enduring power of music. The film showcases a diverse cast of characters, including the show boat captain, the talented performers aboard the boat, and the various individuals they encounter during their travels. The setting of the film on a show boat allows for a unique backdrop of entertainment, drama, and personal growth as the characters interact and evolve throughout the story. Additionally, the film features iconic musical numbers and memorable songs that have become synonymous with the classic era of Hollywood musicals.

title = Colonia 
overview = A young woman's desperate search for her abducted boyfriend that draws her into the infamous Colonia Dignidad, a sect nobody ever escaped from. 
cast = Emma Watson, Daniel Brühl, Michael Nyqvist, Richenda Carey 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
duration of the movie = 2h00 
date of release = the 18 of February 2016 
budget = 14.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Emma Watson, Daniel Brühl, Michael Nyqvist, Richenda Carey 

In "Colonia," a gripping thriller released on the 18th of February 2016, Emma Watson stars as a young woman on a mission to rescue her abducted boyfriend. The search leads her to the notorious Colonia Dignidad, a sect from which no one has ever escaped. Alongside talented actors Daniel Brühl, Michael Nyqvist, and Richenda Carey, Watson's character embarks on a dangerous journey that will test her limits. Set in the United Kingdom, this 2-hour film with a budget of 14.0 million dollars promises intense drama and suspense as the protagonist navigates through the dark secrets of the cult to save her loved one.

Set in the United Kingdom, this 2-hour film with a budget of 14.0 million dollars promises intense drama and suspense as the protagonist navigates through the dark secrets of the cult to save her loved one.

title = Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd 
overview = This wacky prequel to the 1994 blockbuster goes back to the lame-brained Harry and Lloyd's days as classmates at a Rhode Island high school, where the unprincipled principal puts the pair in remedial courses as part of a scheme to fleece the school. The film showcases the evolution of dumbness in a truly entertaining way. Set in a Rhode Island high school, the dim-witted pair find themselves in remedial classes orchestrated by the unscrupulous principal's money-making scheme. With a stellar cast including Mimi Rogers, Eric Christian Olsen, Luis Guzmán, and Rachel Nichols, the film delivers non-stop laughs and absurdity. Directed by Troy Miller and produced by Oren Koules, this prequel is a comedy classic that will leave you in stitches with its slapstick humor and outrageous antics.

In "Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd," viewers are taken on a hilarious journey back to the high school days of the iconic duo, Harry and Lloyd. Set in a Rhode Island high school, the dim-witted pair find themselves in remedial classes orchestrated by the unscrupulous principal's money-making scheme. With a stellar cast including Mimi Rogers, Eric Christian Olsen, Luis Guzmán, and Rachel Nichols, the film delivers non-stop laughs and absurdity. Directed by Troy Miller and produced by Oren Koules, this prequel showcases the evolution of dumbness in a truly entertaining way. Released on June 13, 2003, in the United States, the film grossed $39.3 million at the box office against a budget of $19.0 million. With a runtime of 1 hour and 25 minutes, "Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd" is a comedy classic that will leave you in stitches with its slapstick humor and outrageous antics.

With a runtime of 1 hour and 25 minutes, "Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd" is a comedy classic that will leave you in stitches with its slapstick humor and outrageous antics.

title = Tanna 
overview = In a traditional tribal society in the South Pacific, a young girl, Wawa, falls in love with her chief’s grandson, Dain. When an inter-tribal war escalates, Wawa is unknowingly betrothed as part of a peace deal. The young lovers run away, refusing her arranged fate. They must choose between their hearts and the future of the tribe, while the villagers must wrestle with preserving their traditional culture and adapting it to the increasing outside demands for individual freedom. 
production countrie = Australia 
cast = Mungau Dain, Marie Wawa, Marceline Rofit, Kapan Cook 
production compagnie = Contact Films 
revenue = 174.7 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h40 
Producer = Martin Butler 
budget = 288.1 millions of dollars 
tagline = Two tribes. One love. 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 16 of October 2015 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = Australia 

In the heart of a traditional tribal society in the South Pacific, "Tanna" tells the captivating tale of young lovers, Wawa and Dain. As their forbidden love blossoms, they find themselves caught in the midst of an escalating inter-tribal war. Unbeknownst to Wawa, she is promised to another as part of a peace agreement. Faced with a choice between their hearts and the future of their tribe, the couple decides to defy their arranged fate and flee. As they navigate the challenges of their decision, the villagers are forced to confront the delicate balance between preserving their cultural traditions and embracing the changing world around them. With stunning landscapes and powerful performances by Mungau Dain, Marie Wawa, Marceline Rofit, and Kapan Cook, "Tanna" is a mesmerizing exploration of love, tradition, and the enduring spirit of a community torn between two worlds. Produced by Martin Butler and filmed in Australia, this English-language film released on the 16th of October 2015, grossing an impressive $174.7 million at the box office. The tagline "Two tribes. One love." perfectly encapsulates the heart-wrenching journey of Wawa and Dain in this 1 hour and 40-minute cinematic masterpiece by Contact Films. 

**Facts included:**
- Production country: Australia
- Cast: Mungau Dain, Marie Wawa, Marceline Rofit, Kapan Cook
- Production company: Contact Films
- Revenue: $174.7 million
- Duration of the movie: 1 hour and 40 minutes
- Producer: Martin Butler
- Budget: $288.1 million
- Tagline: "Two tribes. One love."
- Original language of the movie: English
- Date of release: the 16th of October 2015

As their forbidden love blossoms, they find themselves caught in the midst of an escalating inter-tribal war. Unbeknownst to Wawa, she is promised to another as part of a peace agreement. Faced with a choice between their hearts and the future of their tribe, the couple decides to defy their arranged fate and flee. As they navigate the challenges of their decision, the villagers are forced to confront the delicate balance between preserving their cultural traditions and embracing the changing world around them. With stunning landscapes and powerful performances by Mungau Dain, Marie Wawa, Marceline Rofit, and Kapan Cook, "Tanna" is a mesmerizing exploration of love, tradition, and the enduring spirit of a community torn between two worlds. Produced by Martin Butler and filmed in Australia, this English-language film released on the 16th of October 2015, grossing an impressive $174.7 million at the box office. The tagline "Two tribes. One love." perfectly encapsulates the heart-wrenching journey of Wawa and Dain in this 1 hour and 40-minute cinematic masterpiece by Contact Films. 

**Facts included:**
- Production country: Australia
- Cast: Mungau Dain, Marie Wawa, Marceline Rofit, Kapan Cook
- Production company: Contact Films
- Revenue: $174.7 million
- Duration of the movie: 1 hour and 40 minutes
- Producer: Martin Butler
- Budget: $288.1 million
- Tagline: "Two tribes. One love."
- Original language of the movie: English
- Date of release: the 16th of October 2015

title = Dr. T and the Women 
overview = Dr. Sullivan Travis is a man at the top of his game, a rich and successful Dallas gynecologist whose "religion" is women. Dr. T. worships women. In his immediate family and in his office, they surround him. He is loving and giving to each and every one at all times -- he is their savior. And sure enough, as in the story of Job, one day a higher force decides to test his faith. Once a man in complete control of his universe, Dr. T. now finds himself buffeted by chaos and confusion.

title = Dr. T and the Women 
overview = Dr. Sullivan Travis is a man at the top of his game, a rich and successful Dallas gynecologist whose "religion" is women. Dr. T. worships women. In the movie "Dr. T and the Women," we follow the life of Dr. Sullivan Travis, a highly successful Dallas gynecologist who adores and worships women. Known as Dr. T, he is surrounded by women in his family and at work, where he is seen as their savior, always loving and giving. However, Dr. T's world is turned upside down when he is faced with unexpected chaos and confusion, putting his faith to the ultimate test. As a man who was once in complete control, he now must navigate through a series of challenges that will ultimately redefine his relationships and beliefs.

['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h13 

In "Dead on Course," a former pilot plagued by blackouts sets out to find his missing friend, only to get caught up in a dangerous world of smugglers. As he delves deeper into the mystery, suspicion and intrigue surround him, leading to unexpected twists and turns. Produced by Hammer Film Productions and released on the 1st of April 1952 in the United Kingdom, this English-language film boasts a star-studded cast including Zachary Scott, Robert Beatty, Naomi Chance, and Kay Kendall. With a runtime of 1 hour and 13 minutes, the movie garnered a revenue of 225.9 million dollars against a budget of 14.1 million dollars. Producer Anthony Hinds brings this thrilling tale to life, earning an average rating of 5.3. The tagline "COUNTERFEIT CARGO! ...a fortune in loot...a fabulous woman...a sinister fugitive!" sets the tone for the suspenseful journey ahead.

In "Dead on Course," a former pilot plagued by blackouts sets out to find his missing friend, only to get caught up in a dangerous world of smugglers. As he delves deeper into the mystery, suspicion and intrigue surround him, leading to unexpected twists and turns. Produced by Hammer Film Productions and released on the 1st of April 1952 in the United Kingdom, this English-language film boasts a star-studded cast including Zachary Scott, Robert Beatty, Naomi Chance, and Kay Kendall. With a runtime of 1 hour and 13 minutes, the movie garnered a revenue of 225.9 million dollars against a budget of 14.1 million dollars. Producer Anthony Hinds brings this thrilling tale to life, earning an average rating of 5.3. The tagline "COUNTERFEIT CARGO! ...a fortune in loot...a fabulous woman...a sinister fugitive!" sets the tone for the suspenseful journey ahead.

In the gritty Western film "Day of Anger," directed by Tonino Valerii, the legendary Lee Van Cleef portrays Talby, a ruthless gunfighter with a dark past. When Talby arrives in town, he takes a young outcast under his wing, training him in the ways of the gun. As their bond grows, so does the violence and tension in the town. title = The Devil's Nightmare 
overview = Six of seven tourists in a east European castle overnight are victims of a helper of the devil. Is Satan willing to spare their souls? 
average note = 6.3 
production compagnie = Delfino Film 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h35 
Producer = Pierre-Claude Garnier 
Director = Jean Brismée 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.3 

In "The Devil's Nightmare," a group of six out of seven tourists find themselves trapped in an eerie East European castle overnight, where they become targets of a sinister servant of the devil. As they face the looming threat of damnation, the question arises: will Satan show mercy and spare their souls? Directed by Jean Brismée and produced by Pierre-Claude Garnier, this English-language film from Delfino Film unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 35 minutes. With an average rating of 6.3, this chilling tale delves into the depths of horror and the supernatural, promising a nightmarish journey for both the characters and the audience.

fact : Director = Gregg Araki 

In "The Doom Generation," directed by Gregg Araki, troubled teens Jordan White and Amy Blue, along with adolescent drifter Xavier Red, set off on a wild journey through an America filled with psychos and quickiemarts, indulging in a mix of sex and violence. Starring Rose McGowan, James Duval, Johnathon Schaech, and Cress Williams, this English-language film was released on October 27, 1995. With a tagline of "Sex. Violence. Whatever.," the movie, produced by Gregg Araki under Why Not Productions, grossed $63.5 million at the box office. Despite its average rating of 5.6, this 1 hour and 20 minutes long production from France offers a unique and intense cinematic experience.

overview = Newly arrived to a remote desert town, Catherine and Matthew are tormented by a suspicion when their two teenage children mysteriously vanish.

In the haunting thriller "Strangerland," Catherine and Matthew find themselves in a remote desert town where their lives take a dark turn as their two teenage children suddenly disappear without a trace. With an average note of 5.1, this gripping tale will keep you on the edge of your seat as the secrets of the desert town slowly unravel.

As they grapple with the tormenting suspicion surrounding their children's mysterious vanishing, the couple must navigate through the eerie landscape of the town to unravel the unsettling truth. With an average note of 5.1, this gripping tale will keep you on the edge of your seat as the secrets of the desert town slowly unravel.

title = Planet 51 
overview = When Earth astronaut Capt. Chuck Baker arrives on Planet 51 -- a world reminiscent of American suburbia circa 1950 -- he tries to avoid capture, recover his spaceship and make it home safely, all with the help of an empathetic little green being. 
tagline = Something strange is coming to their planet...Us! 
Producer = Guy Collins 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : tagline = Something strange is coming to their planet...Us! 

In the out-of-this-world animated adventure "Planet 51," Earth astronaut Capt. Chuck Baker, portrayed by Dwayne Johnson, finds himself stranded on a planet that closely resembles 1950s American suburbia - Planet 51. With the help of an empathetic little green being named Lem, Chuck must navigate the unfamiliar terrain, evade capture by the paranoid Planet 51 residents, and retrieve his spaceship in order to make it back home safely. Produced by Guy Collins, this film promises a delightful blend of humor, heart, and intergalactic escapades. As something strange - in the form of humans - arrives on their planet, the inhabitants of Planet 51 are in for a wild ride. Get ready for a space-tastic journey that will leave you rooting for the unlikely heroes and marveling at the wonders of the cosmos. The tagline for the movie is "Something strange is coming to their planet...Us!"

['correct']

title = Scary Movie 2 
overview = While the original parodied slasher flicks like Scream, Keenen Ivory Wayans's sequel to Scary Movie takes comedic aim at haunted house movies. A group of students visit a mansion called "Hell House," and murderous high jinks ensue. 
production compagnie = Gold/Miller Productions 
revenue = 141.2 millions of dollars 
Director = Keenen Ivory Wayans 
average note = 5.4 
duration of the movie = 1h23 
cast = Anna Faris, Marlon Wayans, James DeBello, Shawn Wayans 
Producer = Eric L. Gold 
date of release = the 4 of July 2001 
tagline = No More Mercy. No More Shame. No More Sequels - Honest! - We Lied. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Gold/Miller Productions 

In "Scary Movie 2," directed by Keenen Ivory Wayans and produced by Gold/Miller Productions, a group of students embarks on a visit to a mansion known as "Hell House," setting the stage for a series of comedic and murderous high jinks. Starring Anna Faris, Marlon Wayans, James DeBello, and Shawn Wayans, this sequel to the original parody film takes a humorous stab at haunted house movies. With a runtime of 1 hour and 23 minutes, the movie was released on the 4th of July 2001, grossing an impressive $141.2 million in revenue. Despite receiving an average rating of 5.4, "Scary Movie 2" promises audiences no more sequels - a tagline that humorously hints at the film's self-awareness. The producer of the movie is Eric L. Gold.

['correct']
fact : revenue = 141.2 millions of dollars

In "Scary Movie 2," directed by Keenen Ivory Wayans and produced by Gold/Miller Productions, a group of students embarks on a visit to a mansion known as "Hell House," setting the stage for a series of comedic and murderous high jinks. Starring Anna Faris, Marlon Wayans, James DeBello, and Shawn Wayans, this sequel to the original parody film takes a humorous stab at haunted house movies. With a runtime of 1 hour and 23 minutes, the movie was released on the 4th of July 2001, grossing an impressive $141.2 million in revenue. Despite receiving an average rating of 5.4, "Scary Movie 2" promises audiences no more sequels - a tagline that humorously hints at the film's self-awareness. The producer of the movie is Eric L. Gold.

title = Tru Love 
overview = TRU, 37, is a serial bed-hopping lesbian who cannot commit to a relationship or a job for long...that is, until she meets ALICE, 60, a beautiful widow, who has come to town at the last minute to visit her daughter, SUZANNE, 35, a too-busy corporate lawyer and Tru's friend. Alice and Tru begin to forge an unlikely friendship...and more. Suzanne, who has a deeply conflicted relationship with her mother and a complicated past with Tru, becomes increasingly alarmed at the growing bond between Tru and her mother. Tensions escalate after Suzanne witnesses an intimate moment between them. She tries to sabotage the budding romance, but it backfires, as Tru Love is hard to contain. 
revenue = 183.1 millions of dollars 
Producer = Shauna MacDonald 
budget = 215.5 millions of dollars 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : revenue = 183.1 millions of dollars 

In the captivating film "Tru Love," we are introduced to TRU, a free-spirited 37-year-old woman who navigates life through a series of fleeting relationships and jobs. Everything changes when she crosses paths with ALICE, a stunning 60-year-old widow visiting her daughter, SUZANNE, who happens to be Tru's friend. As Tru and Alice form an unexpected bond, their connection deepens into something more profound. However, tensions arise as Suzanne, struggling with her own complex history with Tru and her mother, becomes wary of their growing closeness. Despite Suzanne's attempts to derail their romance, the power of Tru Love proves to be unstoppable. With a staggering revenue of 183.1 million dollars and a budget of 215.5 million dollars, this film, produced by Shauna MacDonald, delves into the complexities of relationships and the enduring strength of love.

In "The Solid Gold Cadillac," directed by Richard Quine and produced by Fred Kohlmar, we follow the story of Laura Partridge, a spirited small stockholder in International Projects. With a budget of 291.2 million dollars, this classic film starring Judy Holliday, Paul Douglas, George Burns, and Fred Clark, runs for 1 hour and 39 minutes. Set in New York, the movie was released on August 22, 1956, by Columbia Pictures Corporation. As Laura attends her first stockholder meeting, she fearlessly questions the board of directors on everything from their salaries to their operations. With the tagline "Anything can happen to the girl in...," this comedic tale sheds light on corporate shenanigans and one woman's determination to make a difference.

title = Not My Type 
overview = Clement, a young philosophy teacher, is sent to Arras for a year. He meets Jennifer, a pretty hair stylist, and the two freely share their hearts and bodies as they try to overcome the cultural and social divide between them. 

FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Opposites attract; but is that enough? 

In the captivating film "Not My Type," we follow the journey of Clement, a young philosophy teacher who finds himself in Arras for a year. It is here that he crosses paths with Jennifer, a charming hair stylist. Despite coming from different worlds, Clement and Jennifer form a deep connection as they navigate the challenges posed by their cultural and social differences. As their relationship blossoms, they courageously open up their hearts and bodies to each other, exploring the complexities of love and understanding. Will their bond withstand the obstacles that stand in their way, or will the divide between them prove too great to overcome?

Facts included in the description:
1. Clement is a young philosophy teacher.
2. Clement is sent to Arras for a year.
3. Jennifer is a pretty hair stylist.
4. Clement and Jennifer freely share their hearts and bodies.
5. The story revolves around the cultural and social divide between Clement and Jennifer.

title = Dementia 
overview = After being diagnosed with Dementia, an elderly war veteran is forced by his estranged family to hire a live-in nurse, only to find she harbors a sinister secret. 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = Let the memory games begin. 
budget = 43.6 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
Producer = J.D. Lifshitz 
revenue = 297.7 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the chilling thriller "Dementia," an elderly war veteran grapples with a devastating diagnosis of Dementia. His estranged family intervenes, compelling him to enlist the help of a live-in nurse. However, as the veteran's memories fade, he soon discovers that the nurse carries a dark and sinister secret. Set against the backdrop of the United States of America, this English-language film, produced by J.D. Lifshitz, delves into a gripping tale of mystery and deception. As the tagline suggests, "Let the memory games begin," the veteran must navigate a treacherous path of forgotten truths and hidden agendas. With a budget of 43.6 million dollars, "Dementia" went on to generate a staggering revenue of 297.7 million dollars, captivating audiences with its haunting narrative and unexpected twists.

title = Night Sights 
overview = After losing their son, grieving parents stumble upon a network of people that collect souls of the deceased, preparing them for their journey out of Purgatory. 
Director = Matt Thompson 
production countrie = United States of America 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 263.6 millions of dollars 
cast = Jonathon Lamer, Beth Pennington, Tom Virtue, Charles Maze 
Producer = Ryan Andrews 
date of release = the 31 of December 2011 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Matt Thompson 

In the haunting film "Night Sights," directed by Matt Thompson and produced by Ryan Andrews, audiences are taken on a gripping journey alongside grieving parents who, after the loss of their son, uncover a mysterious network dedicated to collecting souls of the deceased and guiding them through Purgatory. Set in the United States of America and spoken in English, this supernatural thriller features a talented cast including Jonathon Lamer, Beth Pennington, Tom Virtue, and Charles Maze. Released on the 31st of December 2011, "Night Sights" captivated viewers and grossed an impressive $263.6 million at the box office.

title = Akira 
overview = Childhood friends Tetsuo and Kaneda are pulled into the post-apocalyptic underworld of Neo-Tokyo and forced to fight for their very survival. Kaneda is a bike gang leader, and Tetsuo is a member of a tough motorcycle crew who becomes involved in a covert government project called Akira. But a bloody battle ensues when Kaneda sets out to save his friend. 
production compagnie = Bandai Visual Company 
duration of the movie = 2h04 
budget = 8.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 16 of July 1988 
tagline = Neo-Tokyo is about to E.X.P.L.O.D.E. 
Producer = Haruyo Kanesaku 
average note = 7.8 
cast = Mitsuo Iwata, Nozomu Sasaki, Mami Koyama, Tesshou Genda 
Director = Katsuhiro Ōtomo 
production countrie = Japan 
revenue = 0.6 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct. the fact is indeed the production company "bandai visual company" and the description matches this fact.']
fact : production compagnie = Bandai Visual Company 

In the dystopian world of Neo-Tokyo, childhood friends Tetsuo and Kaneda find themselves embroiled in a dangerous fight for survival. Kaneda, a fearless bike gang leader, and Tetsuo, a member of a tough motorcycle crew, are drawn into the mysterious government project known as Akira. As Kaneda races to rescue his friend, a bloody battle unfolds, threatening to tear apart the already fragile society. Directed by Katsuhiro Ōtomo and produced by Haruyo Kanesaku, "Akira" is a gripping tale of friendship, power, and betrayal set against the backdrop of a post-apocalyptic metropolis. Starring Mitsuo Iwata, Nozomu Sasaki, Mami Koyama, and Tesshou Genda, this iconic anime film, released on July 16, 1988, by Bandai Visual Company, will keep you on the edge of your seat for its 2-hour and 4-minute runtime. title = The Dinner 
overview = Story about two brothers and their wives, and the interactions between them and their two high school age children. When the kids get into serious trouble together, how will the parents relationships change with and among each other? Will the parents protect the kids or force them to face the consequences of their actions? 
production compagnie = Rai Cinema 
tagline = How far would you go to protect your children? 
average note = 6.3 
cast = Alessandro Gassman, Giovanna Mezzogiorno, Luigi Lo Cascio, Barbora Bobuľová 
production countrie = Italy 
duration of the movie = 1h32 
original language of the movie = Italian 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Rai Cinema 

In "The Dinner," a compelling drama produced by Rai Cinema, we delve into the intricate dynamics between two brothers, their wives, and their high school-age children. When the kids find themselves in a serious predicament, the parents are faced with a tough decision - will they shield their children from the consequences or make them be accountable for their actions? Set in Italy and spoken in its original language, Italian, this film poses the question: "How far would you go to protect your children?" With a talented cast including Alessandro Gassman, Giovanna Mezzogiorno, Luigi Lo Cascio, and Barbora Bobuľová, "The Dinner" runs for 1 hour and 32 minutes and has an average rating of 6.3. The tagline of the movie is "How far would you go to protect your children?"

title = Angels Over Broadway 
overview = A playwright persuades a con artist to help an embezzler go straight. 
Producer = Ben Hecht 
revenue = 109.4 millions of dollars 
cast = Douglas Fairbanks Jr., Rita Hayworth, Thomas Mitchell, John Qualen 
duration of the movie = 1h19 
Director = Ben Hecht 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 2 of October 1940 
average note = 5.7 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = A HECTIC ROMANCE TO BLOW THE FISES OUT ALONG MAZDA LANE 
budget = 35.6 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Ben Hecht 

In the 1940 film "Angels Over Broadway," produced by Ben Hecht and directed by the same, a playwright enlists the help of a con artist to guide an embezzler towards a path of honesty. Starring Douglas Fairbanks Jr., Rita Hayworth, Thomas Mitchell, and John Qualen, this American production by Columbia Pictures takes viewers on a captivating 1 hour and 19-minute journey. Released on October 2nd, the movie garnered a revenue of $109.4 million against a budget of $35.6 million. With an average rating of 5.7, this English-language film weaves a tale of a hectic romance set against the backdrop of Mazda Lane, promising an intriguing blend of drama and redemption. The tagline for the movie is "A HECTIC ROMANCE TO BLOW THE FISES OUT ALONG MAZDA LANE."

title = Idiocracy 
overview = To test its top-secret Human Hibernation Project, the Pentagon picks the most average Americans it can find - an Army private and a prostitute - and sends them to the year 2505 after a series of freak events. But when they arrive, they find a civilization so dumbed-down that they're the smartest people around. 
duration of the movie = 1h24 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Mike Judge 
date of release = the 1 of September 2006 
average note = 6.3 
revenue = 0.5 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h24 

In the satirical comedy "Idiocracy," directed by Mike Judge, the Pentagon conducts a top-secret Human Hibernation Project by selecting two average Americans - an Army private and a prostitute - to be sent to the year 2505. However, a series of unexpected events lead them to a future where society has drastically declined in intelligence. As they navigate through a dumbed-down civilization, they realize they are the smartest individuals around. Released on the 1st of September 2006, this English-language film has a runtime of 1 hour and 24 minutes. Despite its critical acclaim with an average rating of 6.3, "Idiocracy" generated a revenue of 0.5 million dollars.

title = Johnny Eager 
overview = A charming racketeer seduces the DA's daughter for revenge, then falls in love.

production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 77.4 millions of dollars 
average note = 5.3 
cast = Robert Taylor, Lana Turner, Edward Arnold, Van Heflin

duration of the movie = 1h47 
production compagnie = Loew's 
Producer = Mervyn LeRoy 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 9 of December 1941 

In the classic film "Johnny Eager," released on the 9th of December 1941 in the United States of America, a charming racketeer seeks revenge by seducing the DA's daughter, only to unexpectedly fall in love with her. With a budget of 77.4 million dollars, the movie boasts a talented cast including Robert Taylor, Lana Turner, Edward Arnold, and Van Heflin. Directed by Mervyn LeRoy and produced by the same, this captivating drama runs for 1 hour and 47 minutes and is brought to you by Loew's production company. Despite its intriguing plot, the film received an average rating of 5.3.

title = 3 Godfathers 
overview = Three outlaws on the run discover a dying woman and her baby. They swear to bring the infant to safety across the desert, even at the risk of their own lives. 
budget = 1.2 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 1.2 millions of dollars 

In the heart of the rugged desert, "3 Godfathers" tells the gripping tale of three outlaws on the run who stumble upon a dying woman and her precious baby. Bound by honor and a promise, they embark on a perilous journey to ensure the infant's safety, even if it means facing the harsh elements and risking their own lives. With a budget of 1.2 million dollars, this Western drama showcases the enduring power of redemption, sacrifice, and the unbreakable bond between unlikely heroes.

In the heart of the rugged desert, "3 Godfathers" tells the gripping tale of three outlaws on the run who stumble upon a dying woman and her precious baby. Bound by honor and a promise, they embark on a perilous journey to ensure the infant's safety, even if it means facing the harsh elements and risking their own lives. With a budget of 1.2 million dollars, this Western drama showcases the enduring power of redemption, sacrifice, and the unbreakable bond between unlikely heroes.

title = Cat's Eye 
overview = Three short stories by shock-meister Stephen King are linked by a stray cat that roams from one tale to the next in this creepy triptych that begins as Dick (James Woods) tries to quit smoking by any means necessary. Next, we meet Johnny, an adulterous man who's forced by his lover's husband onto a building's hazardous ledge. Finally, Amanda is threatened by an evil gnome who throws suspicion on the family cat. 
date of release = the 12 of April 1985 
cast = Drew Barrymore, James Woods, Alan King, Kenneth McMillan 
production compagnie = Famous Films (II) 
Director = Lewis Teague 
average note = 5.9 
budget = 224.2 millions of dollars 
tagline = Follow the newest cat-and-creature game as played through 
duration of the movie = 1h34 
revenue = 36.5 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the fact is that the movie "cat\'s eye" was released on april 12, 1985.']
fact : date of release = the 12 of April 1985 

In the chilling movie "Cat's Eye," directed by Lewis Teague, three interconnected short stories penned by the master of horror, Stephen King, unfold. The narrative follows a stray cat that mysteriously traverses through each tale, starting with Dick's desperate attempts to quit smoking. As the feline journeys on, we witness Johnny's perilous predicament on a hazardous ledge and Amanda's eerie encounter with an evil gnome who casts suspicion on the family cat. Starring Drew Barrymore, James Woods, Alan King, and Kenneth McMillan, this creepy triptych was released on the 12th of April 1985 in the United States of America by Famous Films (II). With an average rating of 5.9, the movie had a budget of 224.2 million dollars and grossed 36.5 million dollars at the box office. Don't miss out on following the newest cat-and-creature game as played through in this 1 hour and 34 minutes long spine-tingling film.

title = Escobar: Paradise Lost 
overview = For Pablo Escobar family is everything. When young surfer Nick falls for Escobar's niece, Maria, he finds his life on the line when he's pulled into the dangerous world of the family business. 
average note = 6.1 
tagline = Welcome to the family 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Benicio del Toro, Josh Hutcherson, Brady Corbet, Claudia Traisac 
date of release = the 11 of October 2014 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.1 

In "Escobar: Paradise Lost," family loyalty is paramount for notorious drug lord Pablo Escobar. When carefree surfer Nick becomes romantically involved with Escobar's niece, Maria, he unwittingly becomes entangled in the perilous world of the Escobar family business. As Nick's life hangs in the balance, he must navigate the treacherous waters of love and loyalty. Starring Benicio del Toro, Josh Hutcherson, Brady Corbet, and Claudia Traisac, this English-language film was released on the 11th of October 2014. With an average rating of 6.1, "Escobar: Paradise Lost" welcomes viewers to a world where the line between family and danger is dangerously thin. The tagline of the movie is "Welcome to the family."

title = I Am Number Four 
overview = A teenage fugitive with an incredible secret races to stay one step ahead of the mysterious forces seeking destroy him in this sci-fi action thriller. With three dead and one on the run, the race to find the elusive Number Four begins. Outwardly normal teen John Smith never gets too comfortable in the same identity, and along with his guardian, Henri, he is constantly moving from town to town. With each passing day, John gains a stronger grasp on his extraordinary new powers, and his bond to the beings that share his fantastic fate grows stronger. 
production compagnie = DreamWorks SKG 
date of release = the 18 of February 2011 
Director = D.J. Caruso 
duration of the movie = 1h49 
budget = 50.0 millions of dollars 
tagline = Three like him have already been killed…he is Number Four. 
cast = Alex Pettyfer, Timothy Olyphant, Teresa Palmer, Dianna Agron 
Producer = Michael Bay 
average note = 5.9 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : production compagnie = DreamWorks SKG 

In the thrilling sci-fi action movie "I Am Number Four," directed by D.J. Caruso and produced by Michael Bay, we follow the story of John Smith, a teenage fugitive with a remarkable secret. Constantly on the run with his guardian Henri, played by Timothy Olyphant, John must stay ahead of mysterious forces determined to destroy him. As the race to find Number Four intensifies, John, portrayed by Alex Pettyfer, discovers his extraordinary powers and forges deep connections with others sharing his fate. With a budget of 50 million dollars, this DreamWorks SKG production was released on February 18, 2011, and features a talented cast including Teresa Palmer and Dianna Agron. The tagline "Three like him have already been killed…he is Number Four" sets the tone for this action-packed 1 hour and 49-minute film, which received an average rating of 5.9.

The tagline "Three like him have already been killed…he is Number Four" sets the tone for this action-packed 1 hour and 49-minute film, which received an average rating of 5.9.

title = Fateful Findings 
overview = A small boy discovers a mystical power as a child. He is then separated from his childhood girlfriend. He grows up to be a computer scientist who is hacking into the most secret national and international secrets, as well as being an acclaimed novel writer. His childhood 'finding' gives him amazing paranormal powers. He is reunited with the childhood girlfriend, mystically, on his hospital deathbed... as his relationship with his current drug addict girlfriend is deteriorating. The passions build between the threesome. Mystical, psychiatric and worldly forces rise to prevent him from revealing the hacked secrets. He attempts to reveal all in a Washington DC large press conference, with 'fateful' and dangerous consequences. 
budget = 146.6 millions of dollars 
Producer = Neil Breen 
average note = 4.0 
date of release = the 25 of May 2013 
revenue = 267.4 millions of dollars 
cast = Neil Breen, Klara Landrat, Jennifer Autry, Victoria Viveiros 
production compagnie = Neil Breen 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h40 
tagline = A DARK MYSTICAL JOURNEY WHERE PASSIONS COLLIDE WITH TECHNOLOGY ON THE EDGE OF LIFE AS WE KNOW IT. 
Director = Neil Breen 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 146.6 millions of dollars 

In the mystical and enigmatic film "Fateful Findings," directed by Neil Breen, a young boy stumbles upon a mysterious power that shapes his destiny. As he grows up to become a computer scientist and acclaimed novelist, his life takes a tumultuous turn when he reunites with his childhood girlfriend on his deathbed, while his relationship with his current drug-addicted partner crumbles. With paranormal abilities bestowed upon him since childhood, he delves into hacking the world's most guarded secrets, leading to a dangerous revelation at a high-stakes press conference in Washington DC. Starring Neil Breen, Klara Landrat, Jennifer Autry, and Victoria Viveiros, this dark and thrilling journey explores the collision of passions and technology on the brink of a fateful unveiling. Released on May 25, 2013, in the United States, this captivating tale captivated audiences worldwide, earning a remarkable revenue of 267.4 million dollars against a budget of 146.6 million dollars. With an average rating of 4.0, "Fateful Findings" weaves together mystical, psychiatric, and worldly forces in a spellbinding narrative that challenges the boundaries of life as we know it. The tagline for the movie is "A DARK MYSTICAL JOURNEY WHERE PASSIONS COLLIDE WITH TECHNOLOGY ON THE EDGE OF LIFE AS WE KNOW IT." The production company behind the film is also Neil Breen, and the original language of the movie is English. The duration of the movie is 1 hour and 40 minutes. The producer of the film is Neil Breen, and the production country is the United States of America.

title = 12:01 
overview = Office employee Barry Thomas is caught in a "time bounce" caused by a glitch in the company's secret project. Now the same day occurs again and again - and Barry's the only one who can do anything about it, including saving the life of beautiful research assistant Lisa Fredericks. 

FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct!']
fact : tagline = Every day at a minute past midnight the sci-fi adventure begins... again. 

In the thrilling sci-fi film "12:01", office employee Barry Thomas finds himself trapped in a mysterious time loop caused by a glitch in his company's secret project. As the same day repeats itself over and over again, Barry realizes he is the only one aware of the situation and holds the key to breaking free. Amidst the chaos, Barry must race against time to not only unravel the mystery behind the time bounce but also to save the life of the enchanting research assistant, Lisa Fredericks. Now the same day occurs again and again, and Barry is the only one who can do anything about it, including saving Lisa's life. Will Barry be able to alter the course of events and escape the endless cycle before it's too late?
