In the thrilling sci-fi film "12:01", office employee Barry Thomas finds himself trapped in a mysterious time loop caused by a glitch in his company's secret project. As the same day repeats itself over and over again, Barry realizes he is the only one aware of the situation and holds the key to breaking free. Amidst the chaos, Barry must race against time to not only unravel the mystery behind the time bounce but also to save the life of the enchanting research assistant, Lisa Fredericks. Now the same day occurs again and again, and Barry is the only one who can do anything about it, including saving Lisa's life. Will Barry be able to alter the course of events and escape the endless cycle before it's too late?

title = The Great Scout & Cathouse Thursday 
overview = Sam Longwood, a frontiersman who has seen better days, spies the gold-mine partner, Jack Colby, who ran off with all the gold from a mine they were prospecting fifteen years earlier. He tells his other partners from that time, Joe Knox and Billy, and they confront Colby demanding not only the thousand dollars he took but an addition fifty-nine thousand for their trouble. After being thwarted in this attempt, they, and a would-be whore named Thursday, hatch a plan to kidnap Colby's wife, Nancy Sue, who is coincidently Sam's old flame, but find that Nancy Sue is not the sweet girl that Sam remembers. 
production compagnie = American International Pictures (AIP) 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 3.1 millions of dollars 
budget = 76.9 millions of dollars 
Producer = Jules Buck 
average note = 4.4 
Director = Don Taylor 
date of release = the 23 of June 1976 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = American International Pictures (AIP) 

In the 1976 film "The Great Scout & Cathouse Thursday," directed by Don Taylor and produced by Jules Buck for American International Pictures (AIP), viewers are taken on a wild frontier adventure. The story follows Sam Longwood, a rugged frontiersman who reunites with his old partners Joe Knox and Billy to seek revenge on their former colleague Jack Colby. Colby had betrayed them years ago by running off with all the gold from a mine they were prospecting. When their initial plan to confront Colby fails, they come up with a daring scheme involving the kidnapping of Colby's wife, Nancy Sue. However, their plan takes an unexpected turn when they realize that Nancy Sue is not the innocent woman they thought she was. As tensions rise and secrets are revealed, the group must navigate a dangerous game of deception and betrayal. With an average rating of 4.4, "The Great Scout & Cathouse Thursday" was released on June 23, 1976. Despite its modest revenue of 3.1 million dollars and a budget of 76.9 million dollars, it remains a classic tale of vengeance and redemption.

title = Hamburger Hill 
overview = The men of Bravo Company are facing a battle that's all uphill… up Hamburger Hill. Fourteen war-weary soldiers are battling for a mud-covered mound of earth so named because it chews up soldiers like chopped meat. They are fighting for their country, their fellow soldiers and their lives. War is hell, but this is worse. Hamburger Hill tells it the way it was, the way it really was. It's a raw, gritty and totally unrelenting dramatic depiction of one of the fiercest battles of America's bloodiest war. This happened. Hamburger Hill - war at its worst, men at their best. 
Director = John Irvin 
duration of the movie = 1h52 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = War at its worst. Men at their best. 
revenue = 13.8 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : Director = John Irvin 

In the intense war drama "Hamburger Hill," directed by John Irvin, viewers are taken on a harrowing journey alongside the men of Bravo Company as they face a brutal battle uphill, on the infamous Hamburger Hill. Set during one of America's bloodiest wars, this raw and gritty depiction showcases the unwavering determination of fourteen war-weary soldiers fighting for their country, their comrades, and their own survival. The tagline "War at its worst. Men at their best" perfectly encapsulates the heart-wrenching reality portrayed in this film. With a runtime of 1 hour and 52 minutes, this unrelenting portrayal of the true events that unfolded on Hamburger Hill leaves a lasting impact on audiences. Despite generating a revenue of 13.8 million dollars, the true value of this film lies in its poignant portrayal of the sacrifices made by soldiers in the face of unimaginable adversity.

title = Teen Witch 
overview = Louise is not very popular at her highschool. Then she learns that she's descended from the witches of Salem and has inherited their powers. At first she uses them to get back at the girls and teachers who teased her and to win the heart of the handsome footballer's captain. But soon she has doubts if it's right to 'cheat' her way to popularity. 
tagline = Fall under her spell. 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h34 
cast = Robyn Lively, Dan Gauthier, Joshua John Miller, Caren Kaye 
budget = 7.5 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Fall under her spell. 

In the enchanting movie "Teen Witch," Louise discovers her magical heritage as a descendant of the witches of Salem, inheriting their mystical powers. Initially using her newfound abilities to seek revenge on those who have mistreated her and to capture the affection of the charming football team captain, Louise soon grapples with the moral implications of manipulating her way to popularity. With a captivating tagline inviting you to "Fall under her spell," this English-language film runs for 1 hour and 34 minutes, featuring a talented cast including Robyn Lively, Dan Gauthier, Joshua John Miller, and Caren Kaye. Made with a budget of 7.5 million dollars, "Teen Witch" weaves a spellbinding tale of self-discovery and the true meaning of power.

In the enchanting movie "Teen Witch," Louise discovers her magical heritage as a descendant of the witches of Salem, inheriting their mystical powers. Initially using her newfound abilities to seek revenge on those who have mistreated her and to capture the affection of the charming football team captain, Louise soon grapples with the moral implications of manipulating her way to popularity. With a captivating tagline inviting you to "Fall under her spell," this English-language film runs for 1 hour and 34 minutes, featuring a talented cast including Robyn Lively, Dan Gauthier, Joshua John Miller, and Caren Kaye. Made with a budget of 7.5 million dollars, "Teen Witch" weaves a spellbinding tale of self-discovery and the true meaning of power.

title = Prime 
overview = A career driven professional from Manhattan is wooed by a young painter, who also happens to be the son of her psychoanalyst. 
Director = Ben Younger 
budget = 230.8 millions of dollars 
average note = 5.7 
date of release = the 21 of September 2005 
revenue = 154.3 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Ben Younger 

In the movie "Prime," directed by Ben Younger, a career-driven professional from Manhattan finds herself unexpectedly drawn to a young painter. What complicates matters is that the painter is not just any artist, but the son of her psychoanalyst. As their relationship unfolds, tensions rise and emotions run high in this romantic drama. Released on the 21st of September 2005, "Prime" garnered an average note of 5.7. With a budget of 230.8 million dollars, the film managed to rake in a revenue of 154.3 million dollars, proving to be a thought-provoking exploration of love, desire, and the complexities of relationships.

title = The Fisher King 
overview = Two troubled men face their terrible destinies and events of their past as they join together on a mission to find the Holy Grail and thus to save themselves. 
Producer = Debra Hill 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = A Modern Day Tale About The Search For Love, Sanity, Ethel Merman And The Holy Grail. 
duration of the movie = 2h17 
date of release = the 9 of September 1991 
budget = 24.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = TriStar Pictures 
Director = Terry Gilliam 
cast = Jeff Bridges, Robin Williams, Mercedes Ruehl, Amanda Plummer 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : Producer = Debra Hill 

In the 1991 film "The Fisher King," directed by Terry Gilliam and produced by Debra Hill for TriStar Pictures, two troubled men, played by Jeff Bridges and Robin Williams, come together on a mission to find the Holy Grail. Set in the United States of America and spoken in English, this modern-day tale explores themes of love, sanity, and the search for meaning. With a runtime of 2 hours and 17 minutes, the movie delves into the characters' past traumas as they navigate their destinies. Alongside Bridges and Williams, the stellar cast includes Mercedes Ruehl and Amanda Plummer. As they embark on their quest, they encounter unexpected challenges and revelations, all while seeking redemption and salvation. With a budget of $24.0 million, "The Fisher King" weaves a captivating narrative that blends elements of fantasy and reality, culminating in a poignant exploration of the human experience. The movie was released on the 9th of September 1991 and is encapsulated by the tagline: "A Modern Day Tale About The Search For Love, Sanity, Ethel Merman And The Holy Grail."

['correct']

title = Vacation 
overview = Hoping to bring his family closer together and to recreate his childhood vacation for his own kids, a grown up Rusty Griswold takes his wife and their two sons on a cross-country road trip to the coolest theme park in America, Walley World. Needless to say, things don't go quite as planned. 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 104.4 millions of dollars 
cast = Ed Helms, Christina Applegate, Skyler Gisondo, Steele Stebbins 
original language of the movie = English 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the hilarious comedy "Vacation," Rusty Griswold embarks on a cross-country road trip with his family to the iconic Walley World theme park, aiming to recreate his own childhood vacation and strengthen family bonds. Starring Ed Helms, Christina Applegate, Skyler Gisondo, and Steele Stebbins, this United States production grossed a whopping $104.4 million at the box office. As mishaps and misadventures unfold, the Griswold family navigates through unexpected challenges, making for a memorable and laughter-filled journey. The original language of the movie is English.

In the hilarious comedy "Vacation," Rusty Griswold embarks on a cross-country road trip with his family to the iconic Walley World theme park, aiming to recreate his own childhood vacation and strengthen family bonds. Starring Ed Helms, Christina Applegate, Skyler Gisondo, and Steele Stebbins, this United States production grossed a whopping $104.4 million at the box office. As mishaps and misadventures unfold, the Griswold family navigates through unexpected challenges, making for a memorable and laughter-filled journey. The original language of the movie is English.

title = Mankatha 
overview = Vinayak and his 4 team members rob a booty of 500 crores INR. Trouble starts when two of the team betrays them. 
cast = Ajith Kumar, Arjun Sarja, Trisha Krishnan, Vaibhav Reddy 
production countrie = India 
budget = 6.1 millions of dollars 
tagline = Strictly no rules 
Producer = Dhayanidhi Alagiri 
Director = Venkat Prabhu 
revenue = 28.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 31 of August 2011 
production compagnie = Sun Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Ajith Kumar, Arjun Sarja, Trisha Krishnan, Vaibhav Reddy 

In the action-packed Indian film "Mankatha," directed by Venkat Prabhu and produced by Dhayanidhi Alagiri under Sun Pictures, a daring heist unfolds as Vinayak, portrayed by Ajith Kumar, and his team of four members successfully steal a whopping 500 crores INR. However, their fortunes take a turn for the worse when betrayal creeps in from within their own ranks, leading to a thrilling game of cat and mouse. With a star-studded cast including Arjun Sarja, Trisha Krishnan, and Vaibhav Reddy, this high-stakes crime drama unfolds against the backdrop of a tagline that sets the tone: "Strictly no rules." Released on August 31, 2011, with a budget of 6.1 million dollars, "Mankatha" went on to generate a revenue of 28.0 million dollars, solidifying its status as a must-watch for fans of intense heist thrillers. The production country is India. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : production countrie = India

However, their fortunes take a turn for the worse when betrayal creeps in from within their own ranks, leading to a thrilling game of cat and mouse. With a star-studded cast including Arjun Sarja, Trisha Krishnan, and Vaibhav Reddy, this high-stakes crime drama unfolds against the backdrop of a tagline that sets the tone: "Strictly no rules." Released on August 31, 2011, with a budget of 6.1 million dollars, "Mankatha" went on to generate a revenue of 28.0 million dollars, solidifying its status as a must-watch for fans of intense heist thrillers. The production country is India.

title = The Perez Family 
overview = In the midst of the Mariel boat lift -- a hurried exodus of refugees from Cuba going to America -- an immigration clerk accidentally presumes that dissident Juan Raul Perez and Dorita Evita Perez are married. United by their last name and a mutual resolve to emigrate, Dorita and Juan agree to play along. But it gets complicated when the two begin falling for each other just as Juan reunites with his wife, Carmela, whom he hasn't seen in decades. 

FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Mira Nair 

title = The Perez Family 
overview = In the midst of the Mariel boat lift -- a hurried exodus of refugees from Cuba going to America -- an immigration clerk accidentally presumes that dissident Juan Raul Perez and Dorita Evita Perez are married. United by their last name and a mutual resolve to emigrate, Dorita and Juan agree to play along. But it gets complicated when the two begin falling for each other just as Juan reunites with his wife, Carmela, whom he hasn't seen in decades. 

In "The Perez Family," set during the Mariel boat lift, an immigration clerk mistakenly assumes that Juan Raul Perez and Dorita Evita Perez are married as they both share the same last name. Seizing the opportunity to emigrate to America, the two strangers decide to pretend to be a couple. As their fake relationship deepens, they find themselves developing genuine feelings for each other, complicating matters when Juan's long-lost wife, Carmela, reenters the picture after decades apart.

title = Sudden Danger 
overview = Det Andy Doyle (Bill Elliott) suspects that a suicide is actually a murder. He suspects the victim's son, Wallace (Tom Drake) who is blind and he pursues him until he gets to the truth.. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h25 

In the thrilling film "Sudden Danger," Detective Andy Doyle, portrayed by Bill Elliott, finds himself entangled in a perplexing case where a suicide may be masking a sinister murder. As Doyle delves deeper into the investigation, his suspicions fall upon Wallace, the blind son of the victim, played by Tom Drake. Determined to uncover the truth, Doyle relentlessly pursues Wallace, leading to a gripping and suspenseful showdown where the truth finally comes to light. The film is set in a small town with a tight-knit community where secrets are hard to keep hidden. The cinematography captures the tension and suspense as Doyle races against time to solve the mystery before more lives are put in danger. The film's soundtrack, composed by a renowned musician, adds an extra layer of intensity to the unfolding drama. "Sudden Danger" keeps viewers on the edge of their seats with its unexpected twists and turns, culminating in a shocking revelation that changes everything.

title = Tears of the Sun 
overview = Navy SEAL Lieutenant A.K. Waters and his elite squadron of tactical specialists are forced to choose between their duty and their humanity, between following orders by ignoring the conflict that surrounds them, or finding the courage to follow their conscience and protect a group of innocent refugees. When the democratic government of Nigeria collapses and the country is taken over by a ruthless military dictator, Waters, a fiercely loyal and hardened veteran is dispatched on a routine mission to retrieve a Doctors Without Borders physician. 
Director = Antoine Fuqua 
revenue = 85.6 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 2h01 
tagline = He was trained to follow orders. He became a hero by defying them. 
cast = Bruce Willis, Monica Bellucci, Cole Hauser, Eamonn Walker 
average note = 6.4 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Antoine Fuqua 

In "Tears of the Sun," directed by Antoine Fuqua, Navy SEAL Lieutenant A.K. Waters, portrayed by Bruce Willis, leads his elite squadron on a mission in war-torn Nigeria. When faced with a moral dilemma, they must choose between following orders and protecting innocent refugees, including a Doctors Without Borders physician played by Monica Bellucci. As the country falls under the control of a ruthless dictator, Waters and his team must navigate the dangerous landscape while grappling with their conscience. With a tagline that emphasizes the internal conflict faced by Waters - "He was trained to follow orders. He became a hero by defying them" - this action-packed film explores themes of duty, humanity, and courage. With a revenue of 85.6 million dollars and an average rating of 6.4, "Tears of the Sun" is a gripping tale of sacrifice and heroism, lasting 2 hours and 1 minute in its original English language. The cast also includes Cole Hauser and Eamonn Walker.

title = W. 
overview = Whether you love him or hate him, there is no question that George W. Bush is one of the most controversial public figures in recent memory. W takes viewers through Bush’s eventful life -- his struggles and triumphs, how he found both his wife and his faith, and of course the critical days leading up to Bush’s decision to invade Iraq. 
revenue = 29.5 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.0 
cast = Josh Brolin, Elizabeth Banks, Ellen Burstyn, Ioan Gruffudd 
tagline = A life misunderestimated. 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 29.5 millions of dollars 

In the biographical drama "W.", viewers are taken on a journey through the eventful life of one of the most controversial public figures in recent history, George W. Bush. Portrayed by Josh Brolin, the film delves into Bush's struggles, triumphs, his relationships, and his faith, culminating in the critical decision to invade Iraq. With a stellar cast including Elizabeth Banks, Ellen Burstyn, and Ioan Gruffudd, "W." offers a glimpse into the complexities of a man often misunderstood. The tagline "A life misunderestimated" encapsulates the essence of the movie. Originally released in English, "W." grossed 29.5 million dollars at the box office and received an average rating of 6.0.

In the biographical drama "W.", viewers are taken on a journey through the eventful life of one of the most controversial public figures in recent history, George W. Bush. Portrayed by Josh Brolin, the film delves into Bush's struggles, triumphs, his relationships, and his faith, culminating in the critical decision to invade Iraq. With a stellar cast including Elizabeth Banks, Ellen Burstyn, and Ioan Gruffudd, "W." offers a glimpse into the complexities of a man often misunderstood. The tagline "A life misunderestimated" encapsulates the essence of the movie. Originally released in English, "W." grossed 29.5 million dollars at the box office and received an average rating of 6.0.

title = A Dog's Life 
overview = Poor Charlie lives in a vacant lot. He tries to get a job but when he gets to the head of the employment line the jobs are gone. Back "home" he rescues Scraps, a bitch being attacked by other strays. Together they manage to steal some sausages from a lunch wagon. They enter a dance hall where Edna is a singer and unwilling companion to the clientele. He is thrown out when he can't pay. Back "home" 
duration of the movie = 0h33 
production compagnie = First National Pictures 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correctthe fact mentions the duration as 0h33, which corresponds to 33 minutes, matching the description.']
fact : duration of the movie = 0h33 

In the heartwarming film "A Dog's Life," produced by First National Pictures in the United States of America, we follow the journey of Charlie, a lovable pup living in a vacant lot. Despite his efforts to find employment, Charlie faces constant setbacks as he struggles to make ends meet. One fateful day, he comes to the rescue of Scraps, a fellow canine in distress, and the two form an unbreakable bond. Together, they embark on a daring adventure to steal sausages, showcasing their resourcefulness and loyalty. As they navigate through challenges, including a run-in at a dance hall where Edna performs, Charlie's resilience and determination shine through. With a runtime of 33 minutes, "A Dog's Life" is a touching tale of friendship, survival, and the enduring spirit of man's best friend. The movie was directed by Charles Chaplin.

title = Carry On Cowboy 
overview = Stodge City is in the grip of the Rumpo Kid and his gang. Mistaken identity again takes a hand as a "sanitary engineer" (plumber) by the name of Marshal P. Knutt is mistaken for a law marshal! Being the conscientious sort, Marshal tries to help the town get rid of Rumpo, and a showdown is inevitable. Marshal has two aids - revenge-seeking Annie Oakley and his sanitary expertise 
cast = Sid James, Jim Dale, Angela Douglas, Kenneth Williams 
average note = 6.1 
tagline = How the west was lost! 
budget = 58.9 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 1 of March 1966 
duration of the movie = 1h33 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Sid James, Jim Dale, Angela Douglas, Kenneth Williams 

In the wild and comedic town of Stodge City, chaos reigns under the rule of the notorious Rumpo Kid and his gang. When a case of mistaken identity lands a humble "sanitary engineer" named Marshal P. Knutt in the role of a lawman, the stage is set for a hilarious showdown. With the help of the revenge-seeking Annie Oakley and his unique sanitary expertise, Marshal sets out to rid the town of Rumpo's tyranny. Starring Sid James, Jim Dale, Angela Douglas, and Kenneth Williams, "Carry On Cowboy" takes you on a wild ride through the Wild West where the average note is 6.1. Get ready for a rootin' tootin' good time as this classic comedy from 1966 unfolds in 1 hour and 33 minutes of laughter. Remember, in this town, how the west was lost! The budget for the movie was 58.9 million dollars, and it was released on the 1st of March 1966.

title = Knowing 
overview = A teacher opens a time capsule that has been dug up at his son's elementary school; in it are some chilling predictions -- some that have already occurred and others that are about to -- that lead him to believe his family plays a role in the events that are about to unfold. 
budget = 50.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 19 of March 2009 
average note = 5.9 
Producer = Steve Tisch 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 50.0 millions of dollars 

In the thrilling movie "Knowing," a teacher makes a startling discovery when he opens a time capsule unearthed at his son's elementary school. Inside, he finds a series of ominous predictions, some of which have already come true while others are yet to unfold. Convinced that his family is somehow entwined in these events, he embarks on a journey to uncover the truth. Produced by Steve Tisch and released on the 19th of March 2009, this suspenseful film had a budget of 50 million dollars and received an average rating of 5.9.

title = Neptune's Daughter 
overview = Scatterbrained Betty Barrett mistakes masseur Jack Spratt for Jose O'Rourke, the captain of the South American polo team. Spratt goes along with the charade, but the situation becomes more complicated when they fall in love. Meanwhile, Betty's sensible older sister Eve fears Betty's heart will be broken when Jose returns to South America. She arranges to meet with the real O'Rourke and love soon blossoms between them as well. 
revenue = 287.2 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h35 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : revenue = 287.2 millions of dollars 

In "Neptune's Daughter," scatterbrained Betty Barrett finds herself in a case of mistaken identity when she confuses masseur Jack Spratt for Jose O'Rourke, the captain of the South American polo team. As their charade continues, a love story unfolds between them, complicating things further. Meanwhile, Betty's older sister Eve intervenes out of concern for her sister's heart, leading to unexpected romantic entanglements. With a revenue of 287.2 million dollars, this charming tale unfolds over a duration of 1 hour and 35 minutes.

title = RoboCop 2 
overview = After a successful deployment of the Robocop Law Enforcement unit, OCP sees its goal of urban pacification come closer and closer, but as this develops, a new narcotic known as "Nuke" invades the streets led by God-delirious leader Cane. As this menace grows, it may prove to be too much for Murphy to handle. OCP tries to replicate the success of the first unit, but ends up with failed prototypes with suicidal issues... until Dr. Faxx, a scientist straying away from OCP's path, uses Cane as the new subject for the Robocop 2 project, a living God. 
duration of the movie = 1h57 
date of release = the 22 of June 1990 
Producer = Jon Davison 
tagline = He's back to protect the innocent. 
production compagnie = Orion Pictures 
Director = Irvin Kershner 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h57 

In the action-packed sequel "RoboCop 2," released on the 22nd of June 1990 by Orion Pictures, the streets are plagued by a new narcotic called "Nuke" under the leadership of the God-delirious Cane. As OCP aims for urban pacification with the Robocop Law Enforcement unit, Officer Murphy faces a formidable challenge in combating this growing threat. Producer Jon Davison and Director Irvin Kershner bring to life a thrilling tale where OCP's attempts to replicate their initial success result in flawed prototypes with suicidal tendencies. Dr. Faxx, a scientist diverging from OCP's agenda, seizes the opportunity to use Cane as the subject for the Robocop 2 project, creating a living God. With the tagline "He's back to protect the innocent," this 1 hour and 57-minute film is a riveting continuation of the RoboCop saga.

As OCP aims for urban pacification with the Robocop Law Enforcement unit, Officer Murphy faces a formidable challenge in combating this growing threat. Producer Jon Davison and Director Irvin Kershner bring to life a thrilling tale where OCP's attempts to replicate their initial success result in flawed prototypes with suicidal tendencies. Dr. Faxx, a scientist diverging from OCP's agenda, seizes the opportunity to use Cane as the subject for the Robocop 2 project, creating a living God. With the tagline "He's back to protect the innocent," this 1 hour and 57-minute film is a riveting continuation of the RoboCop saga.

title = Charlie Wilson's War 
overview = The true story of Texas congressman Charlie Wilson's covert dealings in Afghanistan, where his efforts to assist rebels in their war with the Soviets had some unforeseen and long-reaching effects. 
duration of the movie = 1h42 
Director = Mike Nichols 
budget = 75.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 19 of December 2007 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Tom Hanks 
revenue = 119.0 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = Based on a true story. You think we could make all this up? 
average note = 6.5 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
cast = Tom Hanks, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Julia Roberts, Amy Adams 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h42 

In the riveting film "Charlie Wilson's War," directed by Mike Nichols and produced by Tom Hanks, viewers are taken on a journey through the true story of Texas congressman Charlie Wilson. Set against the backdrop of the Soviet-Afghan War, Wilson's covert dealings in Afghanistan have unforeseen and long-reaching effects. With a star-studded cast including Tom Hanks, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Julia Roberts, and Amy Adams, the movie delves into the complexities of political intrigue and international relations. Released on the 19th of December 2007, in the United States of America, this English-language film runs for 1 hour and 42 minutes. With a budget of 75.0 million dollars, "Charlie Wilson's War" went on to gross 119.0 million dollars in revenue. The tagline "Based on a true story. You think we could make all this up?" perfectly encapsulates the gripping and thought-provoking nature of this film, which received an average rating of 6.5. Produced by Universal Pictures, this movie is a must-watch for those intrigued by historical events and political machinations.

title = Far from Home 
overview = Charlie Cox should have stopped for gas in California. While he's on a cross-country trip with his teenage daughter, Joleen, his car hits empty in a creepy town in Nevada. With nary a drop of fuel to be found, Charlie and Joleen stop for the night at a dilapidated trailer park. There, Joleen catches the eye of two teenage boys, Jimmy and Pinky -- either of whom could be the serial killer currently terrorizing the town. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong(the fact mentioned is "producer = donald p. borchers" which is not present in the description)']
fact : Producer = Donald P. Borchers 

In the thrilling movie "Far from Home," Charlie Cox finds himself in a precarious situation when his car runs out of gas in a desolate town in Nevada during a cross-country trip with his daughter, Joleen. Forced to stay the night at a run-down trailer park, things take a sinister turn when Joleen attracts the attention of two mysterious teenage boys, Jimmy and Pinky. As the town grapples with a serial killer on the loose, Charlie must navigate the eerie surroundings to ensure their safety. Will they be able to uncover the true identity of the killer before it's too late? 

Facts included in the description:
1. Charlie Cox is on a cross-country trip with his teenage daughter, Joleen.
2. The car runs out of gas in a desolate town in Nevada.
3. Joleen catches the eye of two teenage boys, Jimmy and Pinky.
4. The town is dealing with a serial killer on the loose.

In the thrilling movie "Far from Home," Charlie Cox finds himself in a precarious situation when his car runs out of gas in a desolate town in Nevada during a cross-country trip with his daughter, Joleen. Forced to stay the night at a run-down trailer park, things take a sinister turn when Joleen attracts the attention of two mysterious teenage boys, Jimmy and Pinky. As the town grapples with a serial killer on the loose, Charlie must navigate the eerie surroundings to ensure their safety. Will they be able to uncover the true identity of the killer before it's too late? 

Facts included in the description:
1. Charlie Cox is on a cross-country trip with his teenage daughter, Joleen.
2. The car runs out of gas in a desolate town in Nevada.
3. Joleen catches the eye of two teenage boys, Jimmy and Pinky.
4. The town is dealing with a serial killer on the loose.

title = Blood Glacier 
overview = At a climate research station in the Alps, the scientists are stunned as the nearby melting glacier is leaking a red liquid. It quickly turns to be very special juice — with unexpected genetic effects on the local wildlife. 
production compagnie = Allegro-Film 
budget = 55.7 millions of dollars 
revenue = 272.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = Helmut Grasser 
date of release = the 27 of September 2013 
original language of the movie = German 
duration of the movie = 1h38 
average note = 5.6 
Director = Marvin Kren 
tagline = Terror has Evolved! 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Allegro-Film 

In the chilling thriller "Blood Glacier," produced by Allegro-Film and directed by Marvin Kren, a group of scientists at a climate research station in the Alps makes a shocking discovery when a nearby melting glacier starts oozing a mysterious red liquid. This peculiar substance, which the team soon realizes is a very special juice, has unforeseen genetic effects on the local wildlife. As terror evolves in the mountains, the scientists must race against time to understand and contain the monstrous consequences of this bizarre phenomenon. Released on the 27th of September 2013, in its original German language, this 1 hour and 38-minute film garnered an average rating of 5.6. With a budget of 55.7 million dollars, "Blood Glacier" went on to generate a staggering revenue of 272.0 million dollars, proving that sometimes, nature's wrath can be more terrifying than imagined. The tagline says it all: Terror has Evolved!

title = Rudo & Cursi 
overview = Two brothers living a hard life of manual labor in rural Mexico have a simple dream: saving enough money to build their mother her dream house. But fate has other plans. A friendly game of soccer leads to first Rudo, then to Cursi being taken on by the nation’s top talent scout. Suddenly, they find themselves living the high life of star athletes: fame, fortune, fast cars and beautiful women. 
production compagnie = Canana Films 
revenue = 28.5 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.1 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Canana Films 

In "Rudo & Cursi," produced by Canana Films, two hardworking brothers in rural Mexico strive to save money to fulfill their mother's dream of owning a house. Their lives take an unexpected turn when they are scouted by a top talent agent after a soccer game. Rudo and Cursi are catapulted into the world of professional sports, experiencing fame, fortune, luxury cars, and romance. With a revenue of 28.5 million dollars and an average rating of 6.1, this film showcases the journey of two brothers as they navigate the highs and lows of newfound success.

title = Lawnmower Man 2: Beyond Cyberspace 
overview = Jobe is resuscitated by Jonathan Walker. He wants Jobe to create a special computer chip that would connect all the computers in the world into one network, which Walker would control and use. But what Walker doesn't realize is a group of teenage hackers are on to him and out to stop his plan. 
production compagnie = New Line Cinema 
Producer = Keith Fox 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = New Line Cinema 

In "Lawnmower Man 2: Beyond Cyberspace," Jobe is brought back to life by Jonathan Walker with a sinister plan in mind. Walker enlists Jobe to develop a revolutionary computer chip that would link all computers worldwide under his command. Unbeknownst to Walker, a determined group of teenage hackers catches wind of his scheme and sets out to thwart his malevolent intentions. Produced by Keith Fox and brought to life by New Line Cinema, this high-tech thriller delves into the dangers of unchecked power in the digital age. The production company behind the film is New Line Cinema, and the producer is Keith Fox.

Walker enlists Jobe to develop a revolutionary computer chip that would link all computers worldwide under his command. Unbeknownst to Walker, a determined group of teenage hackers catches wind of his scheme and sets out to thwart his malevolent intentions. Produced by Keith Fox and brought to life by New Line Cinema, this high-tech thriller delves into the dangers of unchecked power in the digital age. The production company behind the film is New Line Cinema, and the producer is Keith Fox. 
 
 

 
title = Night of the Devils 
overview = Night of the Devils is an Italian vampire thriller with a remarkably good pedigree. The script is based on The Wurdalak, a short story by A.K. Tolstoy. The central character is the patriarch of a wealthy family who fears that he will show up one day in vampire form. Should this happen, he warns his family not to let him back in his house, no matter how much he begs.

In "Night of the Devils," an Italian vampire thriller with a prestigious lineage, the narrative unfolds around the patriarch of an affluent family who harbors a chilling secret. Based on A.K. Tolstoy's short story "The Wurdalak," the film delves into the patriarch's haunting fear of transforming into a vampire. As he forewarns his family about the impending danger, he cautions them against allowing him entry into their home, regardless of his pleas. Will his loved ones heed his warning, or will they succumb to the terror that lurks within the shadows? The movie is set in a remote village in the Italian countryside, adding to the eerie atmosphere.

title = Trade 
overview = A Texas cop (Kevin Kline), whose own daughter might have been forced into sexual slavery, joins forces with a Mexican youth (Cesar Ramos) to find the boy's sister, who was abducted and forced into prostitution. Meanwhile, a Ukrainian woman who was promised a better life in America also becomes a victim. 
date of release = the 23 of January 2007 
production countrie = Germany 
cast = Kevin Kline, Cesar Ramos, Paulina Gaitán, Alicja Bachleda-Curuś 
revenue = 47.4 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 2h00 
tagline = Each year, more than 1,000,000 people are trafficked across international borders... against their will. 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Centropolis Film Productions 
budget = 12.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = Roland Emmerich 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the fact is indeed "date of release = the 23rd of january 2007".']
fact : date of release = the 23 of January 2007 

In the gripping drama "Trade," released on the 23rd of January 2007, a Texas cop played by Kevin Kline, teams up with a young Mexican, portrayed by Cesar Ramos, to rescue the boy's sister from the horrors of human trafficking. As they delve deeper into the dangerous world of sexual slavery, they encounter a Ukrainian woman seeking a better life in America, only to fall victim to the same fate. With a stellar cast including Paulina Gaitán and Alicja Bachleda-Curuś, this 2-hour film sheds light on the harsh reality of over 1,000,000 people trafficked across borders each year. Produced by Centropolis Film Productions in Germany, under the helm of Roland Emmerich, "Trade" delivers a powerful message in English, grossing 47.4 million dollars at the box office against a budget of 12.0 million dollars. Each year, more than 1,000,000 people are trafficked across international borders... against their will.

overview = Scooby-Doo and the gang are on the case when a mysterious lake monster starts scaring the guests at a summer resort in Erie Point, where Fred, Daphne, Velma and Shaggy have taken on seasonal jobs to pay for a barn they accidentally burned down. But in addition to sneaking suspicions, there's some romance in the air. 
duration of the movie = 1h19 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Warner Bros. Pictures 
Producer = Brian Levant 
date of release = the 15 of October 2010 
tagline = Ruh-Roh! They're in too deep and way over their heads! 
average note = 5.5 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 229.2 millions of dollars 
Director = Brian Levant 
revenue = 75.7 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h19 

In "Scooby-Doo! Curse of the Lake Monster," the beloved Scooby-Doo and his friends find themselves at a summer resort in Erie Point, where a mysterious lake monster is causing chaos among the guests. Fred, Daphne, Velma, and Shaggy are working seasonal jobs to pay for a barn they accidentally burned down, but they can't resist getting involved in solving the spooky case. As they navigate through sneaky suspicions and eerie encounters, romance blossoms in the air. Directed by Brian Levant and produced by Warner Bros. Pictures, this English-language film was released on the 15th of October 2010 in the United States of America. With a duration of 1 hour and 19 minutes, the movie had a budget of 229.2 million dollars and managed to reel in a revenue of 75.7 million dollars. The tagline "Ruh-Roh! They're in too deep and way over their heads!" perfectly captures the thrilling and comedic essence of this adventure, which has an average rating of 5.5.

Pictures, this English-language film was released on the 15th of October 2010 in the United States of America. With a duration of 1 hour and 19 minutes, the movie had a budget of 229.2 million dollars and managed to reel in a revenue of 75.7 million dollars. The tagline "Ruh-Roh! They're in too deep and way over their heads!" perfectly captures the thrilling and comedic essence of this adventure, which has an average rating of 5.5.

title = A Simple Plan 
overview = Captivated by the lure of sudden wealth, the quiet rural lives of two brothers erupt into conflicts of greed, paranoia and distrust when over $4 million in cash is discovered at the remote site of a downed small airplane. Their simple plan to retain the money while avoiding detection opens a Pandora's box when the fear of getting caught triggers panicked behavior and leads to virulent consequences 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 
budget = 3.8 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.9 
duration of the movie = 2h01 
date of release = the 11 of December 1998 
revenue = 55.8 millions of dollars 
cast = Bill Paxton, Bridget Fonda, Billy Bob Thornton, Brent Briscoe 
tagline = Sometimes good people do evil things. 
Producer = Gary Levinsohn 
Director = Sam Raimi 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the American thriller "A Simple Plan," directed by Sam Raimi and produced by Paramount Pictures, the lives of two brothers, played by Bill Paxton and Billy Bob Thornton, take a dark turn when they stumble upon over $4 million in cash at the site of a crashed airplane. Bridget Fonda and Brent Briscoe also star in this suspenseful film. As they hatch a simple plan to keep the money hidden, their actions spiral into a series of catastrophic events fueled by fear and desperation. With an average rating of 6.9, this tale of greed, paranoia, and distrust explores the consequences of good people doing evil things. Released on December 11, 1998, "A Simple Plan" grossed $55.8 million, surpassing its $3.8 million budget. The tagline "Sometimes good people do evil things" perfectly encapsulates the moral dilemmas faced by the characters in this gripping thriller. The movie has a duration of 2 hours and 1 minute and is in English. Gary Levinsohn served as the producer of the film.

title = Run of the Arrow 
overview = A veteran leaves the army, and finds a home with the Sioux. 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 35.5 millions of dollars 
Director = Samuel Fuller 
average note = 6.1 
budget = 77.6 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h26 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In "Run of the Arrow," directed by Samuel Fuller, a veteran decides to leave the army behind and embarks on a journey that leads him to find a new sense of belonging with the Sioux tribe. Set in the United States of America, this Western film explores themes of identity, redemption, and cultural understanding. With an average rating of 6.1, the movie runs for 1 hour and 26 minutes, captivating audiences with its compelling storyline. Despite a budget of $77.6 million, the film managed to generate a revenue of $35.5 million, proving to be a moderate success at the box office.

title = The Lost Man 
overview = A gang of black militants plots to rob a factory to finance their "revolutionary struggle." 
cast = Sidney Poitier, Joanna Shimkus, Al Freeman, Jr., Michael Tolan 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Sidney Poitier, Joanna Shimkus, Al Freeman, Jr., Michael Tolan 

In "The Lost Man," a gripping tale unfolds as a group of black militants, led by a charismatic leader, devises a daring plan to rob a factory in order to finance their "revolutionary struggle." Starring Sidney Poitier, Joanna Shimkus, Al Freeman, Jr., and Michael Tolan, this intense drama delves into themes of activism, justice, and sacrifice. Produced by Universal Pictures, this film offers a thought-provoking exploration of the lengths individuals will go to in pursuit of their beliefs.

Produced by Universal Pictures, this film offers a thought-provoking exploration of the lengths individuals will go to in pursuit of their beliefs.

title = The Limits of Control 
overview = A mysterious stranger works outside the law and keeps his objectives hidden, trusting no one. While his demeanor is paradoxically focused and dreamlike all at once, he embarks on a journey that not only takes him across Spain, but also through his own consciousness. 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 123.1 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = PointBlank Films 
average note = 6.4 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Jim Jarmusch 
Producer = Jon Kilik 
date of release = the 1 of May 2009 
budget = 127.6 millions of dollars 
cast = Isaach De Bankolé, Tilda Swinton, Bill Murray, Gael García Bernal 
tagline = For every way in, there is another way out. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the enigmatic film "The Limits of Control," directed by Jim Jarmusch and released on the 1st of May 2009, a mysterious stranger, portrayed by Isaach De Bankolé, operates on the fringes of the law, concealing his true intentions and placing his trust in no one. With a paradoxical demeanor that is both intensely focused and dreamlike, he embarks on a journey that spans across Spain, delving not only into the physical landscape but also into the depths of his own consciousness. The star-studded cast includes Tilda Swinton, Bill Murray, and Gael García Bernal, who bring their own unique flair to the narrative. Produced by Jon Kilik under the banner of PointBlank Films in the United States of America, this English-language film garnered an average rating of 6.4 and raked in an impressive revenue of 123.1 million dollars at the box office. As the tagline suggests, "For every way in, there is another way out," inviting viewers to unravel the mysteries that lie within the intricate layers of this thought-provoking cinematic experience.

title = The X Files 
overview = Mulder and Scully, now taken off the FBI's X Files cases, must find a way to fight the shadowy elements of the government to find out the truth about a conspiracy that might mean the alien colonization of Earth. 
duration of the movie = 2h01 
Director = Rob Bowman 
revenue = 189.2 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.6 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 2h01 

In the sci-fi thriller "The X Files," directed by Rob Bowman, former FBI agents Mulder and Scully are faced with their most challenging case yet. Taken off the X Files cases, they must navigate through shadowy government elements to uncover a conspiracy that threatens the very existence of Earth - an alien colonization. As they delve deeper into the mystery, the duo must fight against all odds to reveal the truth. With a runtime of 2 hours and 1 minute, the film captivated audiences worldwide, grossing an impressive $189.2 million at the box office. Despite the challenges they face, Mulder and Scully's relentless pursuit of the truth keeps viewers on the edge of their seats, resulting in an average rating of 6.6.

title = Easy Rider 
overview = A cross-country trip to sell drugs puts two hippie bikers on a collision course with small-town prejudices. 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures 
cast = Peter Fonda, Dennis Hopper, Antonio Mendoza, Phil Spector 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 7 of May 1969 
average note = 7.0 
tagline = A man went looking for America and couldn’t find it anywhere... 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "Easy Rider," a groundbreaking film released on the 7th of May 1969, two hippie bikers, portrayed by Peter Fonda and Dennis Hopper, embark on a cross-country journey to sell drugs. As they traverse the United States of America, they confront small-town prejudices and societal norms, leading to a collision course with unexpected challenges. Produced by Columbia Pictures and featuring a stellar cast including Antonio Mendoza and Phil Spector, this English-language film captures the essence of a generation in search of freedom and meaning. With an average rating of 7.0, "Easy Rider" delivers a poignant message encapsulated in its tagline: "A man went looking for America and couldn’t find it anywhere..."

In "Easy Rider," a groundbreaking film released on the 7th of May 1969, two hippie bikers, portrayed by Peter Fonda and Dennis Hopper, embark on a cross-country journey to sell drugs. As they traverse the United States of America, they confront small-town prejudices and societal norms, leading to a collision course with unexpected challenges. Produced by Columbia Pictures and featuring a stellar cast including Antonio Mendoza and Phil Spector, this English-language film captures the essence of a generation in search of freedom and meaning. With an average rating of 7.0, "Easy Rider" delivers a poignant message encapsulated in its tagline: "A man went looking for America and couldn’t find it anywhere..."

title = House of Cards 
overview = When Ruth Matthews's husband is killed in a fall at an archaeological dig, her daughter Sally handles her father's death in a very odd manner. As Sally's condition worsens, Ruth takes her to see Jake, an expert in childhood autism. Jake attempts to bring Sally out of her mental disarray through traditional therapy methods, but Ruth takes a different route. She risks her own sanity by attempting to enter her daughter's mind and make sense of the seemingly bizarre things that Sally does, including building a wondrous house of cards 
Director = Michael Lessac 
production compagnie = Penta Pictures 
duration of the movie = 1h49 
revenue = 216.8 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 25 of June 1993 
Producer = Wolfgang Glattes 
cast = Tommy Lee Jones, Asha Menina, Kathleen Turner, Shiloh Strong 
tagline = A Journey That Will Open Your Mind... And Touch Your Heart. 
average note = 6.7 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : Director = Michael Lessac 

In the captivating drama "House of Cards," directed by Michael Lessac and produced by Wolfgang Glattes, a heart-wrenching story unfolds following Ruth Matthews and her daughter Sally. After a tragic accident claims Ruth's husband's life, Sally's behavior takes a peculiar turn, leading Ruth to seek help from Jake, an expert in childhood autism. As Jake employs traditional therapy methods to reach Sally, Ruth embarks on a risky journey into her daughter's mind. Amidst the turmoil, Ruth discovers the beauty in Sally's seemingly bizarre actions, including the creation of a mesmerizing house of cards. Starring Tommy Lee Jones, Asha Menina, Kathleen Turner, and Shiloh Strong, this emotional tale, released on the 25th of June 1993 by Penta Pictures, grossed a staggering $216.8 million. With a tagline promising "A Journey That Will Open Your Mind... And Touch Your Heart," "House of Cards" received an average rating of 6.7, captivating audiences with its poignant exploration of love, loss, and the extraordinary lengths a mother will go to understand her child.

title = Macabre 
overview = A middle-aged woman, traumatized from the death of her adulterous lover, moves into a room at a New Orleans boarding house where the blind landlord becomes suspicious to her activities of continuing her affair with her dead lover. 
Director = Lamberto Bava 
average note = 6.0 
tagline = Prepare yourself for the Shock of a Lifetime!   Once she kept a lover on the side. But that's nothing compared to what she's keeping in the freezer. 
date of release = the 17 of April 1980 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Lamberto Bava 

In "Macabre," directed by Lamberto Bava, a middle-aged woman grappling with the trauma of her adulterous lover's death seeks solace in a room at a New Orleans boarding house. However, her attempts to continue her affair with her deceased lover raise suspicions from the blind landlord. As the chilling tale unfolds, viewers are taken on a suspenseful journey filled with secrets, betrayal, and a shocking twist that will leave them on the edge of their seats. Released on April 17, 1980, in English, this film promises to deliver the shock of a lifetime, reminding audiences that sometimes the most terrifying secrets are the ones we keep hidden away. Prepare yourself for a riveting cinematic experience with "Macabre." The average note for the movie is 6.0, and the tagline reads, "Prepare yourself for the Shock of a Lifetime! Once she kept a lover on the side. But that's nothing compared to what she's keeping in the freezer."

As the chilling tale unfolds, viewers are taken on a suspenseful journey filled with secrets, betrayal, and a shocking twist that will leave them on the edge of their seats. Released on April 17, 1980, in English, this film promises to deliver the shock of a lifetime, reminding audiences that sometimes the most terrifying secrets are the ones we keep hidden away. Prepare yourself for a riveting cinematic experience with "Macabre." The average note for the movie is 6.0, and the tagline reads, "Prepare yourself for the Shock of a Lifetime! Once she kept a lover on the side. But that's nothing compared to what she's keeping in the freezer."

title = Mickey, Donald, Goofy: The Three Musketeers 
overview = In Disney's take on the Alexander Dumas tale, Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck and Goofy want nothing more than to perform brave deeds on behalf of their queen (Minnie Mouse), but they're stymied by the head Musketeer, Pete. Pete secretly wants to get rid of the queen, so he appoints Mickey and his bumbling friends as guardians to Minnie, thinking such a maneuver will ensure his scheme's success. The score features songs based on familiar classical melodies. 
revenue = 97.0 millions of dollars 
budget = 263.1 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.3 
date of release = the 4 of August 2004 
Producer = Margot Pipkin 
tagline = All for fun and fun for all 
Director = Donovan Cook 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h08 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 97.0 millions of dollars 

In the animated film "Mickey, Donald, Goofy: The Three Musketeers," Disney puts a whimsical twist on the classic Alexander Dumas tale. Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck, and Goofy aspire to carry out heroic deeds for their queen, Minnie Mouse. However, their plans are thwarted by the conniving head Musketeer, Pete, who has ulterior motives. To further his scheme of removing the queen from power, Pete assigns Mickey and his clumsy companions as Minnie's protectors. As they navigate through challenges and comedic mishaps, the trio must prove their worth as true Musketeers. Set to a soundtrack of songs inspired by beloved classical melodies, this adventurous tale showcases the enduring bond of friendship and loyalty. Directed by Donovan Cook and produced by Margot Pipkin, "Mickey, Donald, Goofy: The Three Musketeers" was released on August 4, 2004. With a revenue of $97.0 million against a budget of $263.1 million, the film received an average rating of 6.3. All for fun and fun for all, this English-language movie runs for a duration of 1 hour and 8 minutes.

title = The Mask 
overview = A young archaeologist believes he is cursed by a mask that causes him to have weird nightmares and possibly to murder. Before committing suicide, he mails the mask to his psychiatrist, Dr. Barnes, who is soon plunged into the nightmare world of the mask. 
production countrie = Canada 
date of release = the 27 of October 1961 
Producer = Julian Roffman 
tagline = Look through the mask...if you can't take it...take it off! 
cast = Paul Stevens, Claudette Nevins, Anne Collings, Bill Walker 
average note = 6.2 
production compagnie = Beaver-Champion Attractions 
duration of the movie = 1h23 
budget = 63.1 millions of dollars 
revenue = 27.9 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = Canada 

In the Canadian-produced thriller "The Mask," a young archaeologist finds himself plagued by disturbing nightmares and a potential murderous curse linked to an ominous mask. Convinced of the mask's malevolent influence, he sends it to his psychiatrist, Dr. Barnes, setting off a chain of terrifying events. As Dr. Barnes delves into the mystery behind the mask, he is drawn into a nightmarish world where reality and hallucination blur. With a stellar cast including Paul Stevens, Claudette Nevins, Anne Collings, and Bill Walker, this chilling tale, released on October 27, 1961, under the direction of producer Julian Roffman, explores the dark consequences of unlocking ancient secrets. As the tagline warns, viewers are invited to "Look through the mask...if you can't take it...take it off!" Despite a budget of 63.1 million dollars, the film grossed 27.9 million dollars at the box office, garnering an average rating of 6.2. With a runtime of 1 hour and 23 minutes, "The Mask" promises a gripping and suspenseful journey into the unknown. The production company behind the movie is Beaver-Champion Attractions.

['correct']

As the tagline warns, viewers are invited to "Look through the mask...if you can't take it...take it off!" Despite a budget of 63.1 million dollars, the film grossed 27.9 million dollars at the box office, garnering an average rating of 6.2. With a runtime of 1 hour and 23 minutes, "The Mask" promises a gripping and suspenseful journey into the unknown. The production company behind the movie is Beaver-Champion Attractions.

title = Beat the Devil 
overview = The script, which was written on a day-to-day basis as the film was being shot, concerns the adventures of a motley crew of swindlers and ne'er-do-wells trying to lay claim to land rich in uranium deposits in Kenya as they wait in a small Italian port to travel aboard an ill-fated tramp steamer en route to Mombasa. 
Producer = Humphrey Bogart 
tagline = They're Out To Beat the Devil At His Own Game! 
duration of the movie = 1h29 
revenue = 2.5 millions of dollars 
cast = Humphrey Bogart, Jennifer Jones, Gina Lollobrigida, Robert Morley 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Santana Pictures Corporation 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Humphrey Bogart 

In "Beat the Devil," produced by the legendary Humphrey Bogart, a group of cunning swindlers and misfits embark on a risky journey to claim uranium-rich land in Kenya. Set in a small Italian port, the motley crew awaits their voyage on a doomed tramp steamer bound for Mombasa. As they plot and scheme, they must outwit the devil himself in a high-stakes game. Starring Humphrey Bogart, Jennifer Jones, Gina Lollobrigida, and Robert Morley, this American production by Santana Pictures Corporation unfolds over 1 hour and 29 minutes of suspense and intrigue. With a revenue of 2.5 million dollars, the tagline rings true: They're Out To Beat the Devil At His Own Game!

title = Tonight She Comes 
overview = After a girl goes missing, two of her friends and a mysterious set of strangers find themselves drawn to the cabin in the woods where she disappeared. They will laugh, they will drink, they will kiss, they will make love, and THEY MUST ALL DIE.

In the chilling horror film "Tonight She Comes," a girl goes missing, prompting two of her friends and a group of mysterious strangers to converge on the secluded cabin in the woods where she was last seen. As the night unfolds, filled with laughter, drinks, and passion, the group soon realizes that they are not alone in the woods. With an ominous sense of impending doom looming over them, they must confront the terrifying truth that THEY MUST ALL DIE.

title = Chopper 
overview = The true and intense story of Mark 'Chopper' Read, a legendary criminal who wrote his autobiography while serving a jail sentence in prison. 
Director = Andrew Dominik 
revenue = 0.2 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.7 
Producer = Michele Bennett 
cast = Eric Bana, Simon Lyndon, David Field, Bill Young 
production countrie = Australia 
duration of the movie = 1h34 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Andrew Dominik 

In "Chopper," directed by Andrew Dominik and produced by Michele Bennett, viewers are taken on a gripping journey through the true and intense story of Mark 'Chopper' Read, a notorious criminal from Australia. While serving time in prison, Chopper decides to document his life in an autobiography, shedding light on his dark and tumultuous past. The film features a stellar cast including Eric Bana, Simon Lyndon, David Field, and Bill Young, who bring this compelling narrative to life. With a runtime of 1 hour and 34 minutes, "Chopper" captivates audiences with its raw portrayal of crime and redemption. Despite its modest revenue of 0.2 million dollars, the film has garnered an average rating of 6.7, making it a must-watch for those intrigued by true crime stories.

Despite its modest revenue of 0.2 million dollars, the film has garnered an average rating of 6.7, making it a must-watch for those intrigued by true crime stories.

title = Monkey Trouble 
overview = Dodger, a criminal monkey, belongs to a crooked street performer but escapes his life of crime only to end up in the arms of Eva, an innocent little girl whose mother has no idea that her daughter is harboring a fugitive. 
Director = Franco Amurri 
cast = Thora Birch, Harvey Keitel, Mimi Rogers, Christopher McDonald 
revenue = 16.5 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 18 of March 1994 
duration of the movie = 1h36 
Producer = Mimi Polk Gitlin 
production countrie = Japan 
tagline = Eva's new friend has big eyes, hairy feet, and very sticky fingers. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Franco Amurri 

In "Monkey Trouble," directed by Franco Amurri, a criminal monkey named Dodger escapes his life of crime with a crooked street performer and finds himself in the care of Eva, an innocent little girl. Unbeknownst to her mother, Eva harbors this fugitive monkey who has a knack for mischief. Starring Thora Birch, Harvey Keitel, Mimi Rogers, and Christopher McDonald, this heartwarming tale takes place in Japan and was released on the 18th of March 1994. With a runtime of 1 hour and 36 minutes, the film grossed $16.5 million at the box office. The producer of the movie is Mimi Polk Gitlin. The tagline "Eva's new friend has big eyes, hairy feet, and very sticky fingers" perfectly captures the essence of this charming family movie.

title = From Paris with Love 
overview = James Reese has a good job as an ambassador's aid in France, but his real passion is a side gig, working in a minor role in the CIA. He would love to be a full-fledged agent and can't believe his luck when he lands an assignment with Charlie Wax. Trigger-happy Charlie soon has James crying for his desk job, but when he learns that the same guys they're trying to catch are after him, James realizes that Charlie may be his only hope of survival. 
Producer = India Osborne 
cast = John Travolta, Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Kasia Smutniak, Richard Durden 
average note = 6.2 
production compagnie = Apipoulaï 
Director = Pierre Morel 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
budget = 52.0 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h32 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 5 of February 2010 
tagline = Two agents. One city. No merci. 
revenue = 52.8 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = India Osborne 

In "From Paris with Love," James Reese, an ambassador's aid with a secret CIA side gig, gets the opportunity of a lifetime when he partners with the trigger-happy agent, Charlie Wax, portrayed by John Travolta. As they navigate through the streets of Paris, James quickly realizes that his survival depends on trusting Charlie, especially when they become targets themselves. Directed by Pierre Morel and released on February 5, 2010, this action-packed film, produced by India Osborne, takes viewers on a thrilling ride through the City of Love. With a stellar cast including Jonathan Rhys Meyers and Kasia Smutniak, "From Paris with Love" delivers a mix of adrenaline-pumping sequences and unexpected twists, earning a revenue of 52.8 million dollars against a budget of 52.0 million dollars. The tagline "Two agents. One city. No merci." perfectly encapsulates the high-stakes nature of this United Kingdom production by Apipoulaï. The movie has an average note of 6.2 and a duration of 1h32. The original language of the movie is English, and the production company is Apipoulaï. The production country is the United Kingdom. The tagline "Two agents. One city. No merci." perfectly encapsulates the high-stakes nature of this United Kingdom production by Apipoulaï. John Travolta, Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Kasia Smutniak, and Richard Durden are part of the cast.

title = Wrongfully Accused 
overview = Ryan Harrison, a violin god, superstar and sex symbol does not want to cheat on sexy Lauren Goodhue's husband with her. Mr. Goodhue is found murdered and Ryan suddenly finds himself being the main suspect. After being sentenced to death he manages to flee while being transferred to his execution site. Now, all the world is after him as he stumbles from one unfortunate incident to the next in order to prove himself innocent - by finding a mysterious one-eyed, one-armed, one-legged man... 
Director = Pat Proft 
tagline = It's not just a movie. It's every movie. 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : Director = Pat Proft 

In the action-packed comedy "Wrongfully Accused," directed by Pat Proft, audiences are taken on a wild ride with Ryan Harrison, a renowned violinist and heartthrob who becomes embroiled in a murder mystery. When the husband of the seductive Lauren Goodhue is found dead, Ryan is wrongly accused and sentenced to death. Determined to clear his name, Ryan escapes custody and sets out on a frantic quest to find a one-eyed, one-armed, one-legged man who holds the key to his innocence. As he navigates a series of hilarious mishaps, Ryan must evade capture and unravel the truth before it's too late. With the tagline "It's not just a movie. It's every movie," this English-language film is a rollercoaster of laughs, thrills, and unexpected twists. Ryan Harrison is portrayed as a violin god, superstar, and sex symbol who is reluctant to engage in an affair with Lauren Goodhue. The original language of the movie is English.

title = West Is West 
overview = Comedy sequel to "East is East".  Manchester, North of England, 1975. The now much diminished, but still claustrophobic and dysfunctional, Khan family continues to struggle for survival. Sajid, the youngest Khan, the runt of the litter, is deep in pubescent crisis under heavy assault both from his father's tyrannical insistence on Pakistani tradition, and from the fierce bullies in the schoolyard. So, in a last, desperate attempt to 'sort him out', his father decides to pack him off to Mrs Khan No 1 and family in the Punjab, the wife and daughters he had abandoned 35 years earlier. It is not long before Ella Khan (Mrs Khan No2) with a small entourage from Salford, England, swiftly follows to sort out the mess, past and present. 
Director = Andy de Emmony 
duration of the movie = 1h43 
cast = Aqib Khan, Om Puri, Linda Bassett, Robert Pugh 
date of release = the 19 of October 2010 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = BBC Films 
budget = 3.8 millions of dollars 
revenue = 3.9 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.3 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Andy de Emmony 

In the heartwarming comedy sequel to "East is East", titled "West Is West", viewers are transported to Manchester, North of England in 1975. The Khan family, though diminished, remains as dysfunctional as ever as they navigate the challenges of cultural traditions and family dynamics. The youngest Khan, Sajid, finds himself in the midst of a pubescent crisis, caught between his father's strict adherence to Pakistani traditions and the relentless schoolyard bullies. In a final attempt to help him find his way, Sajid's father decides to send him to Punjab to live with Mrs. Khan No 1 and her family, whom he had left behind decades ago. As the family confronts their past and present, chaos ensues, leading to unexpected revelations and moments of laughter. Directed by Andy de Emmony, this 1 hour and 43-minute film features a talented cast including Aqib Khan, Om Puri, Linda Bassett, and Robert Pugh. "West Is West" was released on the 19th of October 2010, in English, and was produced by BBC Films with a budget of 3.8 million dollars. Despite its modest budget, the film managed to earn 3.9 million dollars in revenue, showcasing its appeal to audiences. With an average rating of 6.3, "West Is West" offers a delightful blend of humor, heart, and cultural exploration that is sure to entertain viewers of all ages.

The Khan family, though diminished, remains as dysfunctional as ever as they navigate the challenges of cultural traditions and family dynamics. The youngest Khan, Sajid, finds himself in the midst of a pubescent crisis, caught between his father's strict adherence to Pakistani traditions and the relentless schoolyard bullies. In a final attempt to help him find his way, Sajid's father decides to send him to Punjab to live with Mrs. Khan No 1 and her family, whom he had left behind decades ago. As the family confronts their past and present, chaos ensues, leading to unexpected revelations and moments of laughter. Directed by Andy de Emmony, this 1 hour and 43-minute film features a talented cast including Aqib Khan, Om Puri, Linda Bassett, and Robert Pugh. "West Is West" was released on the 19th of October 2010, in English, and was produced by BBC Films with a budget of 3.8 million dollars. Despite its modest budget, the film managed to earn 3.9 million dollars in revenue, showcasing its appeal to audiences. With an average rating of 6.3, "West Is West" offers a delightful blend of humor, heart, and cultural exploration that is sure to entertain viewers of all ages.

Arriving at the test site, the group step into hi-tech gear and prepare for a revolutionary, next-level gaming experience that brings modern warfare to life with frightening realism. At first it’s a unique and exhilarating experience. But what starts out like a dream encounter with cutting edge technology quickly takes a turn for the sinister. Once the group are attacked by enemy combatants, they soon realize this is no game after all. Make a mistake here and you pay with your life. Now these masters of the shoot ‘em up will have to fight for survival within a game gone bad, but this time it’s for real.

In the 1920 horror silent film "Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde," based on Robert Louis Stevenson's novella, "The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde," we witness the captivating performance of actor John Barrymore. Released on the 18th of March 1920 by Famous Players-Lasky Corporation, this American production delves into the duality of human nature through the transformation of Dr. Jekyll into the sinister Mr. Hyde. With a revenue of 179.5 million dollars and an average rating of 6.8, the film showcases the talents of actors such as Charles Willis Lane, Brandon Hurst, and Cecil Clovelly. In "Night of the Blood Beast," produced by Gene Corman, an astronaut tragically meets his demise during re-entry to Earth. However, the horror truly begins when his body becomes a host for rapidly-gestating aliens. As the extraterrestrial creatures grow and multiply within him, a terrifying battle for survival ensues. With an average note of 2.4, this sci-fi thriller promises a chilling and suspenseful viewing experience.

title = The Commune 
overview = Erik, a lecturer in architecture, inherits his father’s large old house in Hellerup, north of Copenhagen. His wife Anna, a well-known television newscaster, suggests that they invite their friends to come and live with them. In this way she hopes to evade the boredom that has begun to seep into their marriage. Before long, a dozen women, men and children move into the country house, make collective decisions, engage in discussions and go swimming together in the nearby Øresund strait. They also rub each other up the wrong way on account of their smaller and larger idiosyncrasies. Their fragile equilibrium threatens to come undone when Erik falls in love with his student Emma and the young woman moves into the house. Fourteen-year-old Freja, daughter of Erik and Anna, aloofly observes these goings-on and seeks her own way. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong(note: there is no mention of revenue or box office numbers in the given description)']
fact : revenue = 209.4 millions of dollars 

In "The Commune," Erik, a lecturer in architecture, unexpectedly inherits his father's spacious old house in Hellerup, north of Copenhagen. When his wife Anna, a renowned television newscaster, proposes the idea of turning the house into a commune with their friends, Erik agrees in hopes of injecting some excitement into their marriage. What starts as a seemingly idyllic living arrangement quickly becomes a complex web of relationships and emotions as a diverse group of individuals come together under one roof. As they navigate collective decision-making, heated discussions, and shared leisure activities like swimming in the nearby Øresund strait, tensions rise due to their differing personalities and quirks. The delicate balance of the commune is further tested when Erik finds himself drawn to his student Emma, who joins the household, sparking jealousy and conflict among the residents. Amidst this turmoil, fourteen-year-old Freja, Erik and Anna's daughter, quietly observes the unfolding drama while forging her own path. Will the commune survive the challenges of love, jealousy, and individual desires, or will it crumble under the weight of its members' complexities?

Facts included in the final description:
1. Erik is a lecturer in architecture.
2. The story is set in Hellerup, north of Copenhagen.
3. Anna is a well-known television newscaster.
4. The commune is formed with a dozen women, men, and children.
5. The commune members engage in discussions and make collective decisions.
6. They go swimming together in the nearby Øresund strait.
7. Tensions rise among the commune members due to their differing personalities and quirks.
8. Erik falls in love with his student Emma.
9. Emma moves into the house.
10. Fourteen-year-old Freja, daughter of Erik and Anna, observes the events in the commune.
11. Freja seeks her own way amidst the drama in the commune.

['correct']
fact : tagline = You Choose Your Family 

In "The Commune," Erik, a lecturer in architecture, unexpectedly inherits his father's spacious old house in Hellerup, north of Copenhagen. When his wife Anna, a renowned television newscaster, proposes the idea of turning the house into a commune with their friends, Erik agrees in hopes of injecting some excitement into their marriage. What starts as a seemingly idyllic living arrangement quickly becomes a complex web of relationships and emotions as a diverse group of individuals come together under one roof. As they navigate collective decision-making, heated discussions, and shared leisure activities like swimming in the nearby Øresund strait, tensions rise due to their differing personalities and quirks. The delicate balance of the commune is further tested when Erik finds himself drawn to his student Emma, who joins the household, sparking jealousy and conflict among the residents. Amidst this turmoil, fourteen-year-old Freja, Erik and Anna's daughter, quietly observes the unfolding drama while forging her own path. Will the commune survive the challenges of love, jealousy, and individual desires, or will it crumble under the weight of its members' complexities?

Facts included in the final description:
1. Erik is a lecturer in architecture.
2. The story is set in Hellerup, north of Copenhagen.
3. Anna is a well-known television newscaster.
4. The commune is formed with a dozen women, men, and children.
5. The commune members engage in discussions and make collective decisions.
6. They go swimming together in the nearby Øresund strait.
7. Tensions rise among the commune members due to their differing personalities and quirks.
8. Erik falls in love with his student Emma.
9. Emma moves into the house.
10. Fourteen-year-old Freja, daughter of Erik and Anna, observes the events in the commune.
11. Freja seeks her own way amidst the drama in the commune.
