title = Ball of Fire 
overview = A group of academics have spent years shut up in a house working on the definitive encyclopedia. When one of them discovers that his entry on slang is hopelessly outdated, he ventures into the wide world to learn about the evolving language. Here he meets Sugarpuss O'Shea, a nightclub singer, who's on top of all the slang and, it just so happens, needs a place to stay. 
production compagnie = Samuel Goldwyn Company, The 
Director = Howard Hawks 
budget = 40.6 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h51 
average note = 7.4 
cast = Gary Cooper, Barbara Stanwyck, S.Z. Sakall, Henry Travers 
date of release = the 2 of December 1941 
Producer = Samuel Goldwyn 
revenue = 77.3 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Samuel Goldwyn Company, The 

In "Ball of Fire," directed by Howard Hawks, a group of academics dedicated to creating the definitive encyclopedia find themselves in a whirlwind of adventure when one of them, played by Gary Cooper, realizes his slang entry is outdated. Venturing into the outside world to update his knowledge, he crosses paths with Sugarpuss O'Shea, a savvy nightclub singer portrayed by Barbara Stanwyck. As they navigate the evolving language together, unexpected connections and comedic situations arise. With a stellar cast including S.Z. Sakall and Henry Travers, this United States production by Samuel Goldwyn Company is a delightful blend of wit, charm, and linguistic exploration. Released on December 2, 1941, the film captivated audiences and critics alike, earning an average rating of 7.4. Despite its budget of 40.6 million dollars, "Ball of Fire" proved to be a commercial success, raking in 77.3 million dollars in revenue.

Sakall and Henry Travers, this United States production by Samuel Goldwyn Company is a delightful blend of wit, charm, and linguistic exploration. Released on December 2, 1941, the film captivated audiences and critics alike, earning an average rating of 7.4. Despite its budget of 40.6 million dollars, "Ball of Fire" proved to be a commercial success, raking in 77.3 million dollars in revenue. 
 
 
FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct!']
fact : tagline = "I LOVE HIM because he doesn't know how to kiss -- THE JERK!" 

In "Ball of Fire," directed by Howard Hawks, a group of academics dedicated to creating the definitive encyclopedia find themselves in a whirlwind of adventure when one of them, played by Gary Cooper, realizes his slang entry is outdated. Venturing into the outside world to update his knowledge, he crosses paths with Sugarpuss O'Shea, a savvy nightclub singer portrayed by Barbara Stanwyck. As they navigate the evolving language together, unexpected connections and comedic situations arise. With a stellar cast including S.Z. Sakall and Henry Travers, this United States production by Samuel Goldwyn Company is a delightful blend of wit, charm, and linguistic exploration. Released on December 2, 1941, the film captivated audiences and critics alike, earning an average rating of 7.4. Despite its budget of 40.6 million dollars, "Ball of Fire" proved to be a commercial success, raking in 77.3 million dollars in revenue. 
 
 

 
title = Robinson Crusoe 
overview = Luis Buñuel made this adaptation of one of the world’s most famous shipwreck novels, Robinson Crusoe by Daniel Defoe, during his Mexican period. Despite the fact that the film veers from Buñuel’s “usual” style, for most it is considered the best film version of Defoe’s book, since the director left his personal touch on the story, and when that director is Buñuel, there’s little room for mediocrity.. 
Director = Luis Buñuel 
cast = Dan O'Herlihy, Jaime Fernández, Felipe de Alba, Chel López 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 1h30 
production compagnie = Producciones Tepeyac 
budget = 0.3 millions of dollars 
revenue = 102.7 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 5 of August 1954 
production countrie = Mexico 
average note = 6.4 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Luis Buñuel 

In Luis Buñuel's adaptation of Daniel Defoe's classic shipwreck novel "Robinson Crusoe," the director's unique touch brings a fresh perspective to the timeless tale. Starring Dan O'Herlihy, Jaime Fernández, Felipe de Alba, and Chel López, this English-language film stands out as one of the best versions of the story to date. Despite deviating from Buñuel's typical style, the movie captivates audiences with its exploration of survival and solitude. Produced by Producciones Tepeyac in Mexico, the film was released on August 5, 1954, and grossed an impressive $102.7 million against a budget of $0.3 million. With a duration of 1 hour and 30 minutes and an average rating of 6.4, "Robinson Crusoe" is a cinematic masterpiece that showcases Buñuel's unparalleled storytelling prowess.

title = Rock the Kasbah 
overview = A washed-up music producer finds one last shot at redemption with a golden-voiced young girl in Afghanistan. However, when jealousy gets the better of a disgruntled ex-boyfriend, he decides to oppose the young star with talent of his own. 
Director = Barry Levinson 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Shangri-La Entertainment 
tagline = Opportunity rocks where you least expect it. 
average note = 5.2 
date of release = the 22 of October 2015 
revenue = 3.0 millions of dollars 
budget = 15.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = Steve Bing 
cast = Bill Murray, Zooey Deschanel, Bruce Willis, Kate Hudson 
duration of the movie = 1h40 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : Director = Barry Levinson 

In the comedic film "Rock the Kasbah," directed by Barry Levinson and produced by Steve Bing, a washed-up music producer, portrayed by Bill Murray, discovers a chance for redemption when he stumbles upon a talented young girl with a golden voice in Afghanistan. As he tries to help her succeed, he faces obstacles, including a jealous ex-boyfriend, played by Bruce Willis, who introduces his own talented protege. With a star-studded cast including Zooey Deschanel and Kate Hudson, this English-language production by Shangri-La Entertainment explores the theme that "Opportunity rocks where you least expect it." Released on October 22, 2015, the movie received an average rating of 5.2. Despite a budget of $15.0 million, the film only grossed $3.0 million at the box office. At a runtime of 1 hour and 40 minutes, "Rock the Kasbah" is a humorous and heartwarming tale of second chances in an unexpected setting.

title = The Secret Life of Plants 
overview = The story is a documentary of research that shows fairly conclusively that plants are actually aware of what goes on around them, even miles away. It is somewhat humorous in the methods it uses to prove the secret life of plants, but thought-provoking in the conclusions it arrives at. The most wonderful thing about the film is the soundtrack. This is original music composed by Stevie Wonder. There is even a scene in the film of Stevie singing one of his songs in a boat on a river. This scene is very moving, as Stevie is blind and yet able to know where he is going. The scene is the climax to the movie, and metaphoric as to what has been presented about plants, that although they don't seem to have senses as human beings and animals do, they are quite well aware of what is going on around them and where they fit into this in the evolutionary process. 
duration of the movie = 1h35 
revenue = 52.7 millions of dollars 
Producer = Michael Braun 
Director = Walon Green 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 8.0 
tagline = An incredible world of beauty and terror with a haunting music score by Stevie Wonder. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h35 

In "The Secret Life of Plants," director Walon Green takes viewers on a thought-provoking journey into the world of plants, revealing through research that plants are not just passive organisms, but are actually aware of their surroundings, even from miles away. The documentary, with a runtime of 1 hour and 35 minutes, presents its findings in a humorous yet compelling manner, leaving audiences amazed by the revelations about plant consciousness. 

One of the most remarkable aspects of the film is its original soundtrack, composed by the legendary Stevie Wonder. The music adds depth and emotion to the narrative, culminating in a powerful scene where Stevie performs one of his songs on a river, showcasing his incredible talent despite his blindness. This moment serves as a metaphor for the film's central theme - that plants, despite lacking human senses, possess a profound awareness of their place in the world.

Produced by Michael Braun and directed by Walon Green, "The Secret Life of Plants" was filmed in the United States of America. The documentary grossed an impressive $52.7 million at the box office, resonating with audiences and critics alike. With an average rating of 8.0, the film captivates viewers with its exploration of the beauty and complexity of the natural world, underscored by a haunting music score by Stevie Wonder. As the tagline suggests, this documentary offers an incredible glimpse into a world where beauty and terror coexist, inviting audiences to reconsider their perception of plant life. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 52.7 millions of dollars

This moment serves as a metaphor for the film's central theme - that plants, despite lacking human senses, possess a profound awareness of their place in the world.

Produced by Michael Braun and directed by Walon Green, "The Secret Life of Plants" was filmed in the United States of America. The documentary grossed an impressive $52.7 million at the box office, resonating with audiences and critics alike. With an average rating of 8.0, the film captivates viewers with its exploration of the beauty and complexity of the natural world, underscored by a haunting music score by Stevie Wonder. As the tagline suggests, this documentary offers an incredible glimpse into a world where beauty and terror coexist, inviting audiences to reconsider their perception of plant life.

The documentary, with a runtime of 1 hour and 35 minutes, presents its findings in a humorous yet compelling manner, leaving audiences amazed by the revelations about plant consciousness. 

One of the most remarkable aspects of the film is its original soundtrack, composed by the legendary Stevie Wonder. The music adds depth and emotion to the narrative, culminating in a powerful scene where Stevie performs one of his songs on a river, showcasing his incredible talent despite his blindness. title = Orchestra Wives 
overview = Connie Ward is in seventh heaven when Gene Morrison's band rolls into town. She is swept off her feet by trumpeter Bill Abbot. After marrying him, she joins the bands tour and learns about life as an orchestra wife, weathering the catty attacks of the other band wives. 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = It's Hep! It's Hot! It's Hilarious! 
production compagnie = Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 5.1 
Director = Archie Mayo 
revenue = 91.1 millions of dollars 
Producer = William LeBaron 
date of release = the 4 of September 1942 
cast = George Montgomery, Ann Rutherford, Glenn Miller, Lynn Bari 
budget = 19.8 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the classic film "Orchestra Wives," directed by Archie Mayo, Connie Ward finds herself living a dream when Gene Morrison's band arrives in town. Enamored by trumpeter Bill Abbot, she quickly marries him and joins the band on tour, experiencing the highs and lows of being an orchestra wife. Set in the United States of America, this musical drama showcases the glamorous yet challenging life of musicians on the road. With a star-studded cast including George Montgomery, Ann Rutherford, Glenn Miller, and Lynn Bari, the film immerses viewers in the world of big band music and the competitive dynamics among band wives. As tensions rise and drama unfolds, audiences are treated to a blend of romance, humor, and music. With a tagline proclaiming "It's Hep! It's Hot! It's Hilarious!" and an average rating of 5.1, "Orchestra Wives" captivates viewers with its timeless charm and captivating performances. Released on September 4, 1942, by Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation, the film grossed an impressive $91.1 million at the box office against a budget of $19.8 million, solidifying its status as a beloved classic in cinematic history. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the fact mentioned is indeed the tagline "it\'s hep! it\'s hot! it\'s hilarious!" and it matches the description provided.']
fact : tagline = It's Hep! It's Hot! It's Hilarious!

It's Hilarious!" and an average rating of 5.1, "Orchestra Wives" captivates viewers with its timeless charm and captivating performances. As tensions rise and drama unfolds, audiences are treated to a blend of romance, humor, and music. With a tagline proclaiming "It's Hep! It's Hot! It's Hilarious!" and an average rating of 5.1, "Orchestra Wives" captivates viewers with its timeless charm and captivating performances. Released on September 4, 1942, by Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation, the film grossed an impressive $91.1 million at the box office against a budget of $19.8 million, solidifying its status as a beloved classic in cinematic history. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the classic film "Orchestra Wives," directed by Archie Mayo, Connie Ward finds herself living a dream when Gene Morrison's band arrives in town. Enamored by trumpeter Bill Abbot, she quickly marries him and joins the band on tour, experiencing the highs and lows of being an orchestra wife. Set in the United States of America, this musical drama showcases the glamorous yet challenging life of musicians on the road. With a star-studded cast including George Montgomery, Ann Rutherford, Glenn Miller, and Lynn Bari, the film immerses viewers in the world of big band music and the competitive dynamics among band wives. As tensions rise and drama unfolds, audiences are treated to a blend of romance, humor, and music. With a tagline proclaiming "It's Hep! It's Hot! title = Milk Money 
overview = Three young boys pool their money and pay V, a kindhearted prostitute, to strip for them. Afterward, she drives them home to the suburbs -- but then her car breaks down. It's just as well, though, because a mobster named Waltzer is after her, and V realizes the suburbs are the perfect place to hide. But things get a lot more complicated when V falls in love with Tom, a single father who is unaware of her real profession. 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the English-language film "Milk Money," three young boys embark on a unique adventure by pooling their money to pay V, a compassionate prostitute, to perform a striptease for them. Afterward, she drives them home to the suburbs, where her car breaks down. Finding the suburbs to be a perfect hiding spot from the pursuing mobster Waltzer, V navigates the complexities of her double life. Amidst these challenges, V unexpectedly falls in love with Tom, a single father who remains unaware of her true profession. Will their budding romance survive the secrets that threaten to unravel it?

title = Of Unknown Origin 
overview = Bart Hughes has a pretty good life, a beautiful wife, a young son, a good job with promotion prospects, and a renovated brownstone in New York. When wife and kid leave for a vacation, Bart stays behind to work on a project that will earn him that promotion, unaware that a certain inhabitant of his basement has other plans for his time. Bart goes a bit bonkers trying to kill this rat, destroying most of his house in the process. Certain allegorical elements tie the household conflict to the "rat race" in his office, but the main event is certainly the night-and-day contest of wills between man and rodent. 
cast = Peter Weller, Jennifer Dale, Lawrence Dane, Kenneth Welsh 
duration of the movie = 1h28 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Peter Weller, Jennifer Dale, Lawrence Dane, Kenneth Welsh 

In the thrilling movie "Of Unknown Origin," Bart Hughes finds himself in a battle of wits with an unexpected foe when his family goes on vacation, leaving him alone in their New York brownstone. As Bart becomes obsessed with exterminating a cunning rat residing in his basement, his once perfect life begins to unravel. Portrayed by Peter Weller, Bart's descent into madness is fueled by his relentless pursuit to rid his home of the rodent, leading to a destructive showdown that mirrors the cutthroat competition of his corporate job. Certain allegorical elements tie the household conflict to the "rat race" in his office, but the main event is certainly the night-and-day contest of wills between man and rodent. With a runtime of 1 hour and 28 minutes, this intense psychological thriller, also starring Jennifer Dale, Lawrence Dane, and Kenneth Welsh, explores the fine line between sanity and obsession in a battle for dominance that will keep viewers on the edge of their seats.

title = A Kiss Before Dying 
overview = Infatuated with the idea of becoming rich, college student Jonathan Corliss secretly dates Dorothy Carlsson to gain the approval of her wealthy father. When Dorothy tells Jonathan that she is pregnant and that her father will deny her inheritance if he finds out, Jonathan murders her, but he stages her death as a suicide. As Jonathan works his way onto Mr. Carlsson's payroll, Dorothy's twin sister, Ellen, investigates the apparent suicide. 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Robert Lawrence 
tagline = Loving him was easy. Trusting him was deadly. 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
Director = James Dearden 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the English-language film "A Kiss Before Dying," produced by Robert Lawrence and released by Universal Pictures in the United Kingdom, college student Jonathan Corliss is driven by his desire for wealth. To win the approval of his girlfriend Dorothy's wealthy father, Jonathan goes to extreme lengths, even resorting to murder when Dorothy reveals she is pregnant and fears losing her inheritance. Jonathan stages her death as a suicide, but Dorothy's twin sister Ellen becomes suspicious and starts investigating the supposed suicide. As the tension rises, the tagline "Loving him was easy. Trusting him was deadly" perfectly captures the dangerous game of deceit and manipulation at play in this thrilling tale directed by James Dearden. The movie is titled "A Kiss Before Dying" and the production company is Universal Pictures. Robert Lawrence is the producer of the film. The original language of the movie is English, and the production country is the United Kingdom.

title = The Uninvited 
overview = Anna returns home after spending time in a psychiatric facility following her mother's tragic death and discovers that her mother's former nurse, Rachel, has moved into their house and become engaged to her father. Soon after she learns this shocking news, Anna is visited by her mother's ghost, who warns her that Rachel has evil intentions. 
Producer = Laurie MacDonald 
Director = Charles Guard 
revenue = 41.6 millions of dollars 
tagline = Can you believe what you see? 
cast = Emily Browning, Arielle Kebbel, David Strathairn, Elizabeth Banks 
budget = 297.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = DreamWorks SKG 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 30 of January 2009 
average note = 6.3 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Laurie MacDonald 

In "The Uninvited," directed by Charles Guard and produced by Laurie MacDonald, we follow Anna as she returns home from a psychiatric facility to find her mother's former nurse, Rachel, now engaged to her father. As Anna grapples with this unsettling revelation, she begins to experience visitations from her deceased mother's ghost, who warns her about Rachel's sinister motives. With a stellar cast including Emily Browning, Arielle Kebbel, David Strathairn, and Elizabeth Banks, the film delves into themes of family secrets and supernatural encounters. Released on January 30, 2009, by DreamWorks SKG, this English-language thriller grossed $41.6 million at the box office, despite its hefty $29.7 million budget. The tagline "Can you believe what you see?" encapsulates the chilling uncertainty that permeates this suspenseful tale, earning it an average rating of 6.3.

title = The Rose 
overview = Midler is the rock-and-roll singer Mary Rose Foster (known as the Rose to her legions of fans), whose romantic relationships and mental health are continuously imperiled by the demands of life on the road. 
date of release = the 7 of November 1979 
budget = 9.2 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 2h05 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Bette Midler, Alan Bates, Frederic Forrest, Harry Dean Stanton 
tagline = She gave and gave, until she had nothing left to give 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 7 of November 1979 

In "The Rose," released on the 7th of November 1979 in the United States of America, Bette Midler shines as Mary Rose Foster, a rock-and-roll sensation known as the Rose to her adoring fans. As she navigates the challenges of life on the road, her romantic entanglements and mental well-being are constantly at risk. With a budget of 9.2 million dollars, this gripping tale unfolds over a duration of 2 hours and 5 minutes, featuring a talented cast including Alan Bates, Frederic Forrest, and Harry Dean Stanton. The tagline "She gave and gave, until she had nothing left to give" encapsulates the emotional journey of this iconic film.

title = Speaking of Bunuel 
overview = Documentary about the film maker Luis Bunuel. Surrealist master Luis Bunuel is a towering figure in the world of cinema history, directing such groundbreaking works as Un Chien Andalou, Exterminating Angels, and That Obscure Object of Desire, yet his personal life was clouded in myth and paradox. Though sexually diffident, he frequently worked in the erotic drama genre; though personally quite conservative, his films are florid, flamboyant, and utterly bizarre. This documentary, directed Jose Luis Lopez Linares, tries to illuminate some of these contradictions. 
tagline = 'You believe in God, I believe in mystery' 
date of release = the 9 of June 2000 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Luis Buñuel, José Sancho, Silvia Pinal, Ángela Molina 
Producer = Jorge Sánchez 
revenue = 7.7 millions of dollars 
average note = 6.5 
budget = 35.9 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = 'You believe in God, I believe in mystery' 

In "Speaking of Bunuel," a captivating documentary directed by Jose Luis Lopez Linares, viewers are taken on a journey into the enigmatic world of surrealist master Luis Bunuel. Known for directing groundbreaking works such as "Un Chien Andalou," "Exterminating Angels," and "That Obscure Object of Desire," Bunuel's personal life is shrouded in myth and paradox. Despite his sexual diffidence, he delved into the erotic drama genre, and despite his personal conservatism, his films are characterized by flamboyance and bizarre elements. Through interviews and archival footage, this film, produced by Jorge Sánchez, seeks to shed light on the complexities of Bunuel's persona. Starring Luis Buñuel, José Sancho, Silvia Pinal, and Ángela Molina, "Speaking of Bunuel" delves into the mind of a cinematic genius. As the tagline suggests, "You believe in God, I believe in mystery." Released on June 9, 2000, in the United States of America, the documentary grossed $7.7 million, with an average rating of 6.5, against a budget of $35.9 million.

['correct']
fact : date of release = the 9 of June 2000

title = Troll Hunter 
overview = A group of students investigates a series of mysterious bear killings, but learns that there are much more dangerous things going on. They start to follow a mysterious hunter, learning that he is actually a troll hunter. 
Director = André Øvredal 
revenue = 4.2 millions of dollars 
cast = Otto Jespersen, Hans Morten Hansen, Tomas Alf Larsen, Johanna Mørck 
production compagnie = Filmkameratene A/S 
average note = 6.7 
budget = 3.5 millions of dollars 
production countrie = Norway 
date of release = the 29 of October 2010 
tagline = You believe it when you see it! 
Producer = John M. Jacobsen 
duration of the movie = 1h43 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : Director = André Øvredal 

In the thrilling movie "Troll Hunter," directed by André Øvredal and produced by John M. Jacobsen, a group of students embarks on an investigation into a series of mysterious bear killings, only to uncover a far more perilous truth. As they shadow a secretive hunter, they soon realize that he is no ordinary tracker - he is a troll hunter. With a stellar cast including Otto Jespersen, Hans Morten Hansen, Tomas Alf Larsen, and Johanna Mørck, this Norwegian production from Filmkameratene A/S takes viewers on a gripping journey. Released on October 29, 2010, in Norway, the film garnered an average rating of 6.7 and grossed $4.2 million in revenue against a $3.5 million budget. The tagline "You believe it when you see it!" perfectly encapsulates the awe-inspiring and suspenseful 1 hour and 43-minute runtime of this captivating cinematic experience.

title = Vincent N Roxxy 
overview = A small town loner and a rebellious punk rocker unexpectedly fall in love as they are forced on the run and soon discover violence follows them everywhere. 
Director = Gary Michael Schultz 
date of release = the 18 of April 2016 
cast = Emile Hirsch, Zoë Kravitz, Emory Cohen, Zoey Deutch 
budget = 5.0 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h50 
average note = 5.6 
Producer = Keith Kjarval 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 250.2 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Gary Michael Schultz 

In the action-packed film "Vincent N Roxxy," directed by Gary Michael Schultz, a small town loner and a rebellious punk rocker find themselves unexpectedly falling in love. As they are forced to go on the run, they quickly realize that violence is never far behind. Starring Emile Hirsch, Zoë Kravitz, Emory Cohen, and Zoey Deutch, this movie was released on the 18th of April 2016. With a budget of 5.0 million dollars, the film managed to generate an impressive revenue of 250.2 million dollars. Produced by Keith Kjarval, this 1 hour and 50-minute movie is presented in its original language, English, and has received an average note of 5.6.

Starring Emile Hirsch, Zoë Kravitz, Emory Cohen, and Zoey Deutch, this movie was released on the 18th of April 2016. With a budget of 5.0 million dollars, the film managed to generate an impressive revenue of 250.2 million dollars. Produced by Keith Kjarval, this 1 hour and 50-minute movie is presented in its original language, English, and has received an average note of 5.6.

title = I Am Sam 
overview = Sam has the mental capacity of a 7-year-old. He has a daughter with a homeless woman who abandons them when they leave the hospital, leaving Sam to raise Lucy on his own. But as Lucy grows up, Sam's limitations start to become a problem and the authorities take her away. Sam shames high-priced lawyer Rita into taking his case pro bono and in turn teaches her the value of love and family. 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Sean Penn, Michelle Pfeiffer, Dianne Wiest, Dakota Fanning 
revenue = 92.5 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.2 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 28 of December 2001 
duration of the movie = 2h12 
budget = 22.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = Edward Zwick 
tagline = love is all you need 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the heartwarming drama "I Am Sam," we follow the story of Sam, a man with the mental capacity of a 7-year-old, who finds himself raising his daughter Lucy on his own after her mother abandons them. As Lucy grows older, Sam's limitations become a concern, leading to authorities taking her away. Desperate to regain custody, Sam enlists the help of high-priced lawyer Rita, who is initially reluctant but is eventually moved by Sam's unwavering love for his daughter. Through their journey, Sam teaches Rita the true value of love and family. Starring Sean Penn, Michelle Pfeiffer, Dianne Wiest, and Dakota Fanning, this emotional tale set in the United States of America touches on themes of compassion, sacrifice, and the power of unconditional love. With a box office revenue of 92.5 million dollars and an average rating of 7.2, "I Am Sam" directed by Edward Zwick is a poignant reminder that sometimes, love is all you need. The movie was released on the 28th of December 2001, has a duration of 2 hours and 12 minutes, and was produced with a budget of 22.0 million dollars. The original language of the movie is English, and its tagline is "love is all you need."

['correct']

title = How to Train Your Dragon 2 
overview = The thrilling second chapter of the epic How To Train Your Dragon trilogy brings back the fantastical world of Hiccup and Toothless five years later. While Astrid, Snotlout and the rest of the gang are challenging each other to dragon races (the island's new favorite contact sport), the now inseparable pair journey through the skies, charting unmapped territories and exploring new worlds. When one of their adventures leads to the discovery of a secret ice cave that is home to hundreds of new wild dragons and the mysterious Dragon Rider, the two friends find themselves at the center of a battle to protect the peace. 
date of release = the 12 of June 2014 
Director = Dean DeBlois 
revenue = 609.1 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.6 
production compagnie = DreamWorks Animation 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : date of release = the 12 of June 2014 

In the thrilling sequel "How to Train Your Dragon 2," directed by Dean DeBlois, we are reunited with Hiccup and Toothless five years after the events of the first film. The duo, now inseparable, embark on exciting adventures through uncharted territories and new worlds. When they stumble upon a hidden ice cave housing hundreds of wild dragons and encounter the enigmatic Dragon Rider, they become entangled in a battle to protect the peace. As Astrid, Snotlout, and their friends engage in dragon races, a new favorite sport on the island, Hiccup and Toothless must face their biggest challenge yet. With a staggering revenue of 609.1 million dollars and an average rating of 7.6, this DreamWorks Animation production, originally released on June 12, 2014, in the United States, continues to captivate audiences with its breathtaking animation and heartwarming story.

date of release = the 21 of May 1993

In the suspenseful thriller "Sliver," released on the 21st of May 1993, a woman relocates to a chic apartment in Manhattan, only to uncover a chilling mystery surrounding the previous tenant's tragic demise by falling from the balcony. As she delves deeper into the secrets of her new residence, she realizes that danger lurks behind every corner, leading to a heart-pounding revelation that will leave audiences on the edge of their seats.

title = About a Girl 
overview = Charleen is 15, melodramatic, mega depressed, and Kurt Cobain’s biggest fan. Her best friend Isa is getting really boring, her dad is out of the picture, and her mom has hooked up with her biology teacher. Even though she has an apprenticeship preparing bodies for funerals, which is pretty cool, her musical idols are all dead. It’s about time Charleen was, too. 
average note = 7.3 
tagline = Das Leben steckt voller Überraschungen 
Director = Mark Monheim 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 7.3 

In "About a Girl," directed by Mark Monheim, we are introduced to Charleen, a 15-year-old girl who is deeply immersed in her love for Kurt Cobain and struggling with depression. Her best friend Isa is becoming dull, her family dynamics are complicated with her absent father and her mother dating her biology teacher. Despite having a unique apprenticeship preparing bodies for funerals, Charleen finds solace in the music of her deceased idols. As she navigates through her tumultuous life, Charleen contemplates the idea that perhaps it's time for her to join her musical heroes in death. With an average note of 7.3, this film reminds us that "Das Leben steckt voller Überraschungen" - life is full of surprises. 

Facts included:
- Charleen is 15 years old
- Charleen is melodramatic and struggling with depression
- Charleen is Kurt Cobain’s biggest fan
- Charleen has an apprenticeship preparing bodies for funerals
- Charleen's best friend is Isa
- Charleen's dad is out of the picture
- Charleen's mom has hooked up with her biology teacher
- Charleen's musical idols are all dead
- The film is directed by Mark Monheim
- The film has an average note of 7.3

title = Three Seasons 
overview = Three Seasons wants to show individuals triumphing over adversities, recovering from traumas, looking forward to better times, as well as nostalgia for those better days before American and French and other invasions, material and ideological. It is a poetic film that tries to paint a picture of the urban culture undergoing westernisation. 
budget = 2.8 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 2.8 millions of dollars 

In "Three Seasons," a poetic film with a budget of 2.8 million dollars, viewers are taken on a journey through urban culture undergoing westernization. The movie showcases individuals triumphing over adversities, recovering from traumas, and looking forward to better times, all while reflecting on nostalgia for the days before American, French, and other invasions, both material and ideological. Through its poignant storytelling, "Three Seasons" captures the essence of resilience and hope in the face of changing times. 
 
 
TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h45 

In "Three Seasons," a poetic film with a budget of 2.8 million dollars, viewers are taken on a journey through urban culture undergoing westernization. The movie showcases individuals triumphing over adversities, recovering from traumas, and looking forward to better times, all while reflecting on nostalgia for the days before American, French, and other invasions, both material and ideological. Through its poignant storytelling, "Three Seasons" captures the essence of resilience and hope in the face of changing times.

title = Superman/Shazam!: The Return of Black Adam 
overview = Chosen the world’s protector against the Seven Deadly Enemies of Man – pride, envy, greed, hatred, selfishness, laziness and injustice – young Billy Batson accepts his destiny as Captain Marvel. Battling alongside Superman against nefarious Black Adam, Billy soon discovers the challenge super heroes ultimately face: is it revenge or justice? 
production compagnie = DC Comics 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Joaquim Dos Santos 
date of release = the 9 of November 2010 
Director = Joaquim Dos Santos 
average note = 7.1 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 45.6 millions of dollars 
cast = George Newbern, Jerry O'Connell, Arnold Vosloo, Zach Callison 
revenue = 174.3 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = DC Comics 

In the action-packed movie "Superman/Shazam!: The Return of Black Adam," produced by DC Comics, young Billy Batson embraces his role as Captain Marvel, chosen to protect the world from the Seven Deadly Enemies of Man. Teaming up with Superman to take down the villainous Black Adam, Billy grapples with the age-old dilemma faced by superheroes: seeking revenge or delivering justice. Directed by Joaquim Dos Santos, the film was released on November 9, 2010, in the original language of English. With a stellar cast including George Newbern, Jerry O'Connell, Arnold Vosloo, and Zach Callison, the movie received an average rating of 7.1. Set in the United States of America, the film had a budget of 45.6 million dollars and went on to generate a whopping 174.3 million dollars in revenue. The production company behind this superhero film is DC Comics.

title = Judgment Night 
overview = While racing to a boxing match, Frank, Mike, John and Rey get more than they bargained for. A wrong turn lands them directly in the path of Fallon, a vicious, wise-cracking drug lord. After accidentally witnessing Fallon murder a disloyal henchman, the four become his unwilling prey in a savage game of cat &amp; mouse as they are mercilessly stalked through the urban jungle in this taut suspense drama 
Director = Stephen Hopkins 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Gene Levy 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Stephen Hopkins 

In the heart-pounding thriller "Judgment Night," directed by Stephen Hopkins and produced by Gene Levy, a simple trip to a boxing match takes a terrifying turn for Frank, Mike, John, and Rey. When they accidentally witness a brutal murder committed by the ruthless drug lord Fallon, portrayed with chilling charisma, the four friends find themselves hunted through the urban jungle in a deadly game of cat and mouse. As they struggle to survive the night, the tension escalates in this taut suspense drama, presented in its original English language by Universal Pictures.

title = This Movie Is Broken 
overview = Bruno wakes up in bed next to Caroline, his long time crush. But tomorrow she's off for school in France, and maybe she only granted this miracle as a parting gift for her long time friend. So tonight is Bruno's last chance. And tonight, as it happens, Broken Social Scene, her favourite band, is throwing a big outdoor bash. Maybe if Bruno, with the help of his best pal Blake, can score tickets and give Caroline a night to remember, he can keep this miracle alive. 

FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = Canada 

title = This Movie Is Broken 
overview = Bruno wakes up in bed next to Caroline, his long time crush. But tomorrow she's off for school in France, and maybe she only granted this miracle as a parting gift for her long time friend. So tonight is Bruno's last chance. And tonight, as it happens, Broken Social Scene, her favourite band, is throwing a big outdoor bash. Maybe if Bruno, with the help of his best pal Blake, can score tickets and give Caroline a night to remember, he can keep this miracle alive. 

In the movie "This Movie Is Broken," Bruno finds himself in a bittersweet situation as he wakes up next to his long-time crush, Caroline, who is about to leave for school in France. With tomorrow marking their potential separation, Bruno sees this as his final opportunity to make a move. As luck would have it, Caroline's favorite band, Broken Social Scene, is hosting a massive outdoor event that very night. With the help of his loyal friend Blake, Bruno sets out to secure tickets to the concert in hopes of creating a memorable evening for Caroline. Will Bruno be able to seize the moment and make it a night to remember, or will this chance slip away with Caroline's departure?

In the movie "This Movie Is Broken," Bruno finds himself in a bittersweet situation as he wakes up next to his long-time crush, Caroline, who is about to leave for school in France. With tomorrow marking their potential separation, Bruno sees this as his final opportunity to make a move. As luck would have it, Caroline's favorite band, Broken Social Scene, is hosting a massive outdoor event that very night. With the help of his loyal friend Blake, Bruno sets out to secure tickets to the concert in hopes of creating a memorable evening for Caroline. Will Bruno be able to seize the moment and make it a night to remember, or will this chance slip away with Caroline's departure? 
 
 
FP  -  FalsePositive

overview = Bruno wakes up in bed next to Caroline, his long time crush. But tomorrow she's off for school in France, and maybe she only granted this miracle as a parting gift for her long time friend. So tonight is Bruno's last chance. And tonight, as it happens, Broken Social Scene, her favourite band, is throwing a big outdoor bash. Maybe if Bruno, with the help of his best pal Blake, can score tickets and give Caroline a night to remember, he can keep this miracle alive.

title = Kaabil 
overview = Rohan (Hritik roshan) is a kind, happy young man who has been blind since birth and works as a voice-over artist for a living. Through friends, he meets Supriya (Yami Gautam), a working woman who is also blind, but proudly independent. The two start liking each other and get married. Rohan toughest journey starts in his quest of vengeance for Supriya's indirect murderers. 
date of release = the 26 of January 2017 
original language of the movie = Hindi 
revenue = 117.1 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 26 of January 2017 

In the 2017 Hindi film "Kaabil," Rohan (played by Hritik Roshan) is a kind and happy young man who has been blind since birth. He works as a voice-over artist and meets Supriya (played by Yami Gautam), a strong and independent working woman who is also blind. The two fall in love, get married, and their lives take a tragic turn when Supriya is indirectly murdered. Rohan embarks on a journey for vengeance against those responsible for his wife's death. "Kaabil" was released on the 26th of January 2017 and grossed an impressive $117.1 million in revenue. The movie is in the original Hindi language.

duration of the movie = 1h54

budget = 256.7 millions of dollars

fact : production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 

In "Alfie," produced by Paramount Pictures, we follow the journey of a young man who indulges in a promiscuous lifestyle until a series of life-changing events force him to reevaluate his priorities and aspirations. With a runtime of 1 hour and 54 minutes, this film stars Michael Caine, Shelley Winters, Millicent Martin, and Julia Foster. With a budget of 256.7 million dollars, "Alfie" poses the question, "Is any man an Alfie? Ask any girl!"

overview = Alan Clay, a struggling American businessman, travels to Saudi Arabia to sell a new technology to the King, only to be challenged by endless Middle Eastern bureaucracy, a perpetually absent monarch, and a suspicious growth on his back. 
budget = 30.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 22 of April 2016 
cast = Tom Hanks, Sarita Choudhury, Sidse Babett Knudsen, Ben Whishaw 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = Mexico

['wrong']
fact : budget = 30.0 millions of dollars 

In the movie "A Hologram for the King," we follow Alan Clay, a determined American businessman portrayed by Tom Hanks, on a challenging journey to Saudi Arabia. With a budget of 30 million dollars, this film, released on the 22nd of April 2016, takes us through Alan's struggles with Middle Eastern bureaucracy, an elusive monarch, and an unexpected health concern. Alongside a talented cast including Sarita Choudhury, Sidse Babett Knudsen, and Ben Whishaw, the story unfolds in English, despite being produced in Mexico. Will Alan overcome these obstacles and successfully pitch his new technology to the King?

With a budget of 30 million dollars, this film, released on the 22nd of April 2016, takes us through Alan's struggles with Middle Eastern bureaucracy, an elusive monarch, and an unexpected health concern. Alongside a talented cast including Sarita Choudhury, Sidse Babett Knudsen, and Ben Whishaw, the story unfolds in English, despite being produced in Mexico. Will Alan overcome these obstacles and successfully pitch his new technology to the King?

In "Hot Pursuit," directed by Anne Fletcher and produced by Dana Fox, an uptight by-the-book cop finds herself in a high-stakes situation when she must protect the widow of a drug boss from crooked cops and gunmen. Starring Reese Witherspoon, Sofía Vergara, Michael Mosley, and John Carroll Lynch, this action-comedy takes viewers on a wild ride filled with humor and suspense. With a tagline that promises they are armed and sort-of dangerous, the movie was released on the 8th of May 2015 by New Line Cinema. Despite its average note of 5.4, the film's fast-paced 1 hour and 27-minute duration keeps audiences entertained throughout. With a budget of 35.0 million dollars, "Hot Pursuit" delivers a thrilling and comedic experience that will leave you on the edge of your seat.

title = How to Make a Monster 
overview = When master monster make-up man Pete Dumond is fired by the new bosses of American International studios, he uses his creations to exact revenge. 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 82.4 millions of dollars 
Producer = Herman Cohen 
average note = 5.2 
tagline = See the Ghastly Ghouls in Flaming Color! 
Director = Herbert L. Strock 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Robert H. Harris, Paul Brinegar, Gary Conway, Gary Clarke 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "How to Make a Monster," master monster make-up man Pete Dumond finds himself out of a job after being fired by the new bosses of American International studios. Seeking revenge, he utilizes his creations to unleash terror. Directed by Herbert L. Strock and produced by Herman Cohen, this English-language film showcases a talented cast including Robert H. Harris, Paul Brinegar, Gary Conway, and Gary Clarke. With a revenue of 82.4 million dollars and an average rating of 5.2, audiences are in for a thrilling ride as they witness the ghastly ghouls in flaming color. Don't miss this chilling tale set in the United States of America. The tagline for the movie is "See the Ghastly Ghouls in Flaming Color!"

title = Operation Avalanche 
overview = In 1967, four undercover CIA agents were sent to NASA posing as a documentary film crew. What they discovered led to one of the biggest conspiracies in American history. 
date of release = the 29 of July 2016 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h34 
original language of the movie = English

production compagnie = XYZ Films 
tagline = It's not a lie if you believe it 
budget = 1.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = Matthew Miller 
average note = 6.5 
Director = Matt Johnson 
revenue = 216.6 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 29 of July 2016 

In the thrilling movie "Operation Avalanche" released on the 29th of July 2016 in the United States of America, director Matt Johnson takes viewers on a captivating journey back to 1967. The film follows four undercover CIA agents who disguise themselves as a documentary film crew at NASA. As they delve deeper into their mission, they uncover shocking truths that unravel into one of the biggest conspiracies in American history. With a budget of 1.0 million dollars, the film managed to generate a revenue of 216.6 million dollars, proving to be a successful venture for producer Matthew Miller and XYZ Films. Starring Matt Johnson, Owen Williams, Jared Raab, and Josh Boles, "Operation Avalanche" keeps audiences on the edge of their seats for 1 hour and 34 minutes, all while delivering a compelling narrative in English. The tagline "It's not a lie if you believe it" adds an extra layer of intrigue to this riveting tale, earning an average note of 6.5.

title = Band of Brothers 
overview = Drawn from interviews with survivors of Easy Company, as well as their journals and letters, Band of Brothers chronicles the experiences of these men from paratrooper training in Georgia through the end of the war. As an elite rifle company parachuting into Normandy early on D-Day morning, participants in the Battle of the Bulge, and witness to the horrors of war, the men of Easy knew extraordinary bravery and extraordinary fear - and became the stuff of legend. Based on Stephen E. Ambrose's acclaimed book of the same name.

['correct']
fact : Producer = Gary Goetzman 

The description is missing the fact that the series "Band of Brothers" is based on real events and real people. 

Updated overview: 
Drawn from interviews with survivors of Easy Company, as well as their journals and letters, Band of Brothers chronicles the experiences of these real men from paratrooper training in Georgia through the end of the war. As an elite rifle company parachuting into Normandy early on D-Day morning, participants in the Battle of the Bulge, and witness to the horrors of war, the men of Easy knew extraordinary bravery and extraordinary fear - and became the stuff of legend. Based on Stephen E. Ambrose's acclaimed book of the same name, this series immortalizes the legendary feats of these courageous individuals, making them true heroes of history.

title = Leprechaun 2 
overview = A thousand years ago, the Leprechaun left a bloody trail when he ripped through the countryside in search of his stolen gold. Now he's back in the big city using all of his deadly tricks to snare the girl of his nightmares. His bloody quest becomes more deadly when her boyfriend steals one of the Leprechaun's gold coins. The town soon discovers two dead bodies and a trail of gold dust leads them to the Leprechaun's lair. 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In "Leprechaun 2," the mischievous and murderous Leprechaun returns to the big city, using his deadly tricks to pursue the girl of his nightmares. When her boyfriend steals one of the Leprechaun's gold coins, his bloody quest escalates, leaving a trail of chaos and death in his wake. As the town uncovers two dead bodies and follows a trail of gold dust to the Leprechaun's lair, a deadly showdown looms. title = Frost 
overview = A young couple, physiologist Agla and filmmaker Gunnar, wake up at a glacier drilling camp only to find the camp mysteriously abandoned and their co-workers gone. When searching for the lost team they realize they’re up against an unknown deadly force.

In the chilling thriller "Frost," directed by Reynir Lyngdal and produced by Solar Films, a young couple, physiologist Agla and filmmaker Gunnar, awaken at a glacier drilling camp to a haunting discovery - their camp is deserted, and their colleagues have vanished. When searching for the lost team, they realize they’re up against an unknown deadly force. Starring Anna Gunndís Guðmundsdóttir, Björn Thors, Helgi Björnsson, and Einar Dagbjartsson, this suspenseful film with a runtime of 1 hour and 20 minutes captivated audiences worldwide, grossing an impressive $90.5 million at the box office.

title = Thick as Thieves 
overview = A master thief recruits a notorious thief to help him steal two famous Faberge eggs from an impenetrable vault in an effort to pull off one final job and repay his debt to the Russian mob. 
revenue = 145.8 millions of dollars 
Producer = Les Weldon 
budget = 25.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Revelations Entertainment 
duration of the movie = 1h44 
Director = Mimi Leder 
average note = 5.7 
cast = Morgan Freeman, Antonio Banderas, Radha Mitchell, Robert Forster 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 145.8 millions of dollars 

In "Thick as Thieves," directed by Mimi Leder and produced by Les Weldon, a master thief played by Morgan Freeman enlists the help of a notorious thief, portrayed by Antonio Banderas, to steal two famous Faberge eggs from an impenetrable vault. The heist is part of a final job to repay his debt to the Russian mob. With a budget of 25.0 million dollars, the movie went on to earn an impressive revenue of 145.8 million dollars. The film, with a runtime of 1 hour and 44 minutes, was produced by Revelations Entertainment and also stars Radha Mitchell and Robert Forster. Despite its star-studded cast, the movie received an average rating of 5.7.

title = The Assassination of Richard Nixon 
overview = It’s 1974 and Sam Bicke has lost everything. His wife leaves him with his three kids, his boss fires him, his brother turns away from him, and the bank won’t give him any money to start anew. He tries to find someone to blame for his misfortunes and comes up with the President of the United States who he plans to murder. 
cast = Sean Penn, Naomi Watts, Don Cheadle, Jack Thompson 
duration of the movie = 1h35 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = The mad story of a true man.

title = The Assassination of Richard Nixon

tagline = The mad story of a true man. 

In "The Assassination of Richard Nixon," set in 1974, we follow the gripping tale of Sam Bicke, portrayed by Sean Penn, who faces a series of devastating losses in his life. His desperation leads him to a chilling plan to assassinate the President of the United States, whom he blames for his misfortunes. With a stellar cast including Naomi Watts, Don Cheadle, and Jack Thompson, this English-language film runs for 1 hour and 35 minutes. As the tagline suggests, it unravels the mad story of a true man on the brink of a fateful decision.

His desperation leads him to a chilling plan to assassinate the President of the United States, whom he blames for his misfortunes. With a stellar cast including Naomi Watts, Don Cheadle, and Jack Thompson, this English-language film runs for 1 hour and 35 minutes. As the tagline suggests, it unravels the mad story of a true man on the brink of a fateful decision. 
 
 
FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Monsoon Pictures 

title = The Assassination of Richard Nixon 
overview = It’s 1974 and Sam Bicke has lost everything. His wife leaves him with his three kids, his boss fires him, his brother turns away from him, and the bank won’t give him any money to start anew. He tries to find someone to blame for his misfortunes and comes up with the President of the United States who he plans to murder.

title = The Vampire Lovers 
overview = In the heart of Styria the Karnstein Family, even after their mortal deaths, rise from their tombs spreading evil in the countryside in their lust for fresh blood. Baron Hartog whose family are all victims of Karnstein vampirism, opens their graves and drives a stake through their diabolical hearts. One grave he cannot locate is that of the legendary beautiful Mircalla Karnstein. Years of peace follow that grisly night until Mircalla reappears to avenge her family's decimation and satisfy her desire for blood. 
average note = 6.5 
production compagnie = Hammer Film Productions 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = An erotic nightmare of tormented lusts that throb in headless, undead bodies! 
cast = Ingrid Pitt, Peter Cushing, George Cole, Kate O'Mara 
Director = Roy Ward Baker 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct(note: there are multiple facts mentioned in the description, but all the correct facts are mentioned)']
fact : average note = 6.5 

In "The Vampire Lovers," a tale of ancient evil unfolds in the heart of Styria, where the Karnstein Family's thirst for fresh blood knows no bounds even beyond the grave. Baron Hartog, driven by a personal vendetta against the vampiric family, embarks on a mission to rid the countryside of their malevolent presence. However, his efforts are thwarted when the beautiful and vengeful Mircalla Karnstein, whose grave remains elusive, returns to seek retribution and quench her insatiable bloodlust. Directed by Roy Ward Baker and featuring a stellar cast including Ingrid Pitt, Peter Cushing, George Cole, and Kate O'Mara, this Hammer Film Productions' horror flick delivers an erotic nightmare of tormented desires pulsating within the undead. With an average rating of 6.5, "The Vampire Lovers" weaves a chilling tale of terror and seduction in its original English language, captivating audiences with its haunting narrative.

title = La Dolce Vita 
overview = Episodic journey of an Italian journalist scouring Rome in search of love. 
revenue = 19.5 millions of dollars 
Director = Federico Fellini 
duration of the movie = 2h54 
budget = 135.0 millions of dollars 
cast = Marcello Mastroianni, Anita Ekberg, Anouk Aimée, Yvonne Furneaux 
production countrie = Italy 
tagline = The world's most talked about movie today! 
Producer = Giuseppe Amato 
date of release = the 5 of February 1960 
average note = 7.9 
original language of the movie = Italian 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 19.5 millions of dollars 

In Federico Fellini's "La Dolce Vita," viewers are taken on an episodic journey through the bustling streets of Rome as an Italian journalist embarks on a quest for love. With a star-studded cast including Marcello Mastroianni, Anita Ekberg, Anouk Aimée, and Yvonne Furneaux, this Italian production captivated audiences upon its release on the 5th of February 1960. The film, with a runtime of 2 hours and 54 minutes, garnered an impressive revenue of 19.5 million dollars, despite having a budget of 135 million dollars. As the world's most talked-about movie at the time, "La Dolce Vita" received an average rating of 7.9, captivating viewers with its original Italian language and leaving a lasting impact on cinema history. The movie was produced by Giuseppe Amato in Italy. The tagline for the film was "The world's most talked about movie today!"

With a star-studded cast including Marcello Mastroianni, Anita Ekberg, Anouk Aimée, and Yvonne Furneaux, this Italian production captivated audiences upon its release on the 5th of February 1960. The film, with a runtime of 2 hours and 54 minutes, garnered an impressive revenue of 19.5 million dollars, despite having a budget of 135 million dollars. As the world's most talked-about movie at the time, "La Dolce Vita" received an average rating of 7.9, captivating viewers with its original Italian language and leaving a lasting impact on cinema history. The movie was produced by Giuseppe Amato in Italy. The tagline for the film was "The world's most talked about movie today!"

overview = Rocket Singh - Salesman of the Year is the sometimes thoughtless, sometimes thoughtful story of a fresh graduate trying to find a balance between the maddening demands of the 'professional' way, and the way of his heart - and stumbling upon a crazy way which turned his world upside down, and his career right side up. title = Deathstalker and the Warriors from Hell 
overview = The third thrilling saga of Deathstalker pits him against the evil wizard and ruler of the Southland, Troxartes, and his band of undead warriors. Dashing Deathstalker is entrusted by the beautiful Princess Carissa to protect an enchanted Jewel one of three which together hold the key to the lost city of treasure, Erendor. The missing pair of gems are stashed all too safely in the heavily guarded castle of the wicked Troxartes. His mission clear, Deathstalker rouses his troops and storms the fortress with the power of lightning. And in this fateful battle, one man will survive to witness the magical secrets of Erendor. 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 1 of January 1988 
revenue = 2.2 millions of dollars

Tasked with protecting a mystical Jewel that is crucial to unlocking the lost city of Erendor, Deathstalker must infiltrate Troxartes' heavily guarded castle to retrieve the missing gems. With the help of Princess Carissa, Deathstalker leads a daring assault on the fortress, using the power of lightning to aid in the epic battle that will determine the fate of Erendor. As the dust settles, only one man will emerge victorious and uncover the magical secrets of this ancient city. Set in the United States of America and released on January 1, 1988, "Deathstalker and the Warriors from Hell" grossed an impressive $2.2 million at the box office.

In "Final Destination 2," directed by David R. Ellis and produced by New Line Cinema, Kimberly experiences a terrifying premonition of a deadly highway accident. By blocking the freeway, she saves a group of people from their fateful demise... or so they think. As the survivors begin to mysteriously meet their end one by one, Kimberly must race against time to unravel the mystery and prevent her own impending doom. With a budget of 26.0 million dollars, this English-language film with an average rating of 5.9 keeps viewers on the edge of their seats for its 1 hour and 30-minute duration. Remember, in this thrilling sequel, death is like a boomerang - it keeps coming back.

title = Rock On!! 
overview = Sakshi Shroff, the lonely and neglected wife of busy banking executive, Aditya, decides to give him a surprise on his birthday on July 22nd, but ends surprising him multiple times. While Aditya is thrilled to know that he is going to be a dad, he is unhappy when he notices that Sakshi had also invited some ghosts (Rob Nancy and Kedar Zaveri) from his past. This gives rise to unpleasant memories involving a failed music group 'Magik' ; why the music group broke up, the acrimony especially between Aditya and his former friend, Joseph Mascarenhas; Sakshi takes it on herself to bring Magik back together 
date of release = the 29 of August 2008 
Director = Abhishek Kapoor 
average note = 7.1 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 29 of August 2008 

In the 2008 musical drama "Rock On!!", Sakshi Shroff plans a surprise for her husband Aditya on his birthday, only to end up surprising him in unexpected ways. The revelation of impending fatherhood brings joy to Aditya, but his happiness is overshadowed by the unexpected reunion with ghosts from his past - former bandmates Rob Nancy and Kedar Zaveri. As Sakshi takes it upon herself to reunite the estranged members of the once successful music group 'Magik', painful memories resurface, shedding light on the reasons behind the band's breakup and the unresolved tensions between Aditya and his former friend Joseph Mascarenhas. Directed by Abhishek Kapoor, "Rock On!!" delves into the complexities of relationships, music, and the power of reconciliation. With an average rating of 7.1, this film was released on August 29, 2008, captivating audiences with its emotional depth and musical journey.

['correct']
fact : Director = Abhishek Kapoor

fact : average note = 7.1 

In the 2008 musical drama "Rock On!!", Sakshi Shroff plans a surprise for her husband Aditya on his birthday, only to end up surprising him in unexpected ways. The revelation of impending fatherhood brings joy to Aditya, but his happiness is overshadowed by the unexpected reunion with ghosts from his past - former bandmates Rob Nancy and Kedar Zaveri. As Sakshi takes it upon herself to reunite the estranged members of the once successful music group 'Magik', painful memories resurface, shedding light on the reasons behind the band's breakup and the unresolved tensions between Aditya and his former friend Joseph Mascarenhas. Directed by Abhishek Kapoor, "Rock On!!" delves into the complexities of relationships, music, and the power of reconciliation. With an average rating of 7.1, this film was released on August 29, 2008, captivating audiences with its emotional depth and musical journey.

title = The Star Maker 
overview = The adventures and deceptions of a photographer who travels through the small villages of Sicily pretending that he is working for the big film studios in Rome. 
revenue = 207.7 millions of dollars 
Director = Giuseppe Tornatore 
tagline = In the golden age of cinema, everyone dreams of becoming a star. One man promises to make all their dreams come true... 
production countrie = Italy 
cast = Sergio Castellitto, Tiziana Lodato, Franco Scaldati, Leopoldo Trieste 
Producer = Vittorio Cecchi Gori 
production compagnie = Cecchi Gori Group Tiger Cinematografica 
original language of the movie = Italian 
budget = 299.6 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h53 
average note = 6.8 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 207.7 millions of dollars 

In the golden age of cinema, dreams of stardom run rampant, and in "The Star Maker," director Giuseppe Tornatore takes us on a captivating journey through the picturesque villages of Sicily. The film follows a cunning photographer who masquerades as a representative of prestigious Rome film studios, weaving a web of adventure and deceit as he offers locals a chance at fame. With a stellar cast including Sergio Castellitto, Tiziana Lodato, Franco Scaldati, and Leopoldo Trieste, the movie immerses viewers in a world where aspirations collide with reality. As the plot unfolds, viewers are treated to a glimpse of the glitz and glamour of the Italian film industry, all against the stunning backdrop of Sicily. With a budget of 299.6 million dollars and a staggering revenue of 207.7 million dollars, this production by Cecchi Gori Group Tiger Cinematografica is a testament to the allure of cinema. Will the photographer's promises of stardom come to fruition, or will his web of lies unravel? Find out in this 1 hour and 53-minute masterpiece, where dreams are made and shattered, and where the average note of 6.8 speaks to the film's undeniable charm. "The Star Maker" - where every dream has a price.

The Star Maker is a movie produced in Italy and the original language of the movie is Italian. The tagline of the movie is "In the golden age of cinema, everyone dreams of becoming a star. One man promises to make all their dreams come true..." The movie was produced by Vittorio Cecchi Gori.

title = Riot 
overview = A riot in a state prison is staged to cover up an escape attempt, during which many inmates and guards are killed. Shot on location at Arizona State Prison. 
Director = Buzz Kulik 
date of release = the 15 of January 1969 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = William Castle 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 
production countrie = United States of America 
cast = Gene Hackman, Jim Brown, Mike Kellin, Gerald S. O'Loughlin 
tagline = They exploded the ugliest riot in prison history to cover their dangerous, desperate break for freedom. 
revenue = 84.3 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h36 
average note = 6.0 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the fact mentioned in the description is indeed that the director is buzz kulik, which matches the description.']
fact : Director = Buzz Kulik 

In the action-packed movie "Riot," directed by Buzz Kulik and produced by William Castle, a state prison riot serves as a smokescreen for a daring escape attempt that results in a high body count of both inmates and guards. Shot on location at Arizona State Prison, the film features a star-studded cast including Gene Hackman, Jim Brown, Mike Kellin, and Gerald S. O'Loughlin. Set against the backdrop of the tumultuous events, the characters navigate through chaos and danger in their quest for freedom. With a tagline that promises explosive action, "Riot" delivers a thrilling narrative that keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. Released on January 15, 1969, by Paramount Pictures in the United States of America, this English-language film grossed an impressive $84.3 million at the box office. With a runtime of 1 hour and 36 minutes, "Riot" captivates audiences with its intense storyline and earns an average rating of 6.0.

title = One Day 
overview = A romantic comedy centered on Dexter and Emma, who first meet during their graduation in 1988 and proceed to keep in touch regularly. The film follows what they do on July 15 annually, usually doing something together. 
Producer = Nina Jacobson 
revenue = 59.4 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English

fact : Producer = Nina Jacobson 

In the heartwarming romantic comedy "One Day," produced by Nina Jacobson, viewers are taken on a journey through the lives of Dexter and Emma. The story begins in 1988 when they first meet during their graduation and continue to stay in touch regularly. Each year on July 15th, the audience is invited to witness their annual tradition of doing something special together. With a revenue of 59.4 million dollars, this English-language film beautifully captures the essence of friendship, love, and the passage of time.

title = The Mighty Ducks 
overview = After reckless young lawyer Gordon Bombay gets arrested for drunk driving, he must coach a kids hockey team for his community service. Gordon has experience on the ice, but isn't eager to return to hockey, a point hit home by his tense dealings with his own former coach, Jack Reilly. The reluctant Gordon eventually grows to appreciate his team, which includes promising young Charlie Conway, and leads them to take on Reilly's tough players. 
cast = Emilio Estevez, Joss Ackland, Lane Smith, Heidi Kling 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Emilio Estevez, Joss Ackland, Lane Smith, Heidi Kling 

In "The Mighty Ducks," reckless young lawyer Gordon Bombay finds himself coaching a kids' hockey team as part of his community service after a drunk driving arrest. Despite his initial reluctance to return to hockey, Gordon's experience on the ice comes in handy as he guides his team, including talented player Charlie Conway, to face off against the tough players coached by his former mentor, Jack Reilly. Starring Emilio Estevez, Joss Ackland, Lane Smith, and Heidi Kling, this heartwarming sports film showcases the transformative power of teamwork and second chances.

title = Dead Birds 
overview = A group of Confederate soldiers who hole up in an abandoned plantation after robbing a bank, and find themselves at the mercy of supernatural forces. 
production countrie = United States of America 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Ash R. Shah 
date of release = the 1 of January 2004

duration of the movie = 1h31 
tagline = There are worse things than dying. 
revenue = 202.5 millions of dollars 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : production countrie = United States of America 

In the eerie and suspenseful movie "Dead Birds," directed by Alex Turner, a group of Confederate soldiers seek refuge in an abandoned plantation after a bank robbery, only to discover they are not alone. As they grapple with supernatural forces beyond their control, they realize that there are worse things than dying, as the tagline suggests. Produced by Ash R. Shah and released on the 1st of January 2004 in the United States of America, this English-language film runs for 1 hour and 31 minutes, captivating audiences and generating a revenue of 202.5 million dollars.

Shah and released on the 1st of January 2004 in the United States of America, this English-language film runs for 1 hour and 31 minutes, captivating audiences and generating a revenue of 202.5 million dollars.

title = The Wraith 
overview = Packard Walsh and his motorized gang control and terrorize an Arizona desert town where they force drivers to drag-race so they can 'win' their vehicles. After Walsh beats the decent teenager Jamie Hankins to death after finding him with his girlfriend, a mysterious power creates Jake Kesey, an extremely cool motor-biker who has a car which is invincible. Jake befriends Jamie's girlfriend Keri Johnson, takes Jamie's sweet brother Bill under his wing and manages what Sheriff Loomis couldn't; eliminate Packard's criminal gang the hard way... 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 3.5 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h33 
budget = 2.7 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the action-packed movie "The Wraith," set in an Arizona desert town, Packard Walsh and his gang rule the streets by forcing drivers into deadly drag races to win their vehicles. When Walsh tragically takes the life of teenager Jamie Hankins, a mysterious force transforms Jake Kesey into a formidable motor-biker with an indestructible car. With a cool demeanor, Jake forms an alliance with Jamie's girlfriend Keri Johnson and mentors his brother Bill. Together, they take on Packard's criminal gang, delivering justice in a way Sheriff Loomis couldn't. With a runtime of 1 hour and 33 minutes, this English-language film grossed $3.5 million at the box office, surpassing its $2.7 million budget.

title = Winchester '73 
overview = Lin McAdam rides into town on the trail of Dutch Henry Brown, only to find himself in a shooting competition against him. McAdam wins the prize, a one-in-a-thousand Winchester rifle, but Dutch steals it and leaves town. McAdam follows, intent on settling his old quarrel, while the rifle keeps changing hands and touching a number of lives. 
average note = 7.5 
Producer = Aaron Rosenberg 
tagline = The Gun That Won The West! 
date of release = the 12 of July 1950 
cast = James Stewart, Shelley Winters, Dan Duryea, Stephen McNally 
duration of the movie = 1h32 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 7.5 

In the classic Western film "Winchester '73," Lin McAdam arrives in town tracking down Dutch Henry Brown, leading to a high-stakes shooting competition between the two. After winning a rare Winchester rifle as the prize, McAdam's pursuit of Dutch intensifies as the rifle changes hands, impacting various lives along the way. With a stellar cast including James Stewart, Shelley Winters, Dan Duryea, and Stephen McNally, this tale of vengeance and the iconic rifle that shaped the West unfolds against the backdrop of the rugged frontier. Produced by Aaron Rosenberg and released on the 12th of July 1950, "Winchester '73" weaves a gripping narrative of rivalry and retribution, earning an average rating of 7.5. Don't miss out on experiencing the power of "The Gun That Won The West!"

title = The Coming of Sin 
overview = A superstitious, illiterate young gypsy servant girl comes to live with a solitary female artist at her country chateau. The girl has recurring nightmares of a naked man on horseback assaulting and abusing her. As the artist takes the girl under her wing, an sensuous relationship develops between them. 
average note = 4.0 
Producer = José Frade 
production compagnie = José Frade Producciones Cinematográficas S.A. 
tagline = She asked for it… 
production countrie = Spain 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 4.0 

In the sultry Spanish countryside, "The Coming of Sin" unfolds a mesmerizing tale of superstition, sensuality, and secrets. When a young gypsy servant girl with haunting nightmares arrives at a reclusive artist's chateau, their bond deepens into a passionate and forbidden relationship. Produced by the renowned José Frade and José Frade Producciones Cinematográficas S.A., and set against the backdrop of Spain, this provocative film delves into the complexities of desire and destiny. With an average note of 4.0, this cinematic masterpiece will captivate audiences with its alluring tagline: "She asked for it..."

title = Topper Takes a Trip 
overview = Mrs Topper's friend Mrs Parkhurst has convinced Mrs topper, to file for a divorce from Cosmo, due to the strange circumstances of his trip with ghost Marion Kirby. Marion comes back from heaven's door to help Cosmo again, this time only with dog Mr. Atlas. Due to a strange behavior of Cosmo, the judge refuses to divorce them, so Mrs Parkhurst takes Mrs Topper on a trip to France, where she tries to arrange the final reasons for the divorce, with help of a gold-digging French baron, Marion takes Cosmo to the same hotel, to bring them back together and to get her own final ticket to heaven, but the whole thing turns out to be not too easy. 
budget = 181.9 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Milton H. Bren 
duration of the movie = 1h20 
cast = Constance Bennett, Roland Young, Billie Burke, Alan Mowbray 
date of release = the 29 of December 1938 
revenue = 164.1 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 181.9 millions of dollars 

In the classic film "Topper Takes a Trip," Mrs. Topper finds herself in a dilemma when her friend Mrs. Parkhurst convinces her to file for divorce from her husband Cosmo, who recently had a strange trip with the ghost Marion Kirby. Determined to help Cosmo with the assistance of their dog Mr. Atlas, Marion returns from heaven to intervene. Despite their efforts, the judge refuses to grant the divorce, leading Mrs. Parkhurst to take Mrs. Topper on a trip to France to finalize the separation. As they navigate the complexities of their relationships, including encounters with a gold-digging French baron, Marion orchestrates a plan to reunite Cosmo and Mrs. Topper. However, their reunion proves to be more challenging than expected. Starring Constance Bennett, Roland Young, Billie Burke, and Alan Mowbray, this English-language film produced by Milton H. Bren captivates audiences with its comedic yet heartfelt storyline. Released on December 29, 1938, "Topper Takes a Trip" garnered a revenue of 164.1 million dollars against a budget of 181.9 million dollars in its 1 hour and 20-minute runtime.

With a stellar cast including Jennifer Connelly and Peter Riegert, this gripping drama delves into the complexities of personal and political struggles, ultimately revealing the fragility of the American dream.

title = Route Irish 
overview = A private security contractor in Iraq rejects the official explanation of his friend's death and decides to investigate. 
cast = Mark Womack, John Bishop, Andrea Lowe, Trevor Williams 
Producer = Rebecca O'Brien 
production compagnie = Why Not Productions 
revenue = 127.9 millions of dollars 
Director = Ken Loach 
average note = 6.5 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 16 of March 2011 
production countrie = United Kingdom 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Mark Womack, John Bishop, Andrea Lowe, Trevor Williams 

In "Route Irish," directed by Ken Loach and released on the 16th of March 2011, a private security contractor in Iraq, portrayed by Mark Womack, embarks on a gripping investigation into the death of his friend, challenging the official explanation. With a stellar cast including John Bishop, Andrea Lowe, and Trevor Williams, the film delves into the complexities of loyalty, betrayal, and justice. Produced by Rebecca O'Brien and backed by Why Not Productions, this intense thriller in its original English language grossed a staggering $127.9 million worldwide. With an average rating of 6.5, this United Kingdom production is a must-watch for fans of suspenseful and thought-provoking cinema.
