title = Mademoiselle Fifi 
overview = In occupied France during the Franco-Prussian War, a young French laundress shares a coach ride with several of her condescending social superiors. But when a Prussian officer holds the coach over, social standings are leveled and integrity and spirit are put to the test 
Producer = Val Lewton 
tagline = She faced a question as old as Eve! 
duration of the movie = 1h09 
date of release = the 1 of January 1944 
production compagnie = RKO Radio Pictures 
average note = 4.7 
Director = Robert Wise 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 199.0 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 40.1 millions of dollars 
cast = Simone Simon, John Emery, Kurt Kreuger, Alan Napier 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : Producer = Val Lewton 

In "Mademoiselle Fifi," a gripping tale set in occupied France during the Franco-Prussian War, a young French laundress finds herself in a coach with her snobbish social superiors. When a Prussian officer disrupts their journey, social hierarchies crumble, and the characters are tested on their integrity and resilience. Directed by Robert Wise and produced by Val Lewton, this RKO Radio Pictures production showcases a stellar cast including Simone Simon, John Emery, Kurt Kreuger, and Alan Napier. Released on January 1, 1944, in the United States, this English-language film runs for 1 hour and 9 minutes. With a budget of $40.1 million, "Mademoiselle Fifi" grossed an impressive $199.0 million at the box office, earning an average rating of 4.7. The tagline "She faced a question as old as Eve!" encapsulates the moral dilemmas and challenges the characters confront in this thought-provoking and impactful movie.

title = Patient Seven 
overview = The film centers on Dr. Marcus, a renowned psychiatrist who has selected 6 severe mentally ill and dangerous patients from the Spring Valley Mental Hospital to interview as part of research for his new book. As Dr. Marcus interviews each patient, one by one the horrors they have committed begin to unfold. However, Dr. Marcus soon learns that there is one patient who ties them all together - Patient Seven. 
Producer = Ben Franklin 
Director = Danny Draven 
tagline = Try to remain calm. 
duration of the movie = 1h55 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct.']
fact : Producer = Ben Franklin 

In "Patient Seven," directed by Danny Draven and produced by Ben Franklin, viewers are taken on a chilling journey into the depths of the human psyche. Dr. Marcus, a respected psychiatrist, delves into the minds of six severely mentally ill and dangerous patients at the Spring Valley Mental Hospital. As he conducts interviews for his new book, the disturbing and horrifying tales of their past unfold one by one. However, it is the revelation of Patient Seven that ties them all together, revealing a sinister connection that will leave audiences on the edge of their seats. With a runtime of 1 hour and 55 minutes, this psychological thriller will have viewers questioning their own sanity as they navigate through the twisted minds of the patients. Remember to "Try to remain calm" as you uncover the dark secrets that lie within "Patient Seven."

Facts included:
- Producer: Ben Franklin
- Director: Danny Draven
- Tagline: Try to remain calm.
- Duration of the movie: 1h55

In "Patient Seven," directed by Danny Draven and produced by Ben Franklin, viewers are taken on a chilling journey into the depths of the human psyche. Dr. Marcus, a respected psychiatrist, delves into the minds of six severely mentally ill and dangerous patients at the Spring Valley Mental Hospital. As he conducts interviews for his new book, the disturbing and horrifying tales of their past unfold one by one. However, it is the revelation of Patient Seven that ties them all together, revealing a sinister connection that will leave audiences on the edge of their seats. With a runtime of 1 hour and 55 minutes, this psychological thriller will have viewers questioning their own sanity as they navigate through the twisted minds of the patients. Remember to "Try to remain calm" as you uncover the dark secrets that lie within "Patient Seven."

title = Mine Games 
overview = A group of young friends make an incomprehensible discovery in an abandoned mine, but the more they try to change the future, the more they seal their fate. 
tagline = The Deeper You Go, The Darker It Gets 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = The Deeper You Go, The Darker It Gets 

In the thrilling movie "Mine Games," a group of young friends stumbles upon an incomprehensible discovery deep within an abandoned mine. As they attempt to alter their future, they unknowingly seal their fate. With each twist and turn, the friends find themselves entangled in a web of mystery and danger. The tagline "The Deeper You Go, The Darker It Gets" perfectly encapsulates the ominous and suspenseful journey that unfolds as they delve further into the mine. Will they be able to escape the sinister forces at play, or are they destined to succumb to the darkness that lurks within?

title = The Protector 
overview = In Bangkok, the young Kham was raised by his father in the jungle with elephants as members of their family. When his old elephant and the baby Kern are stolen by criminals, Kham finds that the animals were sent to Sidney. He travels to Australia, where he locates the baby elephant in a restaurant owned by the evil Madame Rose, the leader of an international Thai mafia. With the support of the efficient Thai sergeant Mark, who was involved in a conspiracy, Kham fights to rescue the animal from the mobsters. 
production compagnie = The Weinstein Company 
duration of the movie = 1h48 
tagline = Vengeance Knows No Mercy 
revenue = 27.2 millions of dollars 
budget = 6.0 millions of dollars 
Director = Prachya Pinkaew 
cast = Tony Jaa, Petchtai Wongkamlao, Bongkoj Khongmalai, Xing Jing 
date of release = the 11 of August 2005 
average note = 6.8 
Producer = Prachya Pinkaew 
original language of the movie = Thai 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : production compagnie = The Weinstein Company 

In "The Protector," directed by Prachya Pinkaew and released on the 11th of August 2005, viewers are taken on a thrilling journey from Bangkok to Sydney. The protagonist, Kham, portrayed by Tony Jaa, embarks on a mission to rescue his beloved baby elephant, Kern, from the clutches of the international Thai mafia led by the sinister Madame Rose. With the help of the skilled Thai sergeant Mark, played by Petchtai Wongkamlao, Kham engages in a high-stakes battle against the mobsters to save his animal companion. As vengeance knows no mercy, Kham's determination and martial arts prowess are put to the ultimate test in this action-packed film. Produced by Prachya Pinkaew and The Weinstein Company, with a runtime of 1 hour and 48 minutes, "The Protector" showcases the bond between man and elephant amidst a backdrop of danger and intrigue. The movie, in its original Thai language, received an average rating of 6.8 and grossed $27.2 million, surpassing its $6.0 million budget. The main cast also includes Bongkoj Khongmalai and Xing Jing. The tagline for the movie is "Vengeance Knows No Mercy."

title = Your Highness 
overview = A fantasy movie about an arrogant, lazy prince and his more heroic brother who must complete a quest in order to save their father's kingdom. 
date of release = the 8 of April 2011 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
revenue = 26.1 millions of dollars 
tagline = Get your quest on. 
Director = David Gordon Green 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Danny McBride, James Franco, Natalie Portman, Zooey Deschanel 
average note = 5.2 
budget = 49.9 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 8 of April 2011 

In a kingdom where fantasy meets comedy, "Your Highness" follows the journey of an arrogant and lazy prince, played by Danny McBride, and his more heroic brother, portrayed by James Franco. Together, they embark on a quest to save their father's kingdom, facing challenges and hilarity along the way. Directed by David Gordon Green and released on April 8, 2011, in the United States by Universal Pictures, this English-language film features a star-studded cast including Natalie Portman and Zooey Deschanel. With a budget of $49.9 million, the movie grossed $26.1 million at the box office, receiving an average rating of 5.2. As the tagline suggests, "Get your quest on" and join this adventurous and comedic tale of two very different royal brothers.

With a budget of $49.9 million, the movie grossed $26.1 million at the box office, receiving an average rating of 5.2. As the tagline suggests, "Get your quest on" and join this adventurous and comedic tale of two very different royal brothers.

title = Confessions of a Shopaholic 
overview = In the glamorous world of New York City, Rebecca Bloomwood is a fun-loving girl who is really good at shopping-a little too good, perhaps. She dreams of working for her favorite fashion magazine, but can't quite get her foot in the door-until ironically, she snags a job as an advice columnist for a financial magazine published by the same company. 
Producer = Jerry Bruckheimer 
revenue = 108.3 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 5 of February 2009 
duration of the movie = 1h44 
production countrie = United States of America 
budget = 40.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Jerry Bruckheimer Films 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = P.J. Hogan 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Jerry Bruckheimer 

In the dazzling setting of New York City, "Confessions of a Shopaholic" follows the story of Rebecca Bloomwood, a charming and shopaholic girl with a knack for all things fashion. Despite her shopping addiction, Rebecca aspires to work for a prestigious fashion magazine. Struggling to break into the industry, she unexpectedly lands a job as an advice columnist at a financial magazine owned by the same company. Directed by P.J. Hogan and produced by Jerry Bruckheimer, this comedy film was released on February 5, 2009. With a runtime of 1 hour and 44 minutes, the movie generated a revenue of $108.3 million, surpassing its $40 million budget. Set in the United States, "Confessions of a Shopaholic" is a delightful tale presented in English, capturing the essence of Rebecca's journey to balance her love for shopping with her career aspirations. The production company behind the film is Jerry Bruckheimer Films, and the original language of the movie is English.

title = Burying the Ex 
overview = It seemed like a great idea when all-around nice guy Max and his beautiful girlfriend, Evelyn moved in together. But when Evelyn turns out to be a controlling, manipulative nightmare, Max knows it’s time to call it quits. There’s just one problem: he’s terrified of breaking up with her. Fate steps in when Evelyn is the victim of a fatal, freak accident, leaving Max single and ready to mingle. Just as Max is thinking about moving on with what could be his dream girl, Olivia – Evelyn has returned from the grave and is determined to get her boyfriend back...even if that means transforming him into one of the undead. 
tagline = Some relationships just won't die. 
date of release = the 4 of September 2014 
Director = Joe Dante 
Producer = Alan Trezza 
revenue = 108.2 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h29 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = Some relationships just won't die. 

In the dark comedy "Burying the Ex," directed by Joe Dante and produced by Alan Trezza, we follow the story of Max, a nice guy who finds himself trapped in a toxic relationship with his controlling girlfriend, Evelyn. When fate intervenes and Evelyn meets an untimely demise, Max sees it as an opportunity to start fresh. However, his plans are thwarted when Evelyn rises from the grave, determined to win him back at any cost. As Max navigates the chaos of his resurrected ex-girlfriend's antics, he also finds himself drawn to Olivia, a potential new love interest. With a tagline that states "Some relationships just won't die," this film explores the horrors of love gone wrong in a hilarious and thrilling manner. Released on September 4, 2014, the movie runs for 1 hour and 29 minutes in its original English language, grossing an impressive $108.2 million in revenue.

fact : budget = 120.3 millions of dollars 

In the dark comedy "Burying the Ex," directed by Joe Dante and produced by Alan Trezza, we follow the story of Max, a nice guy who finds himself trapped in a toxic relationship with his controlling girlfriend, Evelyn. When fate intervenes and Evelyn meets an untimely demise, Max sees it as an opportunity to start fresh. However, his plans are thwarted when Evelyn rises from the grave, determined to win him back at any cost. As Max navigates the chaos of his resurrected ex-girlfriend's antics, he also finds himself drawn to Olivia, a potential new love interest. With a tagline that states "Some relationships just won't die," this film explores the horrors of love gone wrong in a hilarious and thrilling manner. Released on September 4, 2014, the movie runs for 1 hour and 29 minutes in its original English language, grossing an impressive $108.2 million in revenue.

When Stuart, his human brother George, and their mischievous cat Snowbell embark on a mission to rescue a friend, they find themselves in a whirlwind of crazy mouse adventures. Directed by Rob Minkoff and produced by Douglas Wick under Columbia Pictures, this heartwarming tale unfolds in English, captivating audiences with a charming cast including Michael J. Fox, Geena Davis, Hugh Laurie, and Jonathan Lipnicki. With a revenue of 170.0 million dollars and an average rating of 5.4, "Stuart Little 2" is a delightful family film that showcases the power of friendship and courage in the bustling city of New York. title = Funny Face 
overview = A shy Greenwich Village book clerk is discovered by a fashion photographer and whisked off to Paris where she becomes a reluctant model. 
Producer = Roger Edens 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Roger Edens 

In "Funny Face," produced by Roger Edens, a timid book clerk from Greenwich Village named Jo Stockton is discovered by a fashion photographer and whisked off to Paris where she becomes a reluctant model. Jo's journey from a shy and reserved individual to a confident and captivating presence in the fashion industry is a central theme of the film. As she navigates the glamorous yet challenging world of modeling, Jo not only finds success on the runway but also discovers her own inner beauty and strength. Through her unique charm and grace, Jo captivates audiences and leaves a lasting impact on the fashion world.

title = Reefer Madness 
overview = High-school principal Dr. Alfred Carroll (Josef Forte) relates to an audience of parents that marijuana can have devastating effects on teens. In his story, a drug supplier entices several restless teens, including sister and brother Mary (Dorothy Short) and Jimmy Lane (Warren McCollum) and Mary's boyfriend, Bill (Kenneth Craig), into frequenting a "reefer" house. Gradually, Bill and Jimmy are drawn into smoking dope, which affects their family lives and leads to a terrible crime. 
original language of the movie = English 
Director = Louis J. Gasnier 
Producer = George A. Hirliman 
budget = 0.1 millions of dollars 
revenue = 103.8 millions of dollars 
average note = 4.1 
date of release = the 15 of January 1936 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = Women cry for it - Men die for it! 
cast = Dorothy Short, Kenneth Craig, Lillian Miles, Dave O'Brien 
duration of the movie = 1h06 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the 1936 American film "Reefer Madness," directed by Louis J. Gasnier and produced by George A. Hirliman, high-school principal Dr. Alfred Carroll warns parents about the dangers of marijuana on teenagers. The story follows siblings Mary and Jimmy Lane, along with Mary's boyfriend Bill, as they are lured into a world of "reefer" by a drug supplier. As Bill and Jimmy start smoking dope, their lives spiral out of control, leading to a tragic crime. Starring Dorothy Short, Kenneth Craig, Lillian Miles, and Dave O'Brien, this cautionary tale highlights the devastating effects of drug use on young people. With a budget of 0.1 million dollars, "Reefer Madness" went on to gross 103.8 million dollars at the box office, despite receiving an average rating of 4.1. The film, with a runtime of 1 hour and 6 minutes, was released on January 15, 1936, in the United States of America. Remember, as the tagline says, "Women cry for it - Men die for it!"

['correct']
fact : Director = Louis J. Gasnier

Hirliman, high-school principal Dr. Alfred Carroll warns parents about the dangers of marijuana on teenagers. The story follows siblings Mary and Jimmy Lane, along with Mary's boyfriend Bill, as they are lured into a world of "reefer" by a drug supplier. title = Nina Forever 
overview = Holly loves Rob and tries to help him through his grief – even if it means contending with his dead girlfriend Nina, who comes back, bloody and broken, every time they make love 
production compagnie = Charlie Productions 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Cassandra Sigsgaard 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Charlie Productions 

In the haunting film "Nina Forever" produced by Cassandra Sigsgaard under Charlie Productions, we are drawn into a twisted love story. Holly is deeply in love with Rob and is determined to support him through his grief, even if it means facing a chilling obstacle - Rob's deceased girlfriend, Nina. Every time Holly and Rob come together intimately, Nina returns in a gruesome and broken state, testing the limits of their relationship. Set against the backdrop of English dialogue, this dark and unconventional tale explores the complexities of love, loss, and the supernatural, leaving viewers on the edge of their seats. The original language of the movie is English.

title = Johnny Mnemonic 
overview = A data courier, literally carrying a data package inside his head, must deliver it before he dies from the burden or is killed by the Yakuza.  In a dystopian 2021, Johnny (Keanu Reeves) is a data trafficker who has an implant that allows him to securely store data too sensitive for regular computer networks. On one delivery run, he accepts a package that not only exceeds the implant's safety limits - and will kill him if the data is not removed in time - but also contains information far more important and valuable than he had ever imagined. On a race against time, he must avoid the assassins sent to kill him and remove the data before it, too, ends his life. 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 26 of May 1995 
Director = Robert Longo 
production countrie = Canada 
tagline = The hottest data on earth. In the coolest head in town. 
Producer = Don Carmody 
duration of the movie = 1h37 
average note = 5.5 
revenue = 19.1 millions of dollars 
budget = 25.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the dystopian world of 2021, "Johnny Mnemonic" follows the story of Johnny, a data courier played by Keanu Reeves, who carries sensitive information in his head. With an implant that securely stores data, Johnny finds himself in a race against time when he accepts a package that exceeds his implant's safety limits. As he must deliver the data before it kills him, Johnny discovers that the information is more valuable than he ever imagined. Directed by Robert Longo and produced by Don Carmody, this sci-fi thriller takes viewers on a thrilling journey as Johnny navigates through assassins sent by the Yakuza to retrieve the data. Will Johnny be able to remove the data in time to save his life? Find out in this action-packed film that promises to keep you on the edge of your seat. "Johnny Mnemonic" was released on May 26, 1995, in Canada, and despite its average note of 5.5, it managed to generate a revenue of 19.1 million dollars with a budget of 25 million dollars. Remember, in a world where information is power, Johnny holds the key to the hottest data on earth in the coolest head in town. The original language of the movie is English, and the tagline is "The hottest data on earth. In the coolest head in town."

In the dystopian world of 2021, "Johnny Mnemonic" follows the story of Johnny, a data courier played by Keanu Reeves, who carries sensitive information in his head. With an implant that securely stores data, Johnny finds himself in a race against time when he accepts a package that exceeds his implant's safety limits. As he must deliver the data before it kills him, Johnny discovers that the information is more valuable than he ever imagined. Directed by Robert Longo and produced by Don Carmody, this sci-fi thriller takes viewers on a thrilling journey as Johnny navigates through assassins sent by the Yakuza to retrieve the data. Will Johnny be able to remove the data in time to save his life? Find out in this action-packed film that promises to keep you on the edge of your seat. "Johnny Mnemonic" was released on May 26, 1995, in Canada, and despite its average note of 5.5, it managed to generate a revenue of 19.1 million dollars with a budget of 25 million dollars. Remember, in a world where information is power, Johnny holds the key to the hottest data on earth in the coolest head in town. The original language of the movie is English, and the tagline is "The hottest data on earth. In the coolest head in town."

In the English-language sci-fi thriller "Forbidden World," produced by Roger Corman and released by New World Pictures, a federation marshal is sent to a research lab on a remote planet in the distant future. Here, a genetic experiment has escaped and is preying on the scientists. As the dwindling scientific group struggles to survive, they must confront the terrifying consequences of playing with nature's boundaries. With a runtime of 1 hour and 17 minutes, this intense and suspenseful film takes viewers on a thrilling journey into the dangers of unchecked scientific experimentation in the United States of America.

title = Unfriended 
overview = While video chatting one night, six high school friends receive a Skype message from a classmate who killed herself exactly one year ago. A first they think it's a prank, but when the girl starts revealing the friends' darkest secrets, they realize they are dealing with something out of this world, something that wants them dead. Told entirely from a young girl's computer desktop, Unfriended redefines 'found footage' for a new generation of teens. 
production compagnie = Bazelevs Production 
date of release = the 17 of April 2015 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production compagnie = Bazelevs Production 

In the chilling horror film "Unfriended," a group of six high school friends find themselves haunted by a sinister presence during a fateful video chat. When a deceased classmate reaches out to them from beyond the grave, the friends initially dismiss it as a cruel prank. However, as the ghostly figure begins to expose their deepest secrets, they realize they are facing a malevolent force determined to harm them. Set against the backdrop of a computer desktop screen, this innovative take on the found footage genre keeps viewers on the edge of their seats. Produced by Bazelevs Production and released in the United States on April 17, 2015, "Unfriended" offers a terrifying glimpse into the dangers of the digital world. The movie was directed by Levan Gabriadze.

title = Extract 
overview = The owner of a factory that produces flavor extracts, Joel Reynold seems to have it all, but really doesn't. What's missing is sexual attention from his wife, Suzie. Joel hatches a convoluted plan to get Suzie to cheat on him, thereby clearing the way for Joel to have an affair with Cindy, an employee. But what Joel doesn't know is that Cindy is a sociopathic con artist, and a freak workplace accident clears the way for her to ruin Joel forever. 
Director = Mike Judge 
duration of the movie = 1h32 
date of release = the 3 of September 2009 
production compagnie = Miramax Films 
revenue = 10.8 millions of dollars 
production countrie = United States of America 
average note = 5.7 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = Sticking it to the man has never looked so good. 
cast = Jason Bateman, Mila Kunis, Kristen Wiig, Ben Affleck 
Producer = Michael Rotenberg 
budget = 8.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Mike Judge 

In the comedic movie "Extract," directed by Mike Judge and produced by Michael Rotenberg, we follow the story of Joel Reynold, the owner of a flavor extracts factory who seems to have it all, except for the attention he craves from his wife, Suzie. Feeling neglected, Joel devises a complicated plan to manipulate his wife into cheating on him so he can pursue an affair with Cindy, one of his employees. However, Joel's scheme takes an unexpected turn when he discovers that Cindy is not who she seems to be - she is a sociopathic con artist. As the plot thickens, a workplace accident orchestrated by Cindy sets off a chain of events that threatens to destroy Joel's life forever. With a star-studded cast including Jason Bateman, Mila Kunis, Kristen Wiig, and Ben Affleck, "Extract" delivers a mix of dark humor and unexpected twists. Released on September 3, 2009, by Miramax Films, this American production received an average rating of 5.7. The movie runs for 1 hour and 32 minutes in English, and its tagline "Sticking it to the man has never looked so good" sets the tone for the chaotic and entertaining ride. The film had a budget of 8.0 million dollars and grossed 10.8 million dollars at the box office. It was filmed in the United States of America.

['correct']

In the comedic movie "Extract," directed by Mike Judge and produced by Michael Rotenberg, we follow the story of Joel Reynold, the owner of a flavor extracts factory who seems to have it all, except for the attention he craves from his wife, Suzie. Feeling neglected, Joel devises a complicated plan to manipulate his wife into cheating on him so he can pursue an affair with Cindy, one of his employees. However, Joel's scheme takes an unexpected turn when he discovers that Cindy is not who she seems to be - she is a sociopathic con artist. As the plot thickens, a workplace accident orchestrated by Cindy sets off a chain of events that threatens to destroy Joel's life forever. With a star-studded cast including Jason Bateman, Mila Kunis, Kristen Wiig, and Ben Affleck, "Extract" delivers a mix of dark humor and unexpected twists. Released on September 3, 2009, by Miramax Films, this American production received an average rating of 5.7. The movie runs for 1 hour and 32 minutes in English, and its tagline "Sticking it to the man has never looked so good" sets the tone for the chaotic and entertaining ride. The film had a budget of 8.0 million dollars and grossed 10.8 million dollars at the box office. It was filmed in the United States of America.

In the comedic movie "Extract," directed by Mike Judge and produced by Michael Rotenberg, we follow the story of Joel Reynold, the owner of a flavor extracts factory who seems to have it all, except for the attention he craves from his wife, Suzie. Feeling neglected, Joel devises a complicated plan to manipulate his wife into cheating on him so he can pursue an affair with Cindy, one of his employees. However, Joel's scheme takes an unexpected turn when he discovers that Cindy is not who she seems to be - she is a sociopathic con artist. As the plot thickens, a workplace accident orchestrated by Cindy sets off a chain of events that threatens to destroy Joel's life forever. With a star-studded cast including Jason Bateman, Mila Kunis, Kristen Wiig, and Ben Affleck, "Extract" delivers a mix of dark humor and unexpected twists. Released on September 3, 2009, by Miramax Films, this American production received an average rating of 5.7. The movie runs for 1 hour and 32 minutes in English, and its tagline "Sticking it to the man has never looked so good" sets the tone for the chaotic and entertaining ride. title = RocketMan 
overview = Fred Z. Randall is geeky and obnoxious spacecraft designer, who gets the chance to make his dream come true and travel to Mars as a member of the first manned flight there. 
revenue = 289.5 millions of dollars 
cast = Harland Williams, Jessica Lundy, William Sadler, Beau Bridges 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Stuart Gillard 
original language of the movie = English 
Producer = Roger Birnbaum 
duration of the movie = 1h35 
date of release = the 10 of October 1997 
budget = 16.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 289.5 millions of dollars 

In the out-of-this-world comedy "RocketMan," directed by Stuart Gillard, we follow the geeky and obnoxious spacecraft designer, Fred Z. Randall, portrayed by Harland Williams. Fred seizes the opportunity of a lifetime to fulfill his dream of traveling to Mars as part of the first manned flight to the red planet. Alongside a stellar cast including Jessica Lundy, William Sadler, and Beau Bridges, Fred embarks on a hilarious and thrilling journey. With a budget of 16.0 million dollars, the film soared to success, grossing an impressive 289.5 million dollars at the box office. Set in the United States of America and spoken in English, "RocketMan" was released on the 10th of October 1997, delighting audiences with its 1 hour and 35-minute runtime. Produced by Roger Birnbaum, this space adventure is a must-watch for those looking for a cosmic blend of comedy and adventure.

title = The Undercover Man 
overview = Frank Warren is a treasury agent assigned to put an end to the activities of a powerful mob crime boss. The "undercover" agent poses as a criminal to seek out information but is frustrated when all he finds are terrified witnesses and corrupt police officers. Although most informants end up dead, Agent Warren gets critical information about the mob from an unlikely source. 
Director = Joseph H. Lewis 
tagline = TOLD WITH THE SNARL OF A MACHINE GUN! 
revenue = 196.2 millions of dollars 
Producer = Robert Rossen 
production countrie = United States of America 
duration of the movie = 1h25 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures Corporation 
budget = 186.9 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 21 of March 1949 
cast = Glenn Ford, Nina Foch, James Whitmore, Barry Kelley 
average note = 6.0 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : Director = Joseph H. Lewis 

In "The Undercover Man," directed by Joseph H. Lewis and produced by Robert Rossen, treasury agent Frank Warren is on a mission to take down a powerful mob crime boss. Posing as a criminal, Warren faces obstacles in the form of terrified witnesses and corrupt police officers. Despite the risks, Warren manages to gather crucial information about the mob from an unexpected source. Starring Glenn Ford, Nina Foch, James Whitmore, and Barry Kelley, this gripping crime drama, released on the 21st of March 1949 by Columbia Pictures Corporation, unfolds with the snarl of a machine gun. With a revenue of 196.2 million dollars against a budget of 186.9 million dollars, this 1 hour and 25-minute film in English received an average rating of 6.0.

The movie's tagline is "TOLD WITH THE SNARL OF A MACHINE GUN!".
The production country is the United States of America.

title = The Blob 
overview = Remake of the 1958 horror sci-fi about a deadly blob which is the spawn of a secret government germ warfare project which consumes everyone in its path. Teenagers try in vain to warn the townsfolk, who refuse to take them seriously, while government agents try to cover up the evidence and confine the creature. 
cast = Kevin Dillon, Shawnee Smith, Donovan Leitch, Jeffrey DeMunn 
revenue = 8.2 millions of dollars 
Producer = Elliott Kastner 
budget = 19.0 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = TriStar Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Kevin Dillon, Shawnee Smith, Donovan Leitch, Jeffrey DeMunn 

In the thrilling remake of the 1958 horror sci-fi classic, "The Blob" tells the story of a deadly blob created from a secret government germ warfare project that devours everything in its path. As teenagers desperately try to warn the townspeople about the impending danger, they are met with disbelief and skepticism. Meanwhile, government agents work tirelessly to conceal the evidence and contain the monstrous creature. Starring Kevin Dillon, Shawnee Smith, Donovan Leitch, and Jeffrey DeMunn, this suspenseful tale unfolds with twists and turns that will keep you on the edge of your seat. Produced by Elliott Kastner and brought to life by TriStar Pictures, "The Blob" grossed an impressive $8.2 million at the box office, showcasing its popularity among horror fans. The film had a budget of $19.0 million, making it a significant investment for the production company.

title = I Spit on Your Grave 
overview = A remake of the 1979 controversial cult classic, I Spit on Your Grave retells the horrific tale of writer Jennifer Hills who takes a retreat from the city to a charming cabin in the woods to start on her next book. But Jennifer's presence in the small town attracts the attention of a few morally deprived locals led by Johnny, the town's service station owner, his two co-workers, Andy and Stanley, who along with their socially and mentally challenged friend Matthew, set out one night to teach this city girl a lesson. 
duration of the movie = 1h48 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h48 

In the intense and chilling remake of the 1979 cult classic, "I Spit on Your Grave," viewers are taken on a harrowing journey with writer Jennifer Hills. Seeking solace in a secluded cabin in the woods to work on her latest book, Jennifer becomes the target of a group of morally corrupt locals. Led by the menacing Johnny, along with his accomplices Andy and Stanley, and their troubled friend Matthew, they set out to terrorize Jennifer one fateful night. As the events unfold over the course of 1 hour and 48 minutes, audiences are gripped by the escalating horrors that Jennifer must endure in this brutal tale of revenge and survival.

title = Exterminators of the Year 3000 
overview = It's the year 3000 and a nuclear war has turned the earth into a desert wasteland. A group of survivors living in a cave run out of water and desperately need to locate a new supply. The last guy they sent out to find water never returned, and now his 10 year old son Timmy wants to join the next search team. They think they know where there's an untapped well of water, but to get there they have to travel through dangerous terrain controlled by a savage gang of motorcyclists under the bloodthirsty reign of 'Crazy Bull'. On their mission, Timmy and his team run into a lonesome stranger named Alien (Robert Iannucci) who may be able to help them against the marauding motorcyclists. Can the struggling survivors looking for water in this barren world defeat Crazy Bull and his exterminating minions? Hang on tight - the battle has just begun! 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : average note = 6.0 

In the post-apocalyptic world of "Exterminators of the Year 3000," Earth has been transformed into a barren wasteland after a devastating nuclear war. A group of survivors residing in a cave faces a dire water shortage, prompting a risky expedition to find a new water source. When young Timmy, the son of a missing scout, insists on joining the search team, they embark on a treacherous journey through hostile territory ruled by the ruthless 'Crazy Bull' and his gang of motorcyclists. Along the way, they encounter a mysterious loner named Alien, played by Robert Iannucci, who may hold the key to defeating the savage marauders. As the survivors battle for survival against Crazy Bull and his minions, tensions rise, and alliances are tested in this adrenaline-fueled quest for water in a desolate world. Strap in for a thrilling ride as the ultimate showdown unfolds in a fight for survival in the year 3000.

Strap in for a thrilling ride as the ultimate showdown unfolds in a fight for survival in the year 3000.

title = D.A.R.Y.L. 
overview = Daryl is a normal 10-year-old boy in many ways. However, unbeknown to his foster parents and friends, Daryl is actually a government-created robot with superhuman reflexes and mental abilities. Even his name has a hidden meaning -- it's actually an acronym for Data Analyzing Robot Youth Life-form. When the organization that created him deems the "super soldier" experiment a failure and schedules Daryl to be disassembled, it is up to a few rogue scientists to help him escape. 
average note = 6.2 
production compagnie = Paramount Pictures 
Director = Simon Wincer 
tagline = He can fly a jet, race a car and outsmart a computer. The government created him and now they want him destroyed. 
Producer = John Heyman 
duration of the movie = 1h40 
revenue = 7.8 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
budget = 88.8 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.2 

In the thrilling sci-fi film "D.A.R.Y.L.", directed by Simon Wincer and produced by John Heyman, we are introduced to a seemingly ordinary 10-year-old boy named Daryl. Little do his foster parents and friends know, Daryl is actually a government-created robot with extraordinary reflexes and mental capabilities. His name, Daryl, is not just a name but an acronym for Data Analyzing Robot Youth Life-form, hinting at his true identity. As the organization behind his creation labels him a failed "super soldier" experiment and plans to dismantle him, a group of renegade scientists step in to help Daryl escape. With a tagline that reads "He can fly a jet, race a car and outsmart a computer. The government created him and now they want him destroyed," the tension and action in this Paramount Pictures production keep viewers on the edge of their seats. Despite its average note of 6.2, the film managed to generate a revenue of 7.8 million dollars, showcasing its appeal to audiences. Set in English with a runtime of 1 hour and 40 minutes, "D.A.R.Y.L." combines elements of science fiction, adventure, and heartwarming themes of identity and freedom, making it a must-watch for fans of the genre. The movie had a budget of 88.8 million dollars.

As the organization behind his creation labels him a failed "super soldier" experiment and plans to dismantle him, a group of renegade scientists step in to help Daryl escape. With a tagline that reads "He can fly a jet, race a car and outsmart a computer. The government created him and now they want him destroyed," the tension and action in this Paramount Pictures production keep viewers on the edge of their seats. Despite its average note of 6.2, the film managed to generate a revenue of 7.8 million dollars, showcasing its appeal to audiences. Set in English with a runtime of 1 hour and 40 minutes, "D.A.R.Y.L." combines elements of science fiction, adventure, and heartwarming themes of identity and freedom, making it a must-watch for fans of the genre. The movie had a budget of 88.8 million dollars. 
 
 

 
title = Fred Claus 
overview = Fred Claus and Santa Claus have been estranged brothers for many years. Now Fred must reconcile his differences with his brother whom he believes overshadows him. When an efficiency expert assesses the workings at the North Pole and threatens to shut Santa down, Fred must help his brother to save Christmas. 
Director = David Dobkin 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 5.5 
production compagnie = Silver Pictures 
tagline = Everybody has that one relative who can't help but cause problems over the holidays. Even Santa. 
cast = Vince Vaughn, Paul Giamatti, John Michael Higgins, Miranda Richardson 
revenue = 97.8 millions of dollars

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = David Dobkin 

In the heartwarming holiday film "Fred Claus," directed by David Dobkin and produced by Joel Silver, viewers are taken on a journey of family reconciliation and the true spirit of Christmas. Fred Claus and Santa Claus, portrayed by Vince Vaughn and Paul Giamatti respectively, have been estranged for years due to feelings of overshadowing and resentment. When an efficiency expert threatens to shut down Santa's operation at the North Pole, Fred must put aside his differences and help his brother save Christmas. With a stellar supporting cast including John Michael Higgins and Miranda Richardson, this English-language film produced by Silver Pictures delivers a message of love and forgiveness during the festive season. As the tagline suggests, "Everybody has that one relative who can't help but cause problems over the holidays. Even Santa." Despite an average rating of 5.5, "Fred Claus" managed to bring in a whopping $97.8 million in revenue, proving that the power of family and the magic of Christmas can truly transcend any obstacles.

title = La viaccia 
overview = The death of a wealthy patriarch in 1885 sets off an interfamily power struggle. 

FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Mauro Bolognini 

In "La Viaccia," the year is 1885 and the sudden death of a wealthy patriarch ignites a fierce power struggle within the family. As the relatives vie for control and influence, dark secrets and long-held grudges come to light, threatening to tear the family apart. Amidst the turmoil, alliances are formed and broken, leading to unexpected betrayals and revelations. Set against the backdrop of a changing society, this gripping tale of greed, ambition, and betrayal will keep viewers on the edge of their seats until the very end. The film is set in Italy and portrays the complexities of family dynamics and the impact of wealth and power on relationships.

As the relatives vie for control and influence, dark secrets and long-held grudges come to light, threatening to tear the family apart. Amidst the turmoil, alliances are formed and broken, leading to unexpected betrayals and revelations. Set against the backdrop of a changing society, this gripping tale of greed, ambition, and betrayal will keep viewers on the edge of their seats until the very end. The film is set in Italy and portrays the complexities of family dynamics and the impact of wealth and power on relationships. 
 
 

 
title = Jaws 
overview = An insatiable great white shark terrorizes the townspeople of Amity Island, The police chief, an oceanographer and a grizzled shark hunter seek to destroy the bloodthirsty beast. 
date of release = the 18 of June 1975 
budget = 7.0 millions of dollars 
Producer = David Brown 
production countrie = United States of America 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 
duration of the movie = 2h04 
tagline = Don't go in the water. 
Director = Steven Spielberg 
average note = 7.5 
cast = Roy Scheider, Robert Shaw, Richard Dreyfuss, Lorraine Gary 
revenue = 470.7 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : date of release = the 18 of June 1975 

In the summer of 1975, "Jaws" took the world by storm with its thrilling tale of an insatiable great white shark wreaking havoc on the townspeople of Amity Island. The police chief, an oceanographer, and a grizzled shark hunter band together to take down the bloodthirsty beast, leading to a heart-pounding battle of man versus nature. Directed by the legendary Steven Spielberg and produced by David Brown, this American classic from Universal Pictures kept audiences on the edge of their seats for 2 hours and 4 minutes. With a budget of 7.0 million dollars, "Jaws" made a splash at the box office, raking in a staggering 470.7 million dollars in revenue. Starring Roy Scheider, Robert Shaw, Richard Dreyfuss, and Lorraine Gary, this iconic film continues to captivate viewers with its unforgettable tagline: "Don't go in the water." With an average rating of 7.5, "Jaws" remains a timeless masterpiece in the original English language.

title = Ned Kelly 
overview = After getting threatened by Kelly's friends and family, Constable Fitzpatrick places the blame on Ned Kelly and exaggerates what happened. With the biggest ever award available, Kelly and his gang set into the wild, to remain hidden from everyone who seeks them. Even if it means having his family arrested, the Kelly Gang stay hidden and plan a way to get their names cleared. 
average note = 6.1 
date of release = the 22 of March 2003 
revenue = 6.6 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = The British Empire branded them as outlaws. The oppressed called them heroes. 
production compagnie = StudioCanal 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.1 

The movie "Ned Kelly" was released on the 22nd of March 2003 by StudioCanal. It tells the story of the infamous Australian outlaw, Ned Kelly, who is falsely accused by Constable Fitzpatrick, leading Kelly and his gang to hide in the wild to avoid capture. Despite the danger, they are determined to clear their names and seek justice. The British Empire portrays them as outlaws, while the oppressed view them as heroes. The tagline of the film is "The British Empire branded them as outlaws. The oppressed called them heroes." "Ned Kelly" grossed $6.6 million at the box office and received an average rating of 6.1. The movie is in English and offers a gripping portrayal of the pursuit for truth and redemption in the face of adversity.

title = Sidekicks 
overview = Barry is an asthmatic kid having trouble in life. He lives with his father, a computer programmer, in Texas. Barry is struggling to get by in life, dealing with his rough school life, bullies, as well as his health. Barry's only source of enjoyment is fantasizing that he is with Chuck Norris. Barry becomes sick of getting picked on by the bigger guys, and decides to learn karate. 
date of release = the 17 of December 1992 
Producer = Chuck Norris 
duration of the movie = 1h41 
budget = 32.0 millions of dollars 
tagline = A dreamer and a champion. An unbeatable team...Until his hero stepped out of his fantasies to fight at his side. 
Director = Aaron Norris 
average note = 4.9 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Beau Bridges, Jonathan Brandis, Chuck Norris, Mako 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 209.3 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 17 of December 1992 

In the 1992 film "Sidekicks," Barry, an asthmatic kid living in Texas with his father, finds solace in fantasizing about being alongside his hero, Chuck Norris. Struggling with bullies, health issues, and school life, Barry decides to take up karate to defend himself. Produced by Chuck Norris and directed by Aaron Norris, this heartwarming tale follows Barry's journey to empowerment and self-discovery. With a budget of 32.0 million dollars, the movie grossed an impressive 209.3 million dollars at the box office. Starring Beau Bridges, Jonathan Brandis, Chuck Norris, and Mako, "Sidekicks" is a story of resilience, friendship, and the power of dreams. Don't miss this inspiring film that proves dreams can become reality.

The film was released on the 17th of December 1992. The tagline of the movie is "A dreamer and a champion. An unbeatable team...Until his hero stepped out of his fantasies to fight at his side." The average note for the movie is 4.9. The original language of the movie is English, and it was produced in the United States of America. The duration of the movie is 1 hour and 41 minutes.

Struggling with bullies, health issues, and school life, Barry decides to take up karate to defend himself. Produced by Chuck Norris and directed by Aaron Norris, this heartwarming tale follows Barry's journey to empowerment and self-discovery. With a budget of 32.0 million dollars, the movie grossed an impressive 209.3 million dollars at the box office. Starring Beau Bridges, Jonathan Brandis, Chuck Norris, and Mako, "Sidekicks" is a story of resilience, friendship, and the power of dreams. Don't miss this inspiring film that proves dreams can become reality.

The film was released on the 17th of December 1992. The tagline of the movie is "A dreamer and a champion. An unbeatable team...Until his hero stepped out of his fantasies to fight at his side." The average note for the movie is 4.9. The original language of the movie is English, and it was produced in the United States of America. The duration of the movie is 1 hour and 41 minutes. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive

title = The Event 
overview = In August 1991 a failed coup d'état attempt (known as Putsch) led by a group of hard-core communists in Moscow, ended the 70-year-long rule of the Soviets. The USSR collapsed soon after, and the tricolour of the sovereign Russian Federation flew over Kremlin. As president Gorbachev was detained by the coup leaders, state-run TV and radio channels, usurped by the putschists, broadcast Tchaikovsky's "Swan Lake" instead of news bulletins, and crowds of protestors gathered around Moscow's White House, preparing to defend the stronghold of democratic opposition led by Boris Yeltsin, in the city of Leningrad thousands of confused, scared, excited and desperate people poured into the streets to become a part of the event, which was supposed to change their destiny. A quarter of a century later, Sergei Loznitsa revisits the dramatic moments of August 1991 and casts an eye on the event which was hailed worldwide as the birth of "Russian democracy". 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : revenue = 156.8 millions of dollars 

title = The Event 
overview = In August 1991 a failed coup d'état attempt (known as Putsch) led by a group of hard-core communists in Moscow, ended the 70-year-long rule of the Soviets. The USSR collapsed soon after, and the tricolour of the sovereign Russian Federation flew over Kremlin. As president Gorbachev was detained by the coup leaders, state-run TV and radio channels, usurped by the putschists, broadcast Tchaikovsky's "Swan Lake" instead of news bulletins, and crowds of protestors gathered around Moscow's White House, preparing to defend the stronghold of democratic opposition led by Boris Yeltsin. In the city of Leningrad, thousands of confused, scared, excited, and desperate people poured into the streets to become a part of the event, which was supposed to change their destiny. A quarter of a century later, Sergei Loznitsa revisits the dramatic moments of August 1991 and casts an eye on the event which was hailed worldwide as the birth of "Russian democracy". 

In "The Event," director Sergei Loznitsa takes us back to the dramatic events of August 1991 in Moscow and Leningrad. A failed coup d'état attempt by hard-core communists leads to the collapse of the USSR and the rise of the Russian Federation. As President Gorbachev is detained, state-run media broadcasts Tchaikovsky's "Swan Lake" instead of news bulletins, while protestors gather to defend democratic opposition led by Boris Yeltsin. In Leningrad, a mix of emotions grips the people as they pour into the streets, unsure of what the future holds. Loznitsa's film captures the confusion, fear, excitement, and desperation of those who became part of the historic event that changed their destiny. "The Event" is a powerful portrayal of a pivotal moment in history that marked the birth of "Russian democracy."

overview = In August 1991 a failed coup d'état attempt (known as Putsch) led by a group of hard-core communists in Moscow, ended the 70-year-long rule of the Soviets. title = The Joy Luck Club 
overview = Through a series of flashbacks, four young chinese women born in America and their respective mothers born in feudal China, explore their past. This search will help them understand their difficult mother/daughter relationship. 
cast = Ming-Na Wen, Lauren Tom, Tamlyn Tomita, Rosalind Chao 
revenue = 32.9 millions of dollars 
original language of the movie = English 
duration of the movie = 2h19 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 8 of September 1993 
Director = Wayne Wang 
tagline = Between every mother and daughter there is a story that must be told. 
budget = 11.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Ming-Na Wen, Lauren Tom, Tamlyn Tomita, Rosalind Chao 

In the heartwarming film "The Joy Luck Club," directed by Wayne Wang, a poignant exploration of the complex mother-daughter relationships between four young Chinese women and their mothers unfolds. Set against the backdrop of America and feudal China, the movie delves into the past through evocative flashbacks, shedding light on the struggles and triumphs that have shaped these women's lives. Ming-Na Wen, Lauren Tom, Tamlyn Tomita, and Rosalind Chao deliver powerful performances that resonate with audiences. With a budget of 11.0 million dollars, the film grossed an impressive 32.9 million dollars at the box office. Released on September 8, 1993, in the United States of America, this 2-hour and 19-minute cinematic masterpiece in English captures the essence of the tagline: "Between every mother and daughter there is a story that must be told."

The movie "The Joy Luck Club" has a revenue of 32.9 million dollars, an original language of English, a production country of the United States of America, a duration of 2 hours and 19 minutes, and was released on the 8th of September 1993. The cast includes Ming-Na Wen, Lauren Tom, Tamlyn Tomita, and Rosalind Chao. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 32.9 millions of dollars 

In the heartwarming film "The Joy Luck Club," directed by Wayne Wang, a poignant exploration of the complex mother-daughter relationships between four young Chinese women and their mothers unfolds. Set against the backdrop of America and feudal China, the movie delves into the past through evocative flashbacks, shedding light on the struggles and triumphs that have shaped these women's lives. Ming-Na Wen, Lauren Tom, Tamlyn Tomita, and Rosalind Chao deliver powerful performances that resonate with audiences. With a budget of 11.0 million dollars, the film grossed an impressive 32.9 million dollars at the box office. Released on September 8, 1993, in the United States of America, this 2-hour and 19-minute cinematic masterpiece in English captures the essence of the tagline: "Between every mother and daughter there is a story that must be told."

The movie "The Joy Luck Club" has a revenue of 32.9 million dollars, an original language of English, a production country of the United States of America, a duration of 2 hours and 19 minutes, and was released on the 8th of September 1993. The cast includes Ming-Na Wen, Lauren Tom, Tamlyn Tomita, and Rosalind Chao.

title = Rustom 
overview = Rustom Pavri, an honourable officer of the Indian Navy shoots his friend Vikram  to death after discovering that his wife Cynthia had an affair with the rich businessman. The Commander surrenders himself to the Police immediately and admits to have killed Vikram but pleads 'not guilty' in court. Is he convicted or acquitted? 
revenue = 180.3 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.3 
production compagnie = KriArj Entertainment 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 180.3 millions of dollars 

In the gripping film "Rustom," we follow the story of Rustom Pavri, a respected officer in the Indian Navy. When he learns of his wife Cynthia's affair with a wealthy businessman named Vikram, Rustom is driven to a breaking point. In a moment of passion, he takes Vikram's life, leading to a dramatic turn of events. Surrendering himself to the authorities, Rustom confesses to the crime but maintains his plea of 'not guilty' during the court proceedings. As the trial unfolds, the audience is left on the edge of their seats, wondering whether Rustom will be convicted or acquitted. With a stellar performance by the lead actor and a compelling narrative, "Rustom" captivates viewers and leaves them questioning the true meaning of justice. Produced by KriArj Entertainment, this film has garnered both critical acclaim and commercial success, grossing an impressive $180.3 million at the box office. With an average rating of 7.3, "Rustom" stands as a testament to the power of storytelling in cinema.

title = Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf? 
overview = Mike Nichols’ film from Edward Albee's play brought new themes to the film industry. Elizabeth Taylor and Richard Burton have never been more brilliant together as they portray an experienced married couple who love each other yet verbally attack one another when they see how boring their naïve newlywed guests have made their night. 
Director = Mike Nichols 
revenue = 33.7 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.8 
duration of the movie = 2h11 
production compagnie = Chenault Productions 
Producer = T.J. Healy II 
production countrie = United States of America 
tagline = You are cordially invited to George and Martha's for an evening of fun and games 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : Director = Mike Nichols 

In "Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf?", directed by Mike Nichols and based on Edward Albee's play, audiences are taken on a gripping journey through the tumultuous relationship of a seasoned married couple, portrayed brilliantly by Elizabeth Taylor and Richard Burton. The couple's love is overshadowed by their tendency to verbally attack each other, especially when they are confronted with the dullness of their naive newlywed guests. As the night unfolds, secrets are revealed and emotions run high in this intense portrayal of marriage dynamics. With a revenue of 33.7 million dollars and an average rating of 7.8, this 2-hour and 11-minute film, produced by Chenault Productions and T.J. Healy II, takes place in the United States of America. The tagline "You are cordially invited to George and Martha's for an evening of fun and games" sets the tone for a night filled with tension, drama, and unexpected twists.

With a revenue of 33.7 million dollars and an average rating of 7.8, this 2-hour and 11-minute film, produced by Chenault Productions and T.J. Healy II, takes place in the United States of America. The tagline "You are cordially invited to George and Martha's for an evening of fun and games" sets the tone for a night filled with tension, drama, and unexpected twists.

overview = The Green Butchers (Danish: De grønne slagtere) is a black comedy featuring two butchers, Svend "Sweat" and Bjarne, who start their own shop to get away from their arrogant boss. Cannibalism is soon introduced to the plot, and further complications arise due to the reappearance of Bjarne's mentally retarded twin brother Eigil.

In "The Green Butchers," a dark comedy directed by Anders Thomas Jensen, we follow the misadventures of two butchers, Svend "Sweat" and Bjarne, who decide to open their own shop to escape their overbearing boss. However, their business takes a twisted turn when cannibalism becomes part of their menu, leading to a series of bizarre and comedic events. Things get even more complicated with the unexpected return of Bjarne's mentally challenged twin brother, Eigil. Produced by Kim Magnusson, this 1 hour and 40-minute film grossed an impressive $14.1 million at the box office.

title = Eddie the Eagle 
overview = Inspired by true events, Eddie the Eagle is a feel-good story about Michael "Eddie" Edwards (Taron Egerton), an unlikely but courageous British ski-jumper who never stopped believing in himself - even as an entire nation was counting him out. With the help of a rebellious and charismatic coach (played by Hugh Jackman), Eddie takes on the establishment and wins the hearts of sports fans around the world by making an improbable and historic showing at the 1988 Calgary Winter Olympics. 
average note = 7.2 
tagline = Win or lose, always aim high 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 46.2 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : average note = 7.2 

In the inspiring film "Eddie the Eagle," based on true events, viewers are taken on a heartwarming journey alongside Michael "Eddie" Edwards, portrayed by Taron Egerton. Against all odds, Eddie, a determined British ski-jumper, refuses to give up on his dreams, capturing the attention of an entire nation. With the guidance of a rebellious and charming coach, played by Hugh Jackman, Eddie defies expectations and captures the hearts of sports fans worldwide. Set against the backdrop of the 1988 Calgary Winter Olympics, Eddie's remarkable and historic performance showcases the power of perseverance and self-belief. As the tagline suggests, "Win or lose, always aim high." With an average note of 7.2, this English-language film grossed an impressive $46.2 million in revenue.

In the inspiring film "Eddie the Eagle," based on true events, viewers are taken on a heartwarming journey alongside Michael "Eddie" Edwards, portrayed by Taron Egerton. Against all odds, Eddie, a determined British ski-jumper, refuses to give up on his dreams, capturing the attention of an entire nation. With the guidance of a rebellious and charming coach, played by Hugh Jackman, Eddie defies expectations and captures the hearts of sports fans worldwide. Set against the backdrop of the 1988 Calgary Winter Olympics, Eddie's remarkable and historic performance showcases the power of perseverance and self-belief. As the tagline suggests, "Win or lose, always aim high." With an average note of 7.2, this English-language film grossed an impressive $46.2 million in revenue.

title = Murder at the Gallop 
overview = Miss Marple and Mr Stringer are witness to the death of the very old and rich Mr. Enderby by heart attack. Yet they have their doubts about what happened. The police don’t believe them thus leading Miss Marple to yet again investigate by herself. A cult film starring Margaret Rutherford. 
budget = 67.9 millions of dollars 
tagline = It's a Penny to a Pony... Murder Will Out! 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : budget = 67.9 millions of dollars 

In "Murder at the Gallop," Miss Marple and Mr. Stringer find themselves embroiled in a mysterious case following the death of wealthy Mr. Enderby, initially believed to be from a heart attack. Despite their doubts and the police's skepticism, Miss Marple takes it upon herself to unravel the truth once more. Starring the iconic Margaret Rutherford, this cult film delves into the intricate web of deception and intrigue surrounding the untimely demise. With a budget of 67.9 million dollars, "Murder at the Gallop" promises a thrilling ride as secrets are uncovered and justice prevails. As the tagline suggests, "It's a Penny to a Pony... Murder Will Out!"

title = Sergeant York 
overview = Alvin York a hillbilly sharpshooter transforms himself from ruffian to religious pacifist. He is then called to serve his country and despite deep religious and moral objections to fighting becomes one of the most celebrated American heroes of WWI. 
date of release = the 2 of July 1941 
production compagnie = Warner Bros. 
duration of the movie = 2h14 
Producer = Hal B. Wallis 
production countrie = United States of America 
revenue = 16.4 millions of dollars 
cast = Gary Cooper, Walter Brennan, Joan Leslie, Margaret Wycherly 
Director = Howard Hawks 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 2 of July 1941 

In the 1941 film "Sergeant York," directed by Howard Hawks and produced by Hal B. Wallis for Warner Bros., audiences are taken on a journey following the transformation of Alvin York, a hillbilly sharpshooter. Despite his initial rough demeanor, York undergoes a profound change to become a religious pacifist. When duty calls during World War I, York faces a moral dilemma as his deep-rooted beliefs clash with the idea of fighting for his country. Played by the talented Gary Cooper, York's internal struggle unfolds over a duration of 2 hours and 14 minutes on screen. Alongside Cooper, the stellar cast includes Walter Brennan, Joan Leslie, and Margaret Wycherly. The film was released on July 2, 1941, in the United States of America and went on to generate a revenue of $16.4 million, solidifying its place as a classic American tale of heroism and inner conflict.

title = A Taxing Woman 
overview = Ryoko Itakura is a government tax agent who has just landed a big promotion. Her first assignment is to catch wheeler-dealer Hideki Gondo. She has a tough job, since in Japan tax evasion is an art and Gondo is, in effect, Rembrandt. Her job is complicated by a growing sympathy for the rogue and by political pressure to lay off. 
revenue = 266.6 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 7 of February 1987 
Director = Juzo Itami 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 266.6 millions of dollars 

In the 1987 film "A Taxing Woman," directed by Juzo Itami, we follow the story of Ryoko Itakura, a government tax agent on a mission to catch the notorious wheeler-dealer Hideki Gondo. As she navigates the intricate world of tax evasion in Japan, Ryoko finds herself torn between her duty to uphold the law and her growing sympathy for Gondo, who is a master at his craft. With political pressure mounting, Ryoko faces a challenging decision that could change everything. The movie, released on the 7th of February 1987, grossed an impressive $266.6 million at the box office.

In the 1987 film "A Taxing Woman," directed by Juzo Itami, we follow the story of Ryoko Itakura, a government tax agent on a mission to catch the notorious wheeler-dealer Hideki Gondo. As she navigates the intricate world of tax evasion in Japan, Ryoko finds herself torn between her duty to uphold the law and her growing sympathy for Gondo, who is a master at his craft. With political pressure mounting, Ryoko faces a challenging decision that could change everything. The movie, released on the 7th of February 1987, grossed an impressive $266.6 million at the box office.

title = The Ring 
overview = It sounded like just another urban legend: A videotape filled with nightmarish images, leading to a phone call foretelling the viewer's death in exactly seven days. As a newspaper reporter, Rachel Keller was naturally skeptical of the story, until four teenagers all met with mysterious deaths exactly one week after watching just such a tape. Allowing her investigative curiosity to get the better of her, Rachel tracks down the video... and watches it. Now she has just seven days to unravel the mystery of the Ring. 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the English-language film "The Ring," a chilling urban legend becomes a terrifying reality for newspaper reporter Rachel Keller. Skeptical at first, Rachel's curiosity leads her to investigate a mysterious videotape that supposedly predicts the viewer's death in seven days. After watching the tape herself, Rachel is thrust into a race against time to uncover the secrets behind the cursed video before her own fate is sealed. Will she be able to solve the mystery of the Ring before it's too late? The movie is about a videotape filled with nightmarish images that leads to a phone call foretelling the viewer's death in exactly seven days. Four teenagers meet mysterious deaths exactly one week after watching the tape, prompting Rachel to track down the video and watch it herself.

In the epic adventure film "Clash of the Titans," set in the United States of America, viewers are taken on a thrilling journey with Perseus as he embarks on a quest to win the right to marry Princess Andromeda. To fulfill his destiny, Perseus must complete various tasks, including taming the majestic Pegasus, capturing the head of the fearsome Medusa, and facing off against the monstrous Kraken. Released on the 15th of March 1981, this film captivates audiences with its fantastical elements and action-packed scenes. With an average rating of 6.8, "Clash of the Titans" promises viewers an unforgettable experience, as emphasized by its tagline: "You will feel the power. Live the adventure. title = SST: Death Flight 
overview = On its maiden flight, the crew of America's first supersonic transport learns that it may not be able to land, due to an act of sabotage and a deadly flu onboard. 
production compagnie = ABC Circle Films 
Director = David Lowell Rich 
date of release = the 25 of February 1977 
average note = 3.5 
budget = 176.3 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h29 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 42.2 millions of dollars 
tagline = ONE HOUR AFTER TAKE OFF...SUDDENLY IT HAPPENS! The Inaugural Flight of America's First SST. 250 People Trapped By a Deadly Menace on a Supersonic Giant...And No Airport in the World Will Let Them Land! 
Producer = Ron Roth 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct. the fact mentioned is indeed "production company = abc circle films" and it matches with the description provided.']
fact : production compagnie = ABC Circle Films 

In the thrilling movie "SST: Death Flight," directed by David Lowell Rich and produced by Ron Roth, viewers are taken on a high-stakes journey aboard America's first supersonic transport. On its maiden flight, a deadly flu outbreak and an act of sabotage create a harrowing situation for the crew and 250 passengers on board. With a budget of 176.3 million dollars, the film was released on the 25th of February 1977 by ABC Circle Films. As the tension rises and the clock ticks, the crew faces the daunting realization that they may not be able to land the aircraft safely. With an average rating of 3.5, this 1 hour and 29-minute film keeps audiences on the edge of their seats as they witness the desperate struggle for survival at 30,000 feet. Will they find a way to overcome the deadly menace on board before it's too late? Find out in "SST: Death Flight."

Facts included in the description:
- Title: SST: Death Flight
- Overview: On its maiden flight, the crew of America's first supersonic transport learns that it may not be able to land, due to an act of sabotage and a deadly flu onboard.
- Production Company: ABC Circle Films
- Director: David Lowell Rich
- Date of Release: the 25th of February 1977
- Average Note: 3.5
- Budget: 176.3 million dollars
- Duration of the movie: 1 hour 29 minutes
- Original Language of the movie: English
- Revenue: 42.2 million dollars
- Tagline: ONE HOUR AFTER TAKE OFF...SUDDENLY IT HAPPENS! The Inaugural Flight of America's First SST. 250 People Trapped By a Deadly Menace on a Supersonic Giant...And No Airport in the World Will Let Them Land!
- Producer: Ron Roth

On its maiden flight, a deadly flu outbreak and an act of sabotage create a harrowing situation for the crew and 250 passengers on board. With a budget of 176.3 million dollars, the film was released on the 25th of February 1977 by ABC Circle Films. As the tension rises and the clock ticks, the crew faces the daunting realization that they may not be able to land the aircraft safely. With an average rating of 3.5, this 1 hour and 29-minute film keeps audiences on the edge of their seats as they witness the desperate struggle for survival at 30,000 feet. Will they find a way to overcome the deadly menace on board before it's too late? Find out in "SST: Death Flight."

Facts included in the description:
- Title: SST: Death Flight
- Overview: On its maiden flight, the crew of America's first supersonic transport learns that it may not be able to land, due to an act of sabotage and a deadly flu onboard.
- Production Company: ABC Circle Films
- Director: David Lowell Rich
- Date of Release: the 25th of February 1977
- Average Note: 3.5
- Budget: 176.3 million dollars
- Duration of the movie: 1 hour 29 minutes
- Original Language of the movie: English
- Revenue: 42.2 million dollars
- Tagline: ONE HOUR AFTER TAKE OFF...SUDDENLY IT HAPPENS! The Inaugural Flight of America's First SST. 250 People Trapped By a Deadly Menace on a Supersonic Giant...And No Airport in the World Will Let Them Land!
- Producer: Ron Roth

title = Mystery of the Wax Museum 
overview = Sculptor Ivan Igor struggles in vain to prevent his partner from burning his wax museum, and his "children". Years later, Igor starts a new museum in New York, but his maimed hands confine him to directing lesser artists. People begin disappearing; Igor takes a sinister interest in Charlotte, fiancée of his assistant Ralph, but arouses the suspicions of roommate, wisecracking reporter Florence. 
Producer = Hal B. Wallis 
tagline = Women of FLESH become WAX in his hands... women of wax become flesh! 
date of release = the 18 of February 1933 
budget = 270.7 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h17 
production countrie = United States of America 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : Producer = Hal B. Wallis 

In "Mystery of the Wax Museum," produced by Hal B. Wallis, sculptor Ivan Igor faces tragedy as his wax museum is destroyed by fire, along with his beloved creations. Years later, Igor reemerges in New York, haunted by his maimed hands and a dark obsession with his assistant's fiancée, Charlotte. As people mysteriously vanish, suspicions rise, especially from the sharp-witted reporter Florence, Igor's roommate. Set in the United States of America, this chilling tale unfolds over 1 hour and 17 minutes, showcasing a twisted world where the line between flesh and wax blurs. With a budget of 270.7 million dollars, "Mystery of the Wax Museum" delves into the macabre, where women of flesh transform into wax and vice versa. Don't miss this classic thriller released on the 18th of February 1933. The tagline for the movie is "Women of FLESH become WAX in his hands... women of wax become flesh!"

title = Margaret's Museum 
overview = In a town where half the men die down the coalpit, Margaret MacNeil is quite happy being single in her small Cape Breton island town. Until she meets Neil Currie, a charming and sincere bagpipe-playing, Gaelic-speaking dishwasher. But no matter what you do, you can't avoid the spectre of the pit forever. 
date of release = the 13 of September 1995 
cast = Helena Bonham Carter, Clive Russell, Craig Olejnik, Kate Nelligan 
average note = 7.5 
tagline = She found a way to preserve her memories forever. 
revenue = 45.9 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h54 
budget = 21.6 millions of dollars 
production countrie = Canada 
Producer = Steve Clark-Hall 
Director = Mort Ransen 
production compagnie = Téléfilm Canada 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 13 of September 1995 

In the heartfelt drama "Margaret's Museum," set in a small Cape Breton island town in Canada, Margaret MacNeil leads a content life despite the tragic loss of many men in the coalpit. Her world changes when she crosses paths with Neil Currie, a charming dishwasher with a passion for bagpipe-playing and Gaelic. As their relationship blossoms, Margaret is forced to confront the looming shadow of the coalpit that haunts her community. Directed by Mort Ransen and featuring a talented cast including Helena Bonham Carter, Clive Russell, Craig Olejnik, and Kate Nelligan, this poignant tale explores love, loss, and the enduring impact of industrial tragedy. With a tagline that hints at Margaret's quest to preserve her memories forever, the film was released on September 13, 1995, and received an average rating of 7.5. Despite its modest budget of 21.6 million dollars, "Margaret's Museum" managed to generate a revenue of 45.9 million dollars, showcasing its emotional resonance with audiences worldwide. The movie has a duration of 1 hour and 54 minutes and was produced in Canada by Téléfilm Canada. The original language of the movie is English, and the producer is Steve Clark-Hall. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : cast = Helena Bonham Carter, Clive Russell, Craig Olejnik, Kate Nelligan 

In the heartfelt drama "Margaret's Museum," set in a small Cape Breton island town in Canada, Margaret MacNeil leads a content life despite the tragic loss of many men in the coalpit. Her world changes when she crosses paths with Neil Currie, a charming dishwasher with a passion for bagpipe-playing and Gaelic. As their relationship blossoms, Margaret is forced to confront the looming shadow of the coalpit that haunts her community. Directed by Mort Ransen and featuring a talented cast including Helena Bonham Carter, Clive Russell, Craig Olejnik, and Kate Nelligan, this poignant tale explores love, loss, and the enduring impact of industrial tragedy. With a tagline that hints at Margaret's quest to preserve her memories forever, the film was released on September 13, 1995, and received an average rating of 7.5. Despite its modest budget of 21.6 million dollars, "Margaret's Museum" managed to generate a revenue of 45.9 million dollars, showcasing its emotional resonance with audiences worldwide. The movie has a duration of 1 hour and 54 minutes and was produced in Canada by Téléfilm Canada. The original language of the movie is English, and the producer is Steve Clark-Hall.
