title = The Corporation 
overview = Since the late 18th century American legal decision that the business corporation organizational model is legally a person, it has become a dominant economic, political and social force around the globe. This film takes an in-depth psychological examination of the organization model through various case studies. What the study illustrates is that in the its behaviour, this type of "person" typically acts like a dangerously destructive psychopath without conscience. Furthermore, we see the profound threat this psychopath has for our world and our future, but also how the people with courage, intelligence and determination can do to stop it. 
tagline = The corporation as psychopath... 
cast = Jane Akre, Ray Anderson, Maude Barlow, Chris Barrett 
Director = Mark Achbar 
revenue = 4.5 millions of dollars 
budget = 74.4 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Big Picture Media Corporation 
duration of the movie = 2h25 
average note = 7.6 
Producer = Mark Achbar 
date of release = the 10 of September 2003 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : tagline = The corporation as psychopath... 

In "The Corporation," directed by Mark Achbar, viewers are taken on a compelling journey through the history and impact of the business corporation model. Through various case studies, the film delves into the psychological examination of this organizational structure, revealing it to behave like a dangerously destructive psychopath without conscience. With a stellar cast including Jane Akre, Ray Anderson, Maude Barlow, and Chris Barrett, the documentary sheds light on the profound threat corporations pose to our world and future. Despite the grim outlook, the film also highlights the potential for change through the actions of courageous and determined individuals. Released on September 10, 2003, with a runtime of 2 hours and 25 minutes, "The Corporation" has garnered an average rating of 7.6. The tagline "The corporation as psychopath..." encapsulates the chilling reality explored in this thought-provoking film.

The film had a revenue of 4.5 million dollars and a budget of 74.4 million dollars. The production company behind "The Corporation" is Big Picture Media Corporation. The original language of the movie is English. Mark Achbar not only directed the film but also served as a producer for it.

title = Lord of War 
overview = Yuri Orlov is a globetrotting arms dealer and, through some of the deadliest war zones, he struggles to stay one step ahead of a relentless Interpol agent, his business rivals and even some of his customers who include many of the world's most notorious dictators. Finally, he must also face his own conscience. 
Director = Andrew Niccol 
average note = 7.0 
duration of the movie = 2h02 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : Director = Andrew Niccol 

In "Lord of War," directed by Andrew Niccol, viewers are taken on a thrilling journey following the life of Yuri Orlov, a cunning arms dealer who navigates through dangerous war zones while trying to outsmart Interpol agents, rival dealers, and even his own clients, some of whom are infamous dictators. As the tension rises, Yuri is forced to confront not only external threats but also his own moral compass. With an average rating of 7.0, this gripping film spans 2 hours and 2 minutes, offering a captivating look into the dark world of international arms trafficking.

As the tension rises, Yuri is forced to confront not only external threats but also his own moral compass. title = The Ref 
overview = A cat burglar is forced to take a bickering, dysfunctional family hostage on Christmas Eve. 
budget = 11.0 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h37 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 9 of March 1994 
tagline = They might be his hostages but what they're doing to this guy is criminal. 
average note = 6.7 
production compagnie = Touchstone Pictures 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = Denis Leary, Judy Davis, Kevin Spacey, Glynis Johns 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : budget = 11.0 millions of dollars 

In "The Ref," a cat burglar finds himself in an unexpected situation when he is forced to take a bickering, dysfunctional family hostage on Christmas Eve. As tensions rise and secrets are revealed, the burglar must navigate the chaos of the family while trying to stay one step ahead. Set in the United States of America, this dark comedy was released on the 9th of March 1994 by Touchstone Pictures. Starring Denis Leary, Judy Davis, Kevin Spacey, and Glynis Johns, the film runs for 1 hour and 37 minutes in English. With a budget of 11 million dollars, "The Ref" received an average rating of 6.7. The tagline "They might be his hostages but what they're doing to this guy is criminal" sets the tone for this witty and entertaining holiday film.

title = The Rich Are Always with Us 
overview = The ten year marriage of of Caroline Van Dyke and Greg Grannard is falling apart. A young woman, Allison, plots to become his second wife. Caroline's friend, novelist Julian, has long loved her and now sees his chance, but she refuses him and goes to Paris to file for divorce. Julian follows but on hearing that Greg has fallen on financial hardship Caroline returns to help him. Greg tells Caroline that his now-wife Allison is pregnant and Caroline realizes that she loves Julian and to travel to China with him and be married. Allison and Greg have a bitter row in the car, which then smashes into a tree killing Allison and injuring Greg. Caroline tells Julian she will stay with Greg until he is well, but marries Julian in the hospital with a promise to join him as soon as she can. 
average note = 6.8 
production countrie = United States of America 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 6.8 

In "The Rich Are Always with Us," the ten-year marriage of Caroline Van Dyke and Greg Grannard is on the brink of collapse. As their relationship crumbles, a young woman named Allison schemes to become Greg's second wife. Caroline's close friend, the novelist Julian, harbors unrequited love for her and seizes the opportunity to win her affections. Despite Julian's advances, Caroline decides to end her marriage and travels to Paris to file for divorce. However, when she learns of Greg's financial troubles, she returns to his side. Amidst the turmoil, a shocking revelation about Allison's pregnancy forces Caroline to confront her true feelings for Julian. A tragic accident involving Allison and Greg changes the course of events, leading Caroline to make a life-altering decision. Set against the backdrop of shifting relationships and unforeseen twists, this American production explores the complexities of love, loyalty, and sacrifice. With an average rating of 6.8, "The Rich Are Always with Us" takes viewers on a journey from heartbreak to unexpected new beginnings.

The production country of "The Rich Are Always with Us" is the United States of America.

title = In a World... 
overview = An underachieving vocal coach is motivated by her father, the king of movie-trailer voice-overs, to pursue her aspirations of becoming a voice-over star. Amidst pride, sexism and family dysfunction, she sets out to change the voice of a generation. 
Director = Lake Bell 
average note = 6.4 
revenue = 3.0 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 9 of August 2013 
tagline = Speak up and let your voice be heard 
budget = 1.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Lake Bell 

In a World... where movie trailers reign supreme, an underachieving vocal coach finds herself at a crossroads when her legendary father, the king of movie-trailer voice-overs, inspires her to pursue her dreams of becoming a voice-over star. Directed by Lake Bell, this comedic journey delves into themes of pride, sexism, and family dysfunction as our protagonist sets out to revolutionize the industry and change the voice of a generation. With a tagline urging you to "Speak up and let your voice be heard," this film was released on the 9th of August 2013, grossing $3.0 million in revenue against a budget of $1.0 million, and received an average rating of 6.4.

In a World... where movie trailers reign supreme, an underachieving vocal coach finds herself at a crossroads when her legendary father, the king of movie-trailer voice-overs, inspires her to pursue her dreams of becoming a voice-over star. Directed by Lake Bell, this comedic journey delves into themes of pride, sexism, and family dysfunction as our protagonist sets out to revolutionize the industry and change the voice of a generation. With a tagline urging you to "Speak up and let your voice be heard," this film was released on the 9th of August 2013, grossing $3.0 million in revenue against a budget of $1.0 million, and received an average rating of 6.4.

overview = When they can no longer stomach the ever-growing weed of suburban crime, Jay and Silent Bob take on the mantles of costumed avengers Bluntman and Chronic, smashing the super-villains they accidentally create!  Can the Doobage Duo save their beloved Jersey 'burbs from their new arch enemies, The League of Shitters?  While clearly not the comic book movie the world wants, GROOVY MOVIE is the comic book movie the world needs!

title = Night Train to Lisbon 
overview = Raimund Gregorius, having saved a beautiful Portuguese woman from leaping to her death, stumbles upon a mesmerizing book by a Portuguese author, which compels him to suddenly abandon the boring life he has led for years and to embark on an enthralling adventure.  In search of the author, Gregorius acts as detective, pulling together pieces of a puzzle that involves political and emotional intrigue and the highest possible stakes. His voyage is one that transcends time and space, delving into the realms of history, medicine and love, all in search of true meaning to his life. 
Producer = Kerstin Ramcke 
tagline = Only when you are lost can you truly find yourself 
production compagnie = Studio Hamburg Filmproduktion 
original language of the movie = English 
production countrie = Germany 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Kerstin Ramcke 

In "Night Train to Lisbon," Raimund Gregorius, a reserved professor, experiences a life-changing encounter when he saves a woman from a desperate act. This pivotal moment leads him to discover a captivating book by a Portuguese author, prompting him to abandon his mundane existence and embark on a thrilling journey. Determined to find the elusive author, Gregorius transforms into a detective, uncovering a complex web of political intrigue and emotional entanglements with high stakes. As he delves deeper into the mystery, he traverses through time and space, exploring themes of history, medicine, and love in his quest for true purpose. Produced by Kerstin Ramcke and filmed in Germany by Studio Hamburg Filmproduktion, this English-language film reminds us that sometimes, it is only in being lost that we can truly discover ourselves. The tagline of the movie is "Only when you are lost can you truly find yourself." The original language of the movie is English, and the production country is Germany.

['correct!']

title = The Grey Fox 
overview = Old West highwayman Bill Miner, known to Pinkertons as "The Gentleman Bandit," is released in 1901 after 33 years in prison, a genial and charming old man. He goes to Washington to live and work with his sister's family. But the world has changed much while he has been away, and he just can't adjust. So he goes to Canada and returns to the only thing familiar to him -- robbery (with stagecoaches changed to trains). 
budget = 117.4 millions of dollars 
Producer = Peter O'Brian 
average note = 7.2 
revenue = 242.8 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h50 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 16 of December 1982 
tagline = In 1901, after 33 years in San Quentin Prison, Bill Miner, "The Gentleman Bandit", was released into the Twentieth Century. 
Director = Phillip Borsos 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : budget = 117.4 millions of dollars 

In the 1982 film "The Grey Fox," directed by Phillip Borsos and produced by Peter O'Brian, audiences are taken on a journey back to the Old West. The movie follows the story of Bill Miner, a notorious highwayman known as "The Gentleman Bandit," who is released from prison after 33 years. Despite his genial and charming demeanor, Miner struggles to adapt to the rapidly changing world around him. Eventually, he decides to return to his life of crime, transitioning from robbing stagecoaches to trains in Canada. With a budget of 117.4 million dollars, the film managed to captivate audiences and critics alike, earning an average note of 7.2. Released on the 16th of December 1982, "The Grey Fox" grossed an impressive 242.8 million dollars at the box office. The tagline "In 1901, after 33 years in San Quentin Prison, Bill Miner, 'The Gentleman Bandit', was released into the Twentieth Century" sets the tone for this captivating tale that explores themes of redemption, nostalgia, and the passage of time. The duration of the movie is 1 hour and 50 minutes. The original language of the movie is English. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : Producer = Peter O'Brian

The movie follows the story of Bill Miner, a notorious highwayman known as "The Gentleman Bandit," who is released from prison after 33 years. Despite his genial and charming demeanor, Miner struggles to adapt to the rapidly changing world around him. Eventually, he decides to return to his life of crime, transitioning from robbing stagecoaches to trains in Canada. With a budget of 117.4 million dollars, the film managed to captivate audiences and critics alike, earning an average note of 7.2. Released on the 16th of December 1982, "The Grey Fox" grossed an impressive 242.8 million dollars at the box office. The tagline "In 1901, after 33 years in San Quentin Prison, Bill Miner, 'The Gentleman Bandit', was released into the Twentieth Century" sets the tone for this captivating tale that explores themes of redemption, nostalgia, and the passage of time. The duration of the movie is 1 hour and 50 minutes. The original language of the movie is English.

['correct']

title = Germany Year Zero 
overview = The final film in Rossellini's war film trilogy (the first two being Rome, Open City and Paisà). Germany Year Zero takes place in post-war Germany, unlike the others, which take place in German-occupied Rome and post-war Italy, respectively. The story follows a twelve-year-old boy, Edmund Kohler, who is mainly left to his own devices in order to survive and to help his family do the same. 
revenue = 69.9 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 1 of December 1948 
Producer = Roberto Rossellini 
original language of the movie = Italian 
duration of the movie = 1h10 
average note = 7.5 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : revenue = 69.9 millions of dollars 

In Roberto Rossellini's powerful film "Germany Year Zero," the audience is transported to post-war Germany, a stark contrast to the previous settings of German-occupied Rome and post-war Italy in the trilogy. The story revolves around twelve-year-old Edmund Kohler, who navigates a devastated landscape, struggling to survive and support his family. As the final installment in Rossellini's war film trilogy, which includes the acclaimed "Rome, Open City" and "Paisà," "Germany Year Zero" offers a poignant and raw portrayal of the aftermath of war. With a runtime of 1 hour and 10 minutes, the film, originally in Italian, was released on December 1, 1948, produced by Roberto Rossellini, and achieved a revenue of 69.9 million dollars, while also receiving an average rating of 7.5.

title = The Hit 
overview = Ex-gangster Willie Parker has betrayed his former "colleagues" and now lives in Spain where he thinks he can hide from their vengeance... 
Director = Stephen Frears 
Producer = Jeremy Thomas 
original language of the movie = English 
cast = John Hurt, Terence Stamp, Tim Roth, Laura del Sol 
average note = 6.5 
revenue = 198.2 millions of dollars 
budget = 260.5 millions of dollars 
duration of the movie = 1h38 
tagline = Even bad guys have bad days 
production compagnie = Zenith Entertainment 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Stephen Frears 

In "The Hit," directed by Stephen Frears and produced by Jeremy Thomas, ex-gangster Willie Parker finds himself in a dangerous game of cat and mouse after betraying his former colleagues and seeking refuge in Spain. Starring John Hurt, Terence Stamp, Tim Roth, and Laura del Sol, this English-language film follows Willie as he tries to evade the vengeance of his past. With an average rating of 6.5, the movie boasts a stellar cast and a gripping storyline. Despite its budget of 260.5 million dollars, "The Hit" managed to rake in an impressive revenue of 198.2 million dollars. With a runtime of 1 hour and 38 minutes, this Zenith Entertainment production delivers on its tagline: "Even bad guys have bad days."

title = The Little Rascals 
overview = Spanky, Alfalfa, Buckwheat, and the other characters made famous in the Our Gang shorts of the 1920s and 1930s are brought back to life in this nostalgic children's comedy. When Alfalfa starts to question his devotion to the club's principles after falling for the beautiful nine-year old Darla, the rest of the gang sets out to keep them apart.

tagline = Mischief loves company 
date of release = the 5 of August 1994 
budget = 74.0 millions of dollars

In the heartwarming and hilarious film "The Little Rascals," the beloved characters from the Our Gang shorts of the 1920s and 1930s are revived for a new generation. Set in the United States of America, this nostalgic children's comedy follows the misadventures of Spanky, Alfalfa, Buckwheat, and their friends. When Alfalfa falls head over heels for the enchanting Darla, he begins to question his loyalty to the club's principles, sparking a series of schemes by the gang to keep the young lovebirds apart. Released on the 5th of August 1994 with a budget of 74.0 million dollars, this film reminds us that "Mischief loves company."

title = I Remember 
overview = The memories of Guiga, from early childhood to young adulthood: his family, relatives, friends, fears, dreams and reality in a still provincial city of Salvador, Bahia, from the 50s to the 70s. 
average note = 8.0 
original language of the movie = Portuguese 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : average note = 8.0 

"I Remember" is a nostalgic journey through the life of Guiga, spanning from his early childhood to young adulthood in Salvador, Bahia. Set in the 1950s to the 1970s, the film beautifully captures Guiga's memories of family, relatives, friends, fears, dreams, and the harsh realities of growing up in a provincial city. With an average rating of 8.0, this Portuguese-language film immerses viewers in a heartfelt tale of reminiscence and self-discovery.

title = No Escape 
overview = In the year 2022, a ruthless prison warden has created the ultimate solution for his most troublesome and violent inmates: Absolom, a secret jungle island where prisoners are abandoned and left to die. But Marine Captain John Robbins, convicted of murdering a commanding officer, is determined to escape the island in order to reveal the truth behind his murderous actions and clear his name. 
duration of the movie = 1h58 
Director = Martin Campbell 
production countrie = United States of America 
date of release = the 29 of April 1994 
Producer = Gale Anne Hurd 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Columbia Pictures Corporation 
average note = 6.1 
revenue = 15.3 millions of dollars 
budget = 20.0 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct!']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h58 

In the action-packed thriller "No Escape," directed by Martin Campbell, viewers are transported to the year 2022 where a cunning prison warden devises a brutal scheme to deal with unruly inmates by banishing them to the treacherous jungle island of Absolom. Among the condemned is Marine Captain John Robbins, wrongly convicted of a heinous crime. Determined to prove his innocence, Robbins must navigate the deadly island to uncover the truth behind his alleged actions and clear his name. With a runtime of 1 hour and 58 minutes, this gripping tale unfolds in the United States of America, as produced by Gale Anne Hurd for Columbia Pictures Corporation. Released on April 29, 1994, "No Escape" garnered an average rating of 6.1 and grossed $15.3 million at the box office against a $20 million budget.

title = Ong-Bak: The Thai Warrior 
overview = When the head of a statue sacred to a village is stolen, a young martial artist goes to the big city and finds himself taking on the underworld to retrieve it. 
Director = Prachya Pinkaew 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Prachya Pinkaew 

In "Ong-Bak: The Thai Warrior," directed by Prachya Pinkaew, a young martial artist ventures into the big city to retrieve the stolen head of a sacred village statue. As he navigates the urban underworld, he must use his exceptional fighting skills to confront formidable foes and reclaim the treasured artifact. The movie follows the protagonist's journey as he showcases traditional Muay Thai techniques in intense and thrilling fight scenes.

In "Ong-Bak: The Thai Warrior," directed by Prachya Pinkaew, a young martial artist ventures into the big city to retrieve the stolen head of a sacred village statue. As he navigates the urban underworld, he must use his exceptional fighting skills to confront formidable foes and reclaim the treasured artifact. The movie follows the protagonist's journey as he showcases traditional Muay Thai techniques in intense and thrilling fight scenes.

title = Cinderella III: A Twist in Time 
overview = The evil stepmother conjures up a spell that reverses all that the fairy godmother had done. Everything that she made (the dress, the horses and the carriage) which was how Cinderella went to "The Ball". So when all the magic is gone will there be a happily ever after all? What will Cinderella do? Find out in Cinderella III. 
tagline = What if the slipper didn't fit? 
Director = Frank Nissen 
original language of the movie = English 
average note = 6.0 
revenue = 206.5 millions of dollars

fact : tagline = What if the slipper didn't fit? 

In "Cinderella III: A Twist in Time," directed by Frank Nissen, the classic fairy tale takes a thrilling turn when the evil stepmother manages to reverse all the magic done by the fairy godmother. The enchanting dress, the majestic horses, and the magical carriage that helped Cinderella attend "The Ball" are all undone by a powerful spell. With everything she holds dear disappearing, including her chance at happiness, Cinderella faces a dilemma - will she still find her happily ever after? Starring Jennifer Hale, Susanne Blakeslee, Tress MacNeille, and Christopher Daniel Barnes, this English-language film from DisneyToon Studios captivates audiences with its unique twist on a beloved story. With an average rating of 6.0, "Cinderella III: A Twist in Time" enchanted viewers worldwide, earning a staggering revenue of 206.5 million dollars. As the clock ticks and the stakes rise, Cinderella must navigate a world without magic and discover if true love can prevail. What if the slipper didn't fit? Find out in this captivating tale of love, loss, and the enduring spirit of Cinderella. The movie has a duration of 1 hour and 14 minutes. The budget for the film was 8.0 million dollars. The production company behind the movie is DisneyToon Studios. The producer of the film is Margot Pipkin. The movie was produced in the United States of America.

title = Footloose 
overview = Ren MacCormack is transplanted from Boston to the small southern town of Bomont where loud music and dancing are prohibited. Not one to bow to the status quo, Ren challenges the ban, revitalizing the town and falling in love with the minister’s troubled daughter Ariel in the process. 
date of release = the 6 of October 2011 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 6 of October 2011 

In the 2011 film "Footloose," Ren MacCormack finds himself uprooted from Boston to the conservative southern town of Bomont, where dancing and loud music are strictly forbidden. Determined to shake things up, Ren takes on the town's ban, sparking a cultural revolution and forming a deep connection with the minister's rebellious daughter, Ariel. As their romance blossoms, Ren's defiance breathes new life into Bomont, challenging its residents to embrace change and self-expression. Released on the 6th of October 2011, "Footloose" is a heartwarming tale of love, rebellion, and the power of breaking free from societal constraints.

['correct!']

title = Live Flesh 
overview = A scorned ex-convict forces himself into the lives of the couple who put him behind bars. 
budget = 121.7 millions of dollars 
Director = Pedro Almodóvar 
revenue = 1.5 millions of dollars 
average note = 7.2 
cast = Liberto Rabal, Francesca Neri, Javier Bardem, Penélope Cruz 
date of release = the 28 of October 1997 
tagline = Life, love, desire... and everything in between. 
duration of the movie = 1h43 
original language of the movie = Spanish 
production countrie = France 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : budget = 121.7 millions of dollars 

In the gripping drama "Live Flesh," directed by Pedro Almodóvar, a scorned ex-convict played by Liberto Rabal, seeks revenge by intertwining himself into the lives of the couple, portrayed by Francesca Neri and Javier Bardem, who were responsible for his imprisonment. The alluring Penélope Cruz also stars in this tale of life, love, and desire set in France. With a budget of 121.7 million dollars, the film was released on the 28th of October 1997, captivating audiences with its intense storyline and captivating performances. Despite its modest revenue of 1.5 million dollars, "Live Flesh" received an average rating of 7.2, proving to be a compelling cinematic experience that delves into the complexities of human emotions. The movie has a duration of 1h43 and is in the original Spanish language. The production country of "Live Flesh" is France.

The alluring Penélope Cruz also stars in this tale of life, love, and desire set in France. With a budget of 121.7 million dollars, the film was released on the 28th of October 1997, captivating audiences with its intense storyline and captivating performances. Despite its modest revenue of 1.5 million dollars, "Live Flesh" received an average rating of 7.2, proving to be a compelling cinematic experience that delves into the complexities of human emotions. title = Xtro 
overview = Tony's father Sam, abducted by aliens three years earlier, returns to earth and seeks out his wife and son, but Rachel has since been living with Joe and the reunion is awkward. Joe doesn't trust Sam, and Rachel can't quite decide what her feelings are for her two men. Sam is not the same as when he left, and he begins affecting Tony in frightening ways. 
Director = Harry Bromley Davenport 
duration of the movie = 1h23 
production compagnie = Amalgamated Film Enterprises 
average note = 5.4 
production countrie = United Kingdom 
tagline = Some extra-terrestrials aren't friendly. 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Director = Harry Bromley Davenport 

In the sci-fi horror film "Xtro," directed by Harry Bromley Davenport, audiences are taken on a thrilling journey as Tony's father, Sam, mysteriously reappears on Earth after being abducted by aliens. The reunion with his wife, Rachel, and son, Tony, is far from joyous as Sam's return brings about a series of unsettling events. Living with another man, Joe, Rachel finds herself torn between her past and present relationships. As Sam's behavior becomes increasingly erratic, Tony begins to exhibit disturbing changes as well. Set in the United Kingdom and produced by Amalgamated Film Enterprises, "Xtro" has a duration of 1h23 and explores the dark and sinister side of extraterrestrial encounters. With an average rating of 5.4, this film's tagline warns viewers that "Some extra-terrestrials aren't friendly."

revenue = 21.1 millions of dollars

As the suspenseful plot unfolds, the movie captivates audiences with its intriguing premise and unexpected twists. title = Secrets of the Tribe 
overview = What happens when western anthropologists descend on the Amazon and make one of the last unacculturated tribes in existence, the Yanomami, the most exhaustively filmed and studied tribe on the planet? Despite their "do no harm" creed and scientific aims, the small army of anthropologists that has studied the Yanomami since the 1960s has wreaked havoc among the tribe - and sparked a war within the anthropology community itself. 
Producer = Mike Chamberlain 
original language of the movie = English 
tagline = A behind-the-scenes look at a scientific community torn apart by infighting. 
revenue = 53.0 millions of dollars 
budget = 269.2 millions of dollars 
date of release = the 22 of January 2010 
production countrie = Brazil 
Director = José Padilha 
duration of the movie = 1h38 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Mike Chamberlain 

In "Secrets of the Tribe," directed by José Padilha, the audience is taken on a gripping journey into the Amazon where western anthropologists encounter the Yanomami tribe, one of the last unacculturated tribes on Earth. As the most exhaustively filmed and studied tribe, the Yanomami's way of life is put under the microscope by a group of scientists led by producer Mike Chamberlain. Despite their initial "do no harm" creed, the anthropologists inadvertently disrupt the tribe's existence, leading to chaos within both the Yanomami community and the anthropology world. With a tagline promising a behind-the-scenes look at a scientific community torn apart by infighting, this thought-provoking film delves into the consequences of invasive study and the clash of cultures. Released on the 22nd of January 2010 in Brazil, "Secrets of the Tribe" runs for 1 hour and 38 minutes, earning a revenue of 53.0 million dollars against a budget of 269.2 million dollars.

['correct']

Despite their initial "do no harm" creed, the anthropologists inadvertently disrupt the tribe's existence, leading to chaos within both the Yanomami community and the anthropology world. With a tagline promising a behind-the-scenes look at a scientific community torn apart by infighting, this thought-provoking film delves into the consequences of invasive study and the clash of cultures. Released on the 22nd of January 2010 in Brazil, "Secrets of the Tribe" runs for 1 hour and 38 minutes, earning a revenue of 53.0 million dollars against a budget of 269.2 million dollars. 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : production countrie = Brazil 

In "Secrets of the Tribe," directed by José Padilha, the audience is taken on a gripping journey into the Amazon where western anthropologists encounter the Yanomami tribe, one of the last unacculturated tribes on Earth. As the most exhaustively filmed and studied tribe, the Yanomami's way of life is put under the microscope by a group of scientists led by producer Mike Chamberlain. Despite their initial "do no harm" creed, the anthropologists inadvertently disrupt the tribe's existence, leading to chaos within both the Yanomami community and the anthropology world. With a tagline promising a behind-the-scenes look at a scientific community torn apart by infighting, this thought-provoking film delves into the consequences of invasive study and the clash of cultures. Released on the 22nd of January 2010 in Brazil, "Secrets of the Tribe" runs for 1 hour and 38 minutes, earning a revenue of 53.0 million dollars against a budget of 269.2 million dollars.

title = Marjoe 
overview = Part documentary, part expose, this film follows one-time child evangelist Marjoe Gortner on the "church tent" Revivalist circuit, commenting on the showmanship of Evangelism and "the religion business", prior to the start of "televangelism". 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : revenue = 249.8 millions of dollars 

In the captivating film "Marjoe", viewers are taken on a journey through the intriguing world of Evangelism with one-time child evangelist Marjoe Gortner. This unique documentary-expose hybrid delves into the behind-the-scenes of the church tent Revivalist circuit, shedding light on the showmanship and intricacies of the religion business. As we witness Marjoe navigate through this world, we are given a glimpse into the era before the rise of televangelism, making this film a fascinating exploration of faith, performance, and the complexities of the Evangelical movement. Part documentary, part expose, this film follows one-time child evangelist Marjoe Gortner on the "church tent" Revivalist circuit, commenting on the showmanship of Evangelism and "the religion business", prior to the start of "televangelism".

title = The Woman in Black 2: Angel of Death 
overview = 40 years after the first haunting at Eel Marsh House, a group of children evacuated from WWII London arrive, awakening the house's darkest inhabitant. 

TN  -  TrueNegative
['wrong']
fact : revenue = 26.5 millions of dollars 

In "The Woman in Black 2: Angel of Death," the chilling tale continues 40 years after the initial haunting at Eel Marsh House. This time, a group of children evacuated from WWII London seek refuge at the ominous residence, unknowingly stirring up the house's darkest inhabitant. As the children navigate the eerie corridors and shadowy rooms, they must confront the malevolent force that lurks within, threatening their very existence. Will they uncover the truth behind the haunting before it's too late, or will they fall victim to the vengeful spirit that haunts the house?

title = The Island at the Top of the World 
overview = A Victorian gentleman hopes to find his long-lost son, who vanished whilst searching for a mysterious Viking community in a volcanic valley somewhere in uncharted Arctic regions. The gentleman puts together an expedition team to go on the search, but when they reach their destination they must escape from some Viking descendants who will kill to keep their existence a secret. 
original language of the movie = English 
date of release = the 1 of January 1974 
budget = 186.3 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Walt Disney Productions 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : original language of the movie = English 

In the 1974 English-language film "The Island at the Top of the World," a Victorian gentleman embarks on a perilous journey to locate his missing son, who disappeared while exploring a hidden Viking community nestled in a volcanic valley in the uncharted Arctic. Determined to uncover the truth, the gentleman assembles an expedition team to assist him in his quest. However, upon reaching their destination, they find themselves in a deadly struggle for survival against the descendants of the Vikings, who will stop at nothing to protect their secluded existence. Produced by Walt Disney Productions with a budget of 186.3 million dollars, this thrilling adventure transports viewers to a world where ancient secrets and modern ambitions collide in a battle for discovery and survival. The movie was released on the 1st of January 1974.

title = The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 
overview = Four best friends (Tibby, Lena, Carmen &amp; Bridget) who buy a mysterious pair of pants that fits each of them, despite their differing sizes, and makes whoever wears them feel fabulous. When faced with the prospect of spending their first summer apart, the pals decide they'll swap the pants so that each girl in turn can enjoy the magic. 
date of release = the 1 of June 2005 
average note = 6.3 
Producer = Denise Di Novi 
tagline = Laugh. Cry. Share the pants. 
budget = 25.0 millions of dollars 
revenue = 39.1 millions of dollars 
Director = Ken Kwapis 
original language of the movie = English 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : date of release = the 1 of June 2005 

In the heartwarming film "The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants," director Ken Kwapis brings to life the story of four best friends - Tibby, Lena, Carmen, and Bridget. These inseparable pals stumble upon a magical pair of pants that mysteriously fits each of them perfectly, regardless of their different sizes. The pants have a transformative effect, making whoever wears them feel absolutely fabulous. As the friends face the daunting reality of spending their first summer apart, they come up with a unique plan - to share the pants. With each girl taking turns wearing the enchanted garment, they embark on a journey of self-discovery, love, and friendship. Released on the 1st of June 2005, this heartwarming tale produced by Denise Di Novi invites viewers to "Laugh. Cry. Share the pants." Despite its modest budget of 25.0 million dollars, the film went on to earn a revenue of 39.1 million dollars. With an average rating of 6.3, this English-language movie is a touching reminder of the power of friendship and the magic of shared experiences.

title = In Pursuit of Honor 
overview = To save a group of horses slated to be destroyed by the US Cavalry, a group of officers rebel and begin a journey towards Canada to save themselves and the mounts. 
tagline = As soldiers they were taught to fight for honor. As men they were willing to die for it. 
Producer = Anne Hopkins 
cast = Don Johnson, Gabrielle Anwar, Craig Sheffer, Rod Steiger 
duration of the movie = 1h51 
budget = 120.3 millions of dollars 
production compagnie = Home Box Office (HBO) 
production countrie = United States of America 
Director = Ken Olin 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 83.4 millions of dollars 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct! the fact matches with the description, specifically the tagline "as soldiers they were taught to fight for honor. as men they were willing to die for it."']
fact : tagline = As soldiers they were taught to fight for honor. As men they were willing to die for it. 

"In Pursuit of Honor" is a gripping tale of sacrifice and bravery. When a group of officers, portrayed by Don Johnson, Gabrielle Anwar, Craig Sheffer, and Rod Steiger, learn that a herd of horses is to be destroyed by the US Cavalry, they make a bold decision to rebel. The officers embark on a dangerous journey towards Canada, not only to save the majestic animals but also to save themselves. Under the direction of Ken Olin and produced by Anne Hopkins for Home Box Office (HBO), this film showcases the true meaning of honor and loyalty. With a budget of 120.3 million dollars, the movie beautifully captures the struggles and triumphs of these courageous men. Despite facing insurmountable odds, they are willing to risk everything for what they believe in. "In Pursuit of Honor" reminds us that sometimes, the greatest battles are fought not with weapons, but with the strength of the human spirit.

Tagline: As soldiers they were taught to fight for honor. As men they were willing to die for it.

Duration of the movie: 1h51

Production company: Home Box Office (HBO)

Production country: United States of America

Director: Ken Olin

Original language of the movie: English

Revenue: 83.4 million dollars

Production country: United States of America

Director: Ken Olin

Original language of the movie: English

Revenue: 83.4 million dollars 
 
 
TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 1h51 

"In Pursuit of Honor" is a gripping tale of sacrifice and bravery. When a group of officers, portrayed by Don Johnson, Gabrielle Anwar, Craig Sheffer, and Rod Steiger, learn that a herd of horses is to be destroyed by the US Cavalry, they make a bold decision to rebel. The officers embark on a dangerous journey towards Canada, not only to save the majestic animals but also to save themselves. Under the direction of Ken Olin and produced by Anne Hopkins for Home Box Office (HBO), this film showcases the true meaning of honor and loyalty. With a budget of 120.3 million dollars, the movie beautifully captures the struggles and triumphs of these courageous men. Despite facing insurmountable odds, they are willing to risk everything for what they believe in. "In Pursuit of Honor" reminds us that sometimes, the greatest battles are fought not with weapons, but with the strength of the human spirit.

Tagline: As soldiers they were taught to fight for honor. As men they were willing to die for it.

title = Cheech & Chong's Next Movie 
overview = Perennially stoned Cheech and Chong tear through the city of Los Angeles, causing trouble wherever they go. After Cheech loses his job, the two pot enthusiasts head to the welfare offices where Cheech's girlfriend, Donna, works. Instead of collecting unemployment, they find themselves thrown back on the streets, searching for a way to earn new income. But when Cheech's cousin, "Red" Mendoza, arrives, things get even crazier. 
revenue = 41.7 millions of dollars 
Director = Tommy Chong 
average note = 6.5 
production countrie = United States of America 
original language of the movie = English 
production compagnie = Universal Pictures 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : revenue = 41.7 millions of dollars 

In "Cheech & Chong's Next Movie," directed by Tommy Chong, perennially stoned duo Cheech and Chong navigate the streets of Los Angeles, leaving chaos in their wake. When Cheech loses his job, they venture to the welfare office where Cheech's girlfriend, Donna, works. Instead of finding a solution, they end up back on the streets, desperate for income. The arrival of Cheech's cousin, "Red" Mendoza, only adds to the madness. With an average rating of 6.5, this comedy film, produced by Universal Pictures in the United States of America and grossing $41.7 million, is a wild ride filled with humor and hijinks.

title = Padosan 
overview = Bhola (Sunil Dutt) falls in love with his new neighbor Bindu (Saira Banu) and tries to woo her with his singing abilities.  Only problem is Bhola is an awful singer and so he takes help from his actor friends and creates an elaborate ruse to woo Bindu.  Padosan is an iconic movie of Hindi Cinema and a must-watch. 
duration of the movie = 2h37 
production compagnie = Mehmood Productions 
Director = Jyoti Swaroop 
average note = 6.4 
date of release = the 29 of November 1968 
production countrie = India 
budget = 183.4 millions of dollars 
cast = Sunil Dutt, Saira Banu, Mehmood, Kishore Kumar 
original language of the movie = Hindi 
Producer = Mehmood 

TP  -  TruePositive
['correct']
fact : duration of the movie = 2h37 

In the iconic Hindi movie "Padosan," Bhola (Sunil Dutt) finds himself head over heels for his new neighbor Bindu (Saira Banu). Despite his terrible singing skills, Bhola enlists the help of his actor friends to concoct a plan to impress Bindu with his musical talents. Directed by Jyoti Swaroop and produced by Mehmood Productions, this must-watch film showcases the lengths one man will go to win the heart of his beloved. With a runtime of 2 hours and 37 minutes, "Padosan" was released on November 29, 1968, in India. Starring Sunil Dutt, Saira Banu, Mehmood, and Kishore Kumar, this comedy classic received an average rating of 6.4. The movie was made with a budget of 183.4 million dollars and is presented in its original language, Hindi. Don't miss the laughter and love in this timeless Bollywood gem!

['correct']

The movie was made with a budget of 183.4 million dollars and is presented in its original language, Hindi. Don't miss the laughter and love in this timeless Bollywood gem!

In the iconic Hindi movie "Padosan," Bhola (Sunil Dutt) finds himself head over heels for his new neighbor Bindu (Saira Banu). Despite his terrible singing skills, Bhola enlists the help of his actor friends to concoct a plan to impress Bindu with his musical talents. Directed by Jyoti Swaroop and produced by Mehmood Productions, this must-watch film showcases the lengths one man will go to win the heart of his beloved. With a runtime of 2 hours and 37 minutes, "Padosan" was released on November 29, 1968, in India. title = The Pelican Brief 
overview = Two Supreme Court Justices have been assassinated. One lone law student has stumbled upon the truth. An investigative journalist wants her story. Everybody else wants her dead. 

FP  -  FalsePositive
['correct']
fact : Producer = Pieter Jan Brugge 

In "The Pelican Brief," the stakes are high as two Supreme Court Justices are brutally assassinated, sending shockwaves through the nation. Amidst the chaos, a determined law student unexpectedly uncovers the dangerous truth behind the killings. With the clock ticking, an intrepid investigative journalist sees an opportunity for a groundbreaking story, but they soon realize they are not the only ones interested in the student's findings. As the student becomes a target for those who will stop at nothing to keep the truth hidden, a thrilling game of cat and mouse ensues, where survival is the ultimate prize. The law student must race against time to reveal the shocking conspiracy before it's too late.

title = The Black Hole 
overview = The explorer craft U.S.S. Palomino is returning to Earth after a fruitless 18-month search for extra-terrestrial life when the crew comes upon a supposedly lost ship, the magnificent U.S.S. Cygnus, hovering near a black hole. The ship is controlled by Dr. Hans Reinhardt and his monstrous robot companion, Maximillian. But the initial wonderment and awe the Palomino crew feel for the ship and its resistance to the power of the black hole turn to horror as they uncover Reinhardt's plans.

His mundane existence is completely transformed when he encounters a vibrant group of young and attractive tourists, leading to a passionate romance with Anna, a 19-year-old enchantress. The film was produced in Germany.

title = Heartbreak Hotel 
overview = When a teen tries to set up a band at his school, his mother who was a big fan of Elvis Presley gets in a wreck he and his band members decides to kidnap Elvis and have him hooked up with his mother. 
Director = Chris Columbus 
original language of the movie = English 
revenue = 88.9 millions of dollars 

FN  -  FalseNegative
['wrong']
fact : Director = Chris Columbus 

In the heartwarming film "Heartbreak Hotel," directed by Chris Columbus, a teenage boy's attempt to start a band at his school takes a wild turn when his mother, a devoted Elvis Presley fan, is involved in a car accident. Determined to lift her spirits, the boy and his bandmates hatch a daring plan to kidnap the legendary singer and reunite him with his mother. Set against a backdrop of musical passion and teenage dreams, this English-language movie grossed an impressive $88.9 million at the box office.

In the heartwarming film "Heartbreak Hotel," directed by Chris Columbus, a teenage boy's attempt to start a band at his school takes a wild turn when his mother, a devoted Elvis Presley fan, is involved in a car accident. Determined to lift her spirits, the boy and his bandmates hatch a daring plan to kidnap the legendary singer and reunite him with his mother. Set against a backdrop of musical passion and teenage dreams, this English-language movie grossed an impressive $88.9 million at the box office.

['wrong']
fact : tagline = A rock and roll fantasy. 

In the heartwarming film "Heartbreak Hotel," directed by Chris Columbus, a teenage boy's attempt to start a band at his school takes a wild turn when his mother, a devoted Elvis Presley fan, is involved in a car accident. Determined to lift her spirits, the boy and his bandmates hatch a daring plan to kidnap the legendary singer and reunite him with his mother. Set against a backdrop of musical passion and teenage dreams, this English-language movie grossed an impressive $88.9 million at the box office.
